1 (function(root) {
  2   root.AV = root.AV || {};
  3   root.AV.VERSION = "js0.5.2";
  4 }(this));
  5 
  6 //     Underscore.js 1.4.4
  7 //     http://underscorejs.org
  8 //     (c) 2009-2013 Jeremy Ashkenas, DocumentCloud Inc.
  9 //     Underscore may be freely distributed under the MIT license.
 10 
 11 (function() {
 12 
 13   // Baseline setup
 14   // --------------
 15 
 16   // Establish the root object, `window` in the browser, or `global` on the server.
 17   var root = this;
 18 
 19   // Save the previous value of the `_` variable.
 20   var previousUnderscore = root._;
 21 
 22   // Establish the object that gets returned to break out of a loop iteration.
 23   var breaker = {};
 24 
 25   // Save bytes in the minified (but not gzipped) version:
 26   var ArrayProto = Array.prototype, ObjProto = Object.prototype, FuncProto = Function.prototype;
 27 
 28   // Create quick reference variables for speed access to core prototypes.
 29   var push             = ArrayProto.push,
 30       slice            = ArrayProto.slice,
 31       concat           = ArrayProto.concat,
 32       toString         = ObjProto.toString,
 33       hasOwnProperty   = ObjProto.hasOwnProperty;
 34 
 35   // All **ECMAScript 5** native function implementations that we hope to use
 36   // are declared here.
 37   var
 38     nativeForEach      = ArrayProto.forEach,
 39     nativeMap          = ArrayProto.map,
 40     nativeReduce       = ArrayProto.reduce,
 41     nativeReduceRight  = ArrayProto.reduceRight,
 42     nativeFilter       = ArrayProto.filter,
 43     nativeEvery        = ArrayProto.every,
 44     nativeSome         = ArrayProto.some,
 45     nativeIndexOf      = ArrayProto.indexOf,
 46     nativeLastIndexOf  = ArrayProto.lastIndexOf,
 47     nativeIsArray      = Array.isArray,
 48     nativeKeys         = Object.keys,
 49     nativeBind         = FuncProto.bind;
 50 
 51   // Create a safe reference to the Underscore object for use below.
 52   var _ = function(obj) {
 53     if (obj instanceof _) return obj;
 54     if (!(this instanceof _)) return new _(obj);
 55     this._wrapped = obj;
 56   };
 57 
 58   // Export the Underscore object for **Node.js**, with
 59   // backwards-compatibility for the old `require()` API. If we're in
 60   // the browser, add `_` as a global object via a string identifier,
 61   // for Closure Compiler "advanced" mode.
 62   if (typeof exports !== 'undefined') {
 63     if (typeof module !== 'undefined' && module.exports) {
 64       exports = module.exports = _;
 65     }
 66     exports._ = _;
 67   } else {
 68     root._ = _;
 69   }
 70 
 71   // Current version.
 72   _.VERSION = '1.4.4';
 73 
 74   // Collection Functions
 75   // --------------------
 76 
 77   // The cornerstone, an `each` implementation, aka `forEach`.
 78   // Handles objects with the built-in `forEach`, arrays, and raw objects.
 79   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `forEach` if available.
 80   var each = _.each = _.forEach = function(obj, iterator, context) {
 81     if (obj == null) return;
 82     if (nativeForEach && obj.forEach === nativeForEach) {
 83       obj.forEach(iterator, context);
 84     } else if (obj.length === +obj.length) {
 85       for (var i = 0, l = obj.length; i < l; i++) {
 86         if (iterator.call(context, obj[i], i, obj) === breaker) return;
 87       }
 88     } else {
 89       for (var key in obj) {
 90         if (_.has(obj, key)) {
 91           if (iterator.call(context, obj[key], key, obj) === breaker) return;
 92         }
 93       }
 94     }
 95   };
 96 
 97   // Return the results of applying the iterator to each element.
 98   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `map` if available.
 99   _.map = _.collect = function(obj, iterator, context) {
100     var results = [];
101     if (obj == null) return results;
102     if (nativeMap && obj.map === nativeMap) return obj.map(iterator, context);
103     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
104       results[results.length] = iterator.call(context, value, index, list);
105     });
106     return results;
107   };
108 
109   var reduceError = 'Reduce of empty array with no initial value';
110 
111   // **Reduce** builds up a single result from a list of values, aka `inject`,
112   // or `foldl`. Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `reduce` if available.
113   _.reduce = _.foldl = _.inject = function(obj, iterator, memo, context) {
114     var initial = arguments.length > 2;
115     if (obj == null) obj = [];
116     if (nativeReduce && obj.reduce === nativeReduce) {
117       if (context) iterator = _.bind(iterator, context);
118       return initial ? obj.reduce(iterator, memo) : obj.reduce(iterator);
119     }
120     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
121       if (!initial) {
122         memo = value;
123         initial = true;
124       } else {
125         memo = iterator.call(context, memo, value, index, list);
126       }
127     });
128     if (!initial) throw new TypeError(reduceError);
129     return memo;
130   };
131 
132   // The right-associative version of reduce, also known as `foldr`.
133   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `reduceRight` if available.
134   _.reduceRight = _.foldr = function(obj, iterator, memo, context) {
135     var initial = arguments.length > 2;
136     if (obj == null) obj = [];
137     if (nativeReduceRight && obj.reduceRight === nativeReduceRight) {
138       if (context) iterator = _.bind(iterator, context);
139       return initial ? obj.reduceRight(iterator, memo) : obj.reduceRight(iterator);
140     }
141     var length = obj.length;
142     if (length !== +length) {
143       var keys = _.keys(obj);
144       length = keys.length;
145     }
146     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
147       index = keys ? keys[--length] : --length;
148       if (!initial) {
149         memo = obj[index];
150         initial = true;
151       } else {
152         memo = iterator.call(context, memo, obj[index], index, list);
153       }
154     });
155     if (!initial) throw new TypeError(reduceError);
156     return memo;
157   };
158 
159   // Return the first value which passes a truth test. Aliased as `detect`.
160   _.find = _.detect = function(obj, iterator, context) {
161     var result;
162     any(obj, function(value, index, list) {
163       if (iterator.call(context, value, index, list)) {
164         result = value;
165         return true;
166       }
167     });
168     return result;
169   };
170 
171   // Return all the elements that pass a truth test.
172   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `filter` if available.
173   // Aliased as `select`.
174   _.filter = _.select = function(obj, iterator, context) {
175     var results = [];
176     if (obj == null) return results;
177     if (nativeFilter && obj.filter === nativeFilter) return obj.filter(iterator, context);
178     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
179       if (iterator.call(context, value, index, list)) results[results.length] = value;
180     });
181     return results;
182   };
183 
184   // Return all the elements for which a truth test fails.
185   _.reject = function(obj, iterator, context) {
186     return _.filter(obj, function(value, index, list) {
187       return !iterator.call(context, value, index, list);
188     }, context);
189   };
190 
191   // Determine whether all of the elements match a truth test.
192   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `every` if available.
193   // Aliased as `all`.
194   _.every = _.all = function(obj, iterator, context) {
195     iterator || (iterator = _.identity);
196     var result = true;
197     if (obj == null) return result;
198     if (nativeEvery && obj.every === nativeEvery) return obj.every(iterator, context);
199     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
200       if (!(result = result && iterator.call(context, value, index, list))) return breaker;
201     });
202     return !!result;
203   };
204 
205   // Determine if at least one element in the object matches a truth test.
206   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `some` if available.
207   // Aliased as `any`.
208   var any = _.some = _.any = function(obj, iterator, context) {
209     iterator || (iterator = _.identity);
210     var result = false;
211     if (obj == null) return result;
212     if (nativeSome && obj.some === nativeSome) return obj.some(iterator, context);
213     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
214       if (result || (result = iterator.call(context, value, index, list))) return breaker;
215     });
216     return !!result;
217   };
218 
219   // Determine if the array or object contains a given value (using `===`).
220   // Aliased as `include`.
221   _.contains = _.include = function(obj, target) {
222     if (obj == null) return false;
223     if (nativeIndexOf && obj.indexOf === nativeIndexOf) return obj.indexOf(target) != -1;
224     return any(obj, function(value) {
225       return value === target;
226     });
227   };
228 
229   // Invoke a method (with arguments) on every item in a collection.
230   _.invoke = function(obj, method) {
231     var args = slice.call(arguments, 2);
232     var isFunc = _.isFunction(method);
233     return _.map(obj, function(value) {
234       return (isFunc ? method : value[method]).apply(value, args);
235     });
236   };
237 
238   // Convenience version of a common use case of `map`: fetching a property.
239   _.pluck = function(obj, key) {
240     return _.map(obj, function(value){ return value[key]; });
241   };
242 
243   // Convenience version of a common use case of `filter`: selecting only objects
244   // containing specific `key:value` pairs.
245   _.where = function(obj, attrs, first) {
246     if (_.isEmpty(attrs)) return first ? null : [];
247     return _[first ? 'find' : 'filter'](obj, function(value) {
248       for (var key in attrs) {
249         if (attrs[key] !== value[key]) return false;
250       }
251       return true;
252     });
253   };
254 
255   // Convenience version of a common use case of `find`: getting the first object
256   // containing specific `key:value` pairs.
257   _.findWhere = function(obj, attrs) {
258     return _.where(obj, attrs, true);
259   };
260 
261   // Return the maximum element or (element-based computation).
262   // Can't optimize arrays of integers longer than 65,535 elements.
263   // See: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=80797
264   _.max = function(obj, iterator, context) {
265     if (!iterator && _.isArray(obj) && obj[0] === +obj[0] && obj.length < 65535) {
266       return Math.max.apply(Math, obj);
267     }
268     if (!iterator && _.isEmpty(obj)) return -Infinity;
269     var result = {computed : -Infinity, value: -Infinity};
270     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
271       var computed = iterator ? iterator.call(context, value, index, list) : value;
272       computed >= result.computed && (result = {value : value, computed : computed});
273     });
274     return result.value;
275   };
276 
277   // Return the minimum element (or element-based computation).
278   _.min = function(obj, iterator, context) {
279     if (!iterator && _.isArray(obj) && obj[0] === +obj[0] && obj.length < 65535) {
280       return Math.min.apply(Math, obj);
281     }
282     if (!iterator && _.isEmpty(obj)) return Infinity;
283     var result = {computed : Infinity, value: Infinity};
284     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
285       var computed = iterator ? iterator.call(context, value, index, list) : value;
286       computed < result.computed && (result = {value : value, computed : computed});
287     });
288     return result.value;
289   };
290 
291   // Shuffle an array.
292   _.shuffle = function(obj) {
293     var rand;
294     var index = 0;
295     var shuffled = [];
296     each(obj, function(value) {
297       rand = _.random(index++);
298       shuffled[index - 1] = shuffled[rand];
299       shuffled[rand] = value;
300     });
301     return shuffled;
302   };
303 
304   // An internal function to generate lookup iterators.
305   var lookupIterator = function(value) {
306     return _.isFunction(value) ? value : function(obj){ return obj[value]; };
307   };
308 
309   // Sort the object's values by a criterion produced by an iterator.
310   _.sortBy = function(obj, value, context) {
311     var iterator = lookupIterator(value);
312     return _.pluck(_.map(obj, function(value, index, list) {
313       return {
314         value : value,
315         index : index,
316         criteria : iterator.call(context, value, index, list)
317       };
318     }).sort(function(left, right) {
319       var a = left.criteria;
320       var b = right.criteria;
321       if (a !== b) {
322         if (a > b || a === void 0) return 1;
323         if (a < b || b === void 0) return -1;
324       }
325       return left.index < right.index ? -1 : 1;
326     }), 'value');
327   };
328 
329   // An internal function used for aggregate "group by" operations.
330   var group = function(obj, value, context, behavior) {
331     var result = {};
332     var iterator = lookupIterator(value || _.identity);
333     each(obj, function(value, index) {
334       var key = iterator.call(context, value, index, obj);
335       behavior(result, key, value);
336     });
337     return result;
338   };
339 
340   // Groups the object's values by a criterion. Pass either a string attribute
341   // to group by, or a function that returns the criterion.
342   _.groupBy = function(obj, value, context) {
343     return group(obj, value, context, function(result, key, value) {
344       (_.has(result, key) ? result[key] : (result[key] = [])).push(value);
345     });
346   };
347 
348   // Counts instances of an object that group by a certain criterion. Pass
349   // either a string attribute to count by, or a function that returns the
350   // criterion.
351   _.countBy = function(obj, value, context) {
352     return group(obj, value, context, function(result, key) {
353       if (!_.has(result, key)) result[key] = 0;
354       result[key]++;
355     });
356   };
357 
358   // Use a comparator function to figure out the smallest index at which
359   // an object should be inserted so as to maintain order. Uses binary search.
360   _.sortedIndex = function(array, obj, iterator, context) {
361     iterator = iterator == null ? _.identity : lookupIterator(iterator);
362     var value = iterator.call(context, obj);
363     var low = 0, high = array.length;
364     while (low < high) {
365       var mid = (low + high) >>> 1;
366       iterator.call(context, array[mid]) < value ? low = mid + 1 : high = mid;
367     }
368     return low;
369   };
370 
371   // Safely convert anything iterable into a real, live array.
372   _.toArray = function(obj) {
373     if (!obj) return [];
374     if (_.isArray(obj)) return slice.call(obj);
375     if (obj.length === +obj.length) return _.map(obj, _.identity);
376     return _.values(obj);
377   };
378 
379   // Return the number of elements in an object.
380   _.size = function(obj) {
381     if (obj == null) return 0;
382     return (obj.length === +obj.length) ? obj.length : _.keys(obj).length;
383   };
384 
385   // Array Functions
386   // ---------------
387 
388   // Get the first element of an array. Passing **n** will return the first N
389   // values in the array. Aliased as `head` and `take`. The **guard** check
390   // allows it to work with `_.map`.
391   _.first = _.head = _.take = function(array, n, guard) {
392     if (array == null) return void 0;
393     return (n != null) && !guard ? slice.call(array, 0, n) : array[0];
394   };
395 
396   // Returns everything but the last entry of the array. Especially useful on
397   // the arguments object. Passing **n** will return all the values in
398   // the array, excluding the last N. The **guard** check allows it to work with
399   // `_.map`.
400   _.initial = function(array, n, guard) {
401     return slice.call(array, 0, array.length - ((n == null) || guard ? 1 : n));
402   };
403 
404   // Get the last element of an array. Passing **n** will return the last N
405   // values in the array. The **guard** check allows it to work with `_.map`.
406   _.last = function(array, n, guard) {
407     if (array == null) return void 0;
408     if ((n != null) && !guard) {
409       return slice.call(array, Math.max(array.length - n, 0));
410     } else {
411       return array[array.length - 1];
412     }
413   };
414 
415   // Returns everything but the first entry of the array. Aliased as `tail` and `drop`.
416   // Especially useful on the arguments object. Passing an **n** will return
417   // the rest N values in the array. The **guard**
418   // check allows it to work with `_.map`.
419   _.rest = _.tail = _.drop = function(array, n, guard) {
420     return slice.call(array, (n == null) || guard ? 1 : n);
421   };
422 
423   // Trim out all falsy values from an array.
424   _.compact = function(array) {
425     return _.filter(array, _.identity);
426   };
427 
428   // Internal implementation of a recursive `flatten` function.
429   var flatten = function(input, shallow, output) {
430     each(input, function(value) {
431       if (_.isArray(value)) {
432         shallow ? push.apply(output, value) : flatten(value, shallow, output);
433       } else {
434         output.push(value);
435       }
436     });
437     return output;
438   };
439 
440   // Return a completely flattened version of an array.
441   _.flatten = function(array, shallow) {
442     return flatten(array, shallow, []);
443   };
444 
445   // Return a version of the array that does not contain the specified value(s).
446   _.without = function(array) {
447     return _.difference(array, slice.call(arguments, 1));
448   };
449 
450   // Produce a duplicate-free version of the array. If the array has already
451   // been sorted, you have the option of using a faster algorithm.
452   // Aliased as `unique`.
453   _.uniq = _.unique = function(array, isSorted, iterator, context) {
454     if (_.isFunction(isSorted)) {
455       context = iterator;
456       iterator = isSorted;
457       isSorted = false;
458     }
459     var initial = iterator ? _.map(array, iterator, context) : array;
460     var results = [];
461     var seen = [];
462     each(initial, function(value, index) {
463       if (isSorted ? (!index || seen[seen.length - 1] !== value) : !_.contains(seen, value)) {
464         seen.push(value);
465         results.push(array[index]);
466       }
467     });
468     return results;
469   };
470 
471   // Produce an array that contains the union: each distinct element from all of
472   // the passed-in arrays.
473   _.union = function() {
474     return _.uniq(concat.apply(ArrayProto, arguments));
475   };
476 
477   // Produce an array that contains every item shared between all the
478   // passed-in arrays.
479   _.intersection = function(array) {
480     var rest = slice.call(arguments, 1);
481     return _.filter(_.uniq(array), function(item) {
482       return _.every(rest, function(other) {
483         return _.indexOf(other, item) >= 0;
484       });
485     });
486   };
487 
488   // Take the difference between one array and a number of other arrays.
489   // Only the elements present in just the first array will remain.
490   _.difference = function(array) {
491     var rest = concat.apply(ArrayProto, slice.call(arguments, 1));
492     return _.filter(array, function(value){ return !_.contains(rest, value); });
493   };
494 
495   // Zip together multiple lists into a single array -- elements that share
496   // an index go together.
497   _.zip = function() {
498     var args = slice.call(arguments);
499     var length = _.max(_.pluck(args, 'length'));
500     var results = new Array(length);
501     for (var i = 0; i < length; i++) {
502       results[i] = _.pluck(args, "" + i);
503     }
504     return results;
505   };
506 
507   // Converts lists into objects. Pass either a single array of `[key, value]`
508   // pairs, or two parallel arrays of the same length -- one of keys, and one of
509   // the corresponding values.
510   _.object = function(list, values) {
511     if (list == null) return {};
512     var result = {};
513     for (var i = 0, l = list.length; i < l; i++) {
514       if (values) {
515         result[list[i]] = values[i];
516       } else {
517         result[list[i][0]] = list[i][1];
518       }
519     }
520     return result;
521   };
522 
523   // If the browser doesn't supply us with indexOf (I'm looking at you, **MSIE**),
524   // we need this function. Return the position of the first occurrence of an
525   // item in an array, or -1 if the item is not included in the array.
526   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `indexOf` if available.
527   // If the array is large and already in sort order, pass `true`
528   // for **isSorted** to use binary search.
529   _.indexOf = function(array, item, isSorted) {
530     if (array == null) return -1;
531     var i = 0, l = array.length;
532     if (isSorted) {
533       if (typeof isSorted == 'number') {
534         i = (isSorted < 0 ? Math.max(0, l + isSorted) : isSorted);
535       } else {
536         i = _.sortedIndex(array, item);
537         return array[i] === item ? i : -1;
538       }
539     }
540     if (nativeIndexOf && array.indexOf === nativeIndexOf) return array.indexOf(item, isSorted);
541     for (; i < l; i++) if (array[i] === item) return i;
542     return -1;
543   };
544 
545   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `lastIndexOf` if available.
546   _.lastIndexOf = function(array, item, from) {
547     if (array == null) return -1;
548     var hasIndex = from != null;
549     if (nativeLastIndexOf && array.lastIndexOf === nativeLastIndexOf) {
550       return hasIndex ? array.lastIndexOf(item, from) : array.lastIndexOf(item);
551     }
552     var i = (hasIndex ? from : array.length);
553     while (i--) if (array[i] === item) return i;
554     return -1;
555   };
556 
557   // Generate an integer Array containing an arithmetic progression. A port of
558   // the native Python `range()` function. See
559   // [the Python documentation](http://docs.python.org/library/functions.html#range).
560   _.range = function(start, stop, step) {
561     if (arguments.length <= 1) {
562       stop = start || 0;
563       start = 0;
564     }
565     step = arguments[2] || 1;
566 
567     var len = Math.max(Math.ceil((stop - start) / step), 0);
568     var idx = 0;
569     var range = new Array(len);
570 
571     while(idx < len) {
572       range[idx++] = start;
573       start += step;
574     }
575 
576     return range;
577   };
578 
579   // Function (ahem) Functions
580   // ------------------
581 
582   // Create a function bound to a given object (assigning `this`, and arguments,
583   // optionally). Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `Function.bind` if
584   // available.
585   _.bind = function(func, context) {
586     if (func.bind === nativeBind && nativeBind) return nativeBind.apply(func, slice.call(arguments, 1));
587     var args = slice.call(arguments, 2);
588     return function() {
589       return func.apply(context, args.concat(slice.call(arguments)));
590     };
591   };
592 
593   // Partially apply a function by creating a version that has had some of its
594   // arguments pre-filled, without changing its dynamic `this` context.
595   _.partial = function(func) {
596     var args = slice.call(arguments, 1);
597     return function() {
598       return func.apply(this, args.concat(slice.call(arguments)));
599     };
600   };
601 
602   // Bind all of an object's methods to that object. Useful for ensuring that
603   // all callbacks defined on an object belong to it.
604   _.bindAll = function(obj) {
605     var funcs = slice.call(arguments, 1);
606     if (funcs.length === 0) funcs = _.functions(obj);
607     each(funcs, function(f) { obj[f] = _.bind(obj[f], obj); });
608     return obj;
609   };
610 
611   // Memoize an expensive function by storing its results.
612   _.memoize = function(func, hasher) {
613     var memo = {};
614     hasher || (hasher = _.identity);
615     return function() {
616       var key = hasher.apply(this, arguments);
617       return _.has(memo, key) ? memo[key] : (memo[key] = func.apply(this, arguments));
618     };
619   };
620 
621   // Delays a function for the given number of milliseconds, and then calls
622   // it with the arguments supplied.
623   _.delay = function(func, wait) {
624     var args = slice.call(arguments, 2);
625     return setTimeout(function(){ return func.apply(null, args); }, wait);
626   };
627 
628   // Defers a function, scheduling it to run after the current call stack has
629   // cleared.
630   _.defer = function(func) {
631     return _.delay.apply(_, [func, 1].concat(slice.call(arguments, 1)));
632   };
633 
634   // Returns a function, that, when invoked, will only be triggered at most once
635   // during a given window of time.
636   _.throttle = function(func, wait) {
637     var context, args, timeout, result;
638     var previous = 0;
639     var later = function() {
640       previous = new Date;
641       timeout = null;
642       result = func.apply(context, args);
643     };
644     return function() {
645       var now = new Date;
646       var remaining = wait - (now - previous);
647       context = this;
648       args = arguments;
649       if (remaining <= 0) {
650         clearTimeout(timeout);
651         timeout = null;
652         previous = now;
653         result = func.apply(context, args);
654       } else if (!timeout) {
655         timeout = setTimeout(later, remaining);
656       }
657       return result;
658     };
659   };
660 
661   // Returns a function, that, as long as it continues to be invoked, will not
662   // be triggered. The function will be called after it stops being called for
663   // N milliseconds. If `immediate` is passed, trigger the function on the
664   // leading edge, instead of the trailing.
665   _.debounce = function(func, wait, immediate) {
666     var timeout, result;
667     return function() {
668       var context = this, args = arguments;
669       var later = function() {
670         timeout = null;
671         if (!immediate) result = func.apply(context, args);
672       };
673       var callNow = immediate && !timeout;
674       clearTimeout(timeout);
675       timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
676       if (callNow) result = func.apply(context, args);
677       return result;
678     };
679   };
680 
681   // Returns a function that will be executed at most one time, no matter how
682   // often you call it. Useful for lazy initialization.
683   _.once = function(func) {
684     var ran = false, memo;
685     return function() {
686       if (ran) return memo;
687       ran = true;
688       memo = func.apply(this, arguments);
689       func = null;
690       return memo;
691     };
692   };
693 
694   // Returns the first function passed as an argument to the second,
695   // allowing you to adjust arguments, run code before and after, and
696   // conditionally execute the original function.
697   _.wrap = function(func, wrapper) {
698     return function() {
699       var args = [func];
700       push.apply(args, arguments);
701       return wrapper.apply(this, args);
702     };
703   };
704 
705   // Returns a function that is the composition of a list of functions, each
706   // consuming the return value of the function that follows.
707   _.compose = function() {
708     var funcs = arguments;
709     return function() {
710       var args = arguments;
711       for (var i = funcs.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
712         args = [funcs[i].apply(this, args)];
713       }
714       return args[0];
715     };
716   };
717 
718   // Returns a function that will only be executed after being called N times.
719   _.after = function(times, func) {
720     if (times <= 0) return func();
721     return function() {
722       if (--times < 1) {
723         return func.apply(this, arguments);
724       }
725     };
726   };
727 
728   // Object Functions
729   // ----------------
730 
731   // Retrieve the names of an object's properties.
732   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `Object.keys`
733   _.keys = nativeKeys || function(obj) {
734     if (obj !== Object(obj)) throw new TypeError('Invalid object');
735     var keys = [];
736     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) keys[keys.length] = key;
737     return keys;
738   };
739 
740   // Retrieve the values of an object's properties.
741   _.values = function(obj) {
742     var values = [];
743     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) values.push(obj[key]);
744     return values;
745   };
746 
747   // Convert an object into a list of `[key, value]` pairs.
748   _.pairs = function(obj) {
749     var pairs = [];
750     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) pairs.push([key, obj[key]]);
751     return pairs;
752   };
753 
754   // Invert the keys and values of an object. The values must be serializable.
755   _.invert = function(obj) {
756     var result = {};
757     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) result[obj[key]] = key;
758     return result;
759   };
760 
761   // Return a sorted list of the function names available on the object.
762   // Aliased as `methods`
763   _.functions = _.methods = function(obj) {
764     var names = [];
765     for (var key in obj) {
766       if (_.isFunction(obj[key])) names.push(key);
767     }
768     return names.sort();
769   };
770 
771   // Extend a given object with all the properties in passed-in object(s).
772   _.extend = function(obj) {
773     each(slice.call(arguments, 1), function(source) {
774       if (source) {
775         for (var prop in source) {
776           obj[prop] = source[prop];
777         }
778       }
779     });
780     return obj;
781   };
782 
783   // Return a copy of the object only containing the whitelisted properties.
784   _.pick = function(obj) {
785     var copy = {};
786     var keys = concat.apply(ArrayProto, slice.call(arguments, 1));
787     each(keys, function(key) {
788       if (key in obj) copy[key] = obj[key];
789     });
790     return copy;
791   };
792 
793    // Return a copy of the object without the blacklisted properties.
794   _.omit = function(obj) {
795     var copy = {};
796     var keys = concat.apply(ArrayProto, slice.call(arguments, 1));
797     for (var key in obj) {
798       if (!_.contains(keys, key)) copy[key] = obj[key];
799     }
800     return copy;
801   };
802 
803   // Fill in a given object with default properties.
804   _.defaults = function(obj) {
805     each(slice.call(arguments, 1), function(source) {
806       if (source) {
807         for (var prop in source) {
808           if (obj[prop] == null) obj[prop] = source[prop];
809         }
810       }
811     });
812     return obj;
813   };
814 
815   // Create a (shallow-cloned) duplicate of an object.
816   _.clone = function(obj) {
817     if (!_.isObject(obj)) return obj;
818     return _.isArray(obj) ? obj.slice() : _.extend({}, obj);
819   };
820 
821   // Invokes interceptor with the obj, and then returns obj.
822   // The primary purpose of this method is to "tap into" a method chain, in
823   // order to perform operations on intermediate results within the chain.
824   _.tap = function(obj, interceptor) {
825     interceptor(obj);
826     return obj;
827   };
828 
829   // Internal recursive comparison function for `isEqual`.
830   var eq = function(a, b, aStack, bStack) {
831     // Identical objects are equal. `0 === -0`, but they aren't identical.
832     // See the Harmony `egal` proposal: http://wiki.ecmascript.org/doku.php?id=harmony:egal.
833     if (a === b) return a !== 0 || 1 / a == 1 / b;
834     // A strict comparison is necessary because `null == undefined`.
835     if (a == null || b == null) return a === b;
836     // Unwrap any wrapped objects.
837     if (a instanceof _) a = a._wrapped;
838     if (b instanceof _) b = b._wrapped;
839     // Compare `[[Class]]` names.
840     var className = toString.call(a);
841     if (className != toString.call(b)) return false;
842     switch (className) {
843       // Strings, numbers, dates, and booleans are compared by value.
844       case '[object String]':
845         // Primitives and their corresponding object wrappers are equivalent; thus, `"5"` is
846         // equivalent to `new String("5")`.
847         return a == String(b);
848       case '[object Number]':
849         // `NaN`s are equivalent, but non-reflexive. An `egal` comparison is performed for
850         // other numeric values.
851         return a != +a ? b != +b : (a == 0 ? 1 / a == 1 / b : a == +b);
852       case '[object Date]':
853       case '[object Boolean]':
854         // Coerce dates and booleans to numeric primitive values. Dates are compared by their
855         // millisecond representations. Note that invalid dates with millisecond representations
856         // of `NaN` are not equivalent.
857         return +a == +b;
858       // RegExps are compared by their source patterns and flags.
859       case '[object RegExp]':
860         return a.source == b.source &&
861                a.global == b.global &&
862                a.multiline == b.multiline &&
863                a.ignoreCase == b.ignoreCase;
864     }
865     if (typeof a != 'object' || typeof b != 'object') return false;
866     // Assume equality for cyclic structures. The algorithm for detecting cyclic
867     // structures is adapted from ES 5.1 section 15.12.3, abstract operation `JO`.
868     var length = aStack.length;
869     while (length--) {
870       // Linear search. Performance is inversely proportional to the number of
871       // unique nested structures.
872       if (aStack[length] == a) return bStack[length] == b;
873     }
874     // Add the first object to the stack of traversed objects.
875     aStack.push(a);
876     bStack.push(b);
877     var size = 0, result = true;
878     // Recursively compare objects and arrays.
879     if (className == '[object Array]') {
880       // Compare array lengths to determine if a deep comparison is necessary.
881       size = a.length;
882       result = size == b.length;
883       if (result) {
884         // Deep compare the contents, ignoring non-numeric properties.
885         while (size--) {
886           if (!(result = eq(a[size], b[size], aStack, bStack))) break;
887         }
888       }
889     } else {
890       // Objects with different constructors are not equivalent, but `Object`s
891       // from different frames are.
892       var aCtor = a.constructor, bCtor = b.constructor;
893       if (aCtor !== bCtor && !(_.isFunction(aCtor) && (aCtor instanceof aCtor) &&
894                                _.isFunction(bCtor) && (bCtor instanceof bCtor))) {
895         return false;
896       }
897       // Deep compare objects.
898       for (var key in a) {
899         if (_.has(a, key)) {
900           // Count the expected number of properties.
901           size++;
902           // Deep compare each member.
903           if (!(result = _.has(b, key) && eq(a[key], b[key], aStack, bStack))) break;
904         }
905       }
906       // Ensure that both objects contain the same number of properties.
907       if (result) {
908         for (key in b) {
909           if (_.has(b, key) && !(size--)) break;
910         }
911         result = !size;
912       }
913     }
914     // Remove the first object from the stack of traversed objects.
915     aStack.pop();
916     bStack.pop();
917     return result;
918   };
919 
920   // Perform a deep comparison to check if two objects are equal.
921   _.isEqual = function(a, b) {
922     return eq(a, b, [], []);
923   };
924 
925   // Is a given array, string, or object empty?
926   // An "empty" object has no enumerable own-properties.
927   _.isEmpty = function(obj) {
928     if (obj == null) return true;
929     if (_.isArray(obj) || _.isString(obj)) return obj.length === 0;
930     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) return false;
931     return true;
932   };
933 
934   // Is a given value a DOM element?
935   _.isElement = function(obj) {
936     return !!(obj && obj.nodeType === 1);
937   };
938 
939   // Is a given value an array?
940   // Delegates to ECMA5's native Array.isArray
941   _.isArray = nativeIsArray || function(obj) {
942     return toString.call(obj) == '[object Array]';
943   };
944 
945   // Is a given variable an object?
946   _.isObject = function(obj) {
947     return obj === Object(obj);
948   };
949 
950   // Add some isType methods: isArguments, isFunction, isString, isNumber, isDate, isRegExp.
951   each(['Arguments', 'Function', 'String', 'Number', 'Date', 'RegExp'], function(name) {
952     _['is' + name] = function(obj) {
953       return toString.call(obj) == '[object ' + name + ']';
954     };
955   });
956 
957   // Define a fallback version of the method in browsers (ahem, IE), where
958   // there isn't any inspectable "Arguments" type.
959   if (!_.isArguments(arguments)) {
960     _.isArguments = function(obj) {
961       return !!(obj && _.has(obj, 'callee'));
962     };
963   }
964 
965   // Optimize `isFunction` if appropriate.
966   if (typeof (/./) !== 'function') {
967     _.isFunction = function(obj) {
968       return typeof obj === 'function';
969     };
970   }
971 
972   // Is a given object a finite number?
973   _.isFinite = function(obj) {
974     return isFinite(obj) && !isNaN(parseFloat(obj));
975   };
976 
977   // Is the given value `NaN`? (NaN is the only number which does not equal itself).
978   _.isNaN = function(obj) {
979     return _.isNumber(obj) && obj != +obj;
980   };
981 
982   // Is a given value a boolean?
983   _.isBoolean = function(obj) {
984     return obj === true || obj === false || toString.call(obj) == '[object Boolean]';
985   };
986 
987   // Is a given value equal to null?
988   _.isNull = function(obj) {
989     return obj === null;
990   };
991 
992   // Is a given variable undefined?
993   _.isUndefined = function(obj) {
994     return obj === void 0;
995   };
996 
997   // Shortcut function for checking if an object has a given property directly
998   // on itself (in other words, not on a prototype).
999   _.has = function(obj, key) {
1000     return hasOwnProperty.call(obj, key);
1001   };
1002 
1003   // Utility Functions
1004   // -----------------
1005 
1006   // Run Underscore.js in *noConflict* mode, returning the `_` variable to its
1007   // previous owner. Returns a reference to the Underscore object.
1008   _.noConflict = function() {
1009     root._ = previousUnderscore;
1010     return this;
1011   };
1012 
1013   // Keep the identity function around for default iterators.
1014   _.identity = function(value) {
1015     return value;
1016   };
1017 
1018   // Run a function **n** times.
1019   _.times = function(n, iterator, context) {
1020     var accum = Array(n);
1021     for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) accum[i] = iterator.call(context, i);
1022     return accum;
1023   };
1024 
1025   // Return a random integer between min and max (inclusive).
1026   _.random = function(min, max) {
1027     if (max == null) {
1028       max = min;
1029       min = 0;
1030     }
1031     return min + Math.floor(Math.random() * (max - min + 1));
1032   };
1033 
1034   // List of HTML entities for escaping.
1035   var entityMap = {
1036     escape: {
1037       '&': '&',
1038       '<': '<',
1039       '>': '>',
1040       '"': '"',
1041       "'": ''',
1042       '/': '/'
1043     }
1044   };
1045   entityMap.unescape = _.invert(entityMap.escape);
1046 
1047   // Regexes containing the keys and values listed immediately above.
1048   var entityRegexes = {
1049     escape:   new RegExp('[' + _.keys(entityMap.escape).join('') + ']', 'g'),
1050     unescape: new RegExp('(' + _.keys(entityMap.unescape).join('|') + ')', 'g')
1051   };
1052 
1053   // Functions for escaping and unescaping strings to/from HTML interpolation.
1054   _.each(['escape', 'unescape'], function(method) {
1055     _[method] = function(string) {
1056       if (string == null) return '';
1057       return ('' + string).replace(entityRegexes[method], function(match) {
1058         return entityMap[method][match];
1059       });
1060     };
1061   });
1062 
1063   // If the value of the named property is a function then invoke it;
1064   // otherwise, return it.
1065   _.result = function(object, property) {
1066     if (object == null) return null;
1067     var value = object[property];
1068     return _.isFunction(value) ? value.call(object) : value;
1069   };
1070 
1071   // Add your own custom functions to the Underscore object.
1072   _.mixin = function(obj) {
1073     each(_.functions(obj), function(name){
1074       var func = _[name] = obj[name];
1075       _.prototype[name] = function() {
1076         var args = [this._wrapped];
1077         push.apply(args, arguments);
1078         return result.call(this, func.apply(_, args));
1079       };
1080     });
1081   };
1082 
1083   // Generate a unique integer id (unique within the entire client session).
1084   // Useful for temporary DOM ids.
1085   var idCounter = 0;
1086   _.uniqueId = function(prefix) {
1087     var id = ++idCounter + '';
1088     return prefix ? prefix + id : id;
1089   };
1090 
1091   // By default, Underscore uses ERB-style template delimiters, change the
1092   // following template settings to use alternative delimiters.
1093   _.templateSettings = {
1094     evaluate    : /<%([\s\S]+?)%>/g,
1095     interpolate : /<%=([\s\S]+?)%>/g,
1096     escape      : /<%-([\s\S]+?)%>/g
1097   };
1098 
1099   // When customizing `templateSettings`, if you don't want to define an
1100   // interpolation, evaluation or escaping regex, we need one that is
1101   // guaranteed not to match.
1102   var noMatch = /(.)^/;
1103 
1104   // Certain characters need to be escaped so that they can be put into a
1105   // string literal.
1106   var escapes = {
1107     "'":      "'",
1108     '\\':     '\\',
1109     '\r':     'r',
1110     '\n':     'n',
1111     '\t':     't',
1112     '\u2028': 'u2028',
1113     '\u2029': 'u2029'
1114   };
1115 
1116   var escaper = /\\|'|\r|\n|\t|\u2028|\u2029/g;
1117 
1118   // JavaScript micro-templating, similar to John Resig's implementation.
1119   // Underscore templating handles arbitrary delimiters, preserves whitespace,
1120   // and correctly escapes quotes within interpolated code.
1121   _.template = function(text, data, settings) {
1122     var render;
1123     settings = _.defaults({}, settings, _.templateSettings);
1124 
1125     // Combine delimiters into one regular expression via alternation.
1126     var matcher = new RegExp([
1127       (settings.escape || noMatch).source,
1128       (settings.interpolate || noMatch).source,
1129       (settings.evaluate || noMatch).source
1130     ].join('|') + '|$', 'g');
1131 
1132     // Compile the template source, escaping string literals appropriately.
1133     var index = 0;
1134     var source = "__p+='";
1135     text.replace(matcher, function(match, escape, interpolate, evaluate, offset) {
1136       source += text.slice(index, offset)
1137         .replace(escaper, function(match) { return '\\' + escapes[match]; });
1138 
1139       if (escape) {
1140         source += "'+\n((__t=(" + escape + "))==null?'':_.escape(__t))+\n'";
1141       }
1142       if (interpolate) {
1143         source += "'+\n((__t=(" + interpolate + "))==null?'':__t)+\n'";
1144       }
1145       if (evaluate) {
1146         source += "';\n" + evaluate + "\n__p+='";
1147       }
1148       index = offset + match.length;
1149       return match;
1150     });
1151     source += "';\n";
1152 
1153     // If a variable is not specified, place data values in local scope.
1154     if (!settings.variable) source = 'with(obj||{}){\n' + source + '}\n';
1155 
1156     source = "var __t,__p='',__j=Array.prototype.join," +
1157       "print=function(){__p+=__j.call(arguments,'');};\n" +
1158       source + "return __p;\n";
1159 
1160     try {
1161       render = new Function(settings.variable || 'obj', '_', source);
1162     } catch (e) {
1163       e.source = source;
1164       throw e;
1165     }
1166 
1167     if (data) return render(data, _);
1168     var template = function(data) {
1169       return render.call(this, data, _);
1170     };
1171 
1172     // Provide the compiled function source as a convenience for precompilation.
1173     template.source = 'function(' + (settings.variable || 'obj') + '){\n' + source + '}';
1174 
1175     return template;
1176   };
1177 
1178   // Add a "chain" function, which will delegate to the wrapper.
1179   _.chain = function(obj) {
1180     return _(obj).chain();
1181   };
1182 
1183   // OOP
1184   // ---------------
1185   // If Underscore is called as a function, it returns a wrapped object that
1186   // can be used OO-style. This wrapper holds altered versions of all the
1187   // underscore functions. Wrapped objects may be chained.
1188 
1189   // Helper function to continue chaining intermediate results.
1190   var result = function(obj) {
1191     return this._chain ? _(obj).chain() : obj;
1192   };
1193 
1194   // Add all of the Underscore functions to the wrapper object.
1195   _.mixin(_);
1196 
1197   // Add all mutator Array functions to the wrapper.
1198   each(['pop', 'push', 'reverse', 'shift', 'sort', 'splice', 'unshift'], function(name) {
1199     var method = ArrayProto[name];
1200     _.prototype[name] = function() {
1201       var obj = this._wrapped;
1202       method.apply(obj, arguments);
1203       if ((name == 'shift' || name == 'splice') && obj.length === 0) delete obj[0];
1204       return result.call(this, obj);
1205     };
1206   });
1207 
1208   // Add all accessor Array functions to the wrapper.
1209   each(['concat', 'join', 'slice'], function(name) {
1210     var method = ArrayProto[name];
1211     _.prototype[name] = function() {
1212       return result.call(this, method.apply(this._wrapped, arguments));
1213     };
1214   });
1215 
1216   _.extend(_.prototype, {
1217 
1218     // Start chaining a wrapped Underscore object.
1219     chain: function() {
1220       this._chain = true;
1221       return this;
1222     },
1223 
1224     // Extracts the result from a wrapped and chained object.
1225     value: function() {
1226       return this._wrapped;
1227     }
1228 
1229   });
1230 
1231 }).call(this);
1232 
1233 /*global _: false, $: false, localStorage: false, process: true,
1234   XMLHttpRequest: false, XDomainRequest: false, exports: false,
1235   require: false */
1236 (function(root) {
1237   root.AV = root.AV || {};
1238   /**
1239    * Contains all AV API classes and functions.
1240    * @name AV
1241    * @namespace
1242    *
1243    * Contains all AV API classes and functions.
1244    */
1245   var AV = root.AV;
1246 
1247   // Import XMLHttpRequest
1248   if (typeof(XMLHttpRequest) !== 'undefined') {
1249     AV.XMLHttpRequest = XMLHttpRequest;
1250   } else if (typeof(require) === 'function' && typeof(require.ensure) === 'undefined') {
1251     AV.XMLHttpRequest = require('xmlhttprequest').XMLHttpRequest;
1252   }
1253 
1254   // Import localStorage
1255   if (typeof(localStorage) !== 'undefined') {
1256     AV.localStorage= localStorage;
1257   } else if (typeof(require) === 'function' && typeof(require.ensure) === 'undefined') {
1258     try{
1259       AV.localStorage = require('localStorage');
1260     }catch(error){
1261       AV.localStorage = require('./localStorage.js').localStorage;
1262     }
1263   }
1264 
1265   // Import AV's local copy of underscore.
1266   if (typeof(exports) !== "undefined" && exports._) {
1267     // We're running in Node.js.  Pull in the dependencies.
1268     AV._ = exports._.noConflict();
1269     exports.AV = AV;
1270   } else {
1271     AV._ = _.noConflict();
1272   }
1273 
1274   // If jQuery or Zepto has been included, grab a reference to it.
1275   if (typeof($) !== "undefined") {
1276     AV.$ = $;
1277   }
1278 
1279   // Helpers
1280   // -------
1281 
1282   // Shared empty constructor function to aid in prototype-chain creation.
1283   var EmptyConstructor = function() {};
1284 
1285 
1286   // Helper function to correctly set up the prototype chain, for subclasses.
1287   // Similar to `goog.inherits`, but uses a hash of prototype properties and
1288   // class properties to be extended.
1289   var inherits = function(parent, protoProps, staticProps) {
1290     var child;
1291 
1292     // The constructor function for the new subclass is either defined by you
1293     // (the "constructor" property in your `extend` definition), or defaulted
1294     // by us to simply call the parent's constructor.
1295     if (protoProps && protoProps.hasOwnProperty('constructor')) {
1296       child = protoProps.constructor;
1297     } else {
1298       /** @ignore */
1299       child = function(){ parent.apply(this, arguments); };
1300     }
1301 
1302     // Inherit class (static) properties from parent.
1303     AV._.extend(child, parent);
1304 
1305     // Set the prototype chain to inherit from `parent`, without calling
1306     // `parent`'s constructor function.
1307     EmptyConstructor.prototype = parent.prototype;
1308     child.prototype = new EmptyConstructor();
1309 
1310     // Add prototype properties (instance properties) to the subclass,
1311     // if supplied.
1312     if (protoProps) {
1313       AV._.extend(child.prototype, protoProps);
1314     }
1315 
1316     // Add static properties to the constructor function, if supplied.
1317     if (staticProps) {
1318       AV._.extend(child, staticProps);
1319     }
1320 
1321     // Correctly set child's `prototype.constructor`.
1322     child.prototype.constructor = child;
1323 
1324     // Set a convenience property in case the parent's prototype is
1325     // needed later.
1326     child.__super__ = parent.prototype;
1327 
1328     return child;
1329   };
1330 
1331   // Set the server for AV to talk to.
1332   AV.serverURL = "https://cn.avoscloud.com";
1333 
1334   // Check whether we are running in Node.js.
1335   if (typeof(process) !== "undefined" &&
1336       process.versions &&
1337       process.versions.node) {
1338     AV._isNode = true;
1339   }
1340 
1341   /**
1342    * Call this method first to set up your authentication tokens for AV.
1343    * You can get your keys from the Data Browser on avoscloud.com.
1344    * @param {String} applicationId Your AV Application ID.
1345    * @param {String} applicationKey Your AV JavaScript Key.
1346    * @param {String} masterKey (optional) Your AVOSCloud Master Key. (Node.js only!).
1347    */
1348   AV.initialize = function(applicationId, applicationKey, masterKey) {
1349     if (masterKey) {
1350       throw "AV.initialize() was passed a Master Key, which is only " +
1351         "allowed from within Node.js.";
1352     }
1353     AV._initialize(applicationId, applicationKey,masterKey);
1354   };
1355 
1356   /**
1357    * Call this method first to set up authentication tokens for AV.
1358    * This method is for AV's own private use.
1359    * @param {String} applicationId Your AV Application ID.
1360    * @param {String} applicationKey Your AV Application Key
1361    */
1362    AV._initialize = function(applicationId, applicationKey, masterKey) {
1363     AV.applicationId = applicationId;
1364     AV.applicationKey = applicationKey;
1365     AV.masterKey = masterKey;
1366     AV._useMasterKey = false;
1367   };
1368 
1369 
1370   /**
1371    * Call this method to set production environment variable.
1372    * @param {Boolean} production True is production environment,and
1373    *  it's true by default.
1374    */
1375   AV.setProduction = function(production){
1376     if(!AV._isNullOrUndefined(production)) {
1377       //make sure it's a number
1378       production = production ? 1 : 0;
1379     }
1380     //default is 1
1381     AV.applicationProduction = AV._isNullOrUndefined(production) ? 1: production;
1382   };
1383 
1384   // If we're running in node.js, allow using the master key.
1385   if (AV._isNode) {
1386     AV.initialize = AV._initialize;
1387 
1388     AV.Cloud = AV.Cloud || {};
1389     /**
1390      * Switches the AVOSCloud SDK to using the Master key.  The Master key grants
1391      * priveleged access to the data in AVOSCloud and can be used to bypass ACLs and
1392      * other restrictions that are applied to the client SDKs.
1393      * <p><strong><em>Available in Cloud Code and Node.js only.</em></strong>
1394      * </p>
1395      */
1396     AV.Cloud.useMasterKey = function() {
1397       AV._useMasterKey = true;
1398     };
1399   }
1400 
1401 
1402    /**
1403     *Use china avoscloud API service:https://cn.avoscloud.com
1404     */
1405    AV.useAVCloudCN = function(){
1406     AV.serverURL = "https://leancloud.cn";
1407    };
1408 
1409    /**
1410     *Use USA avoscloud API service:https://us.avoscloud.com
1411     */
1412    AV.useAVCloudUS = function(){
1413     AV.serverURL = "https://avoscloud.us";
1414    };
1415 
1416   /**
1417    * Returns prefix for localStorage keys used by this instance of AV.
1418    * @param {String} path The relative suffix to append to it.
1419    *     null or undefined is treated as the empty string.
1420    * @return {String} The full key name.
1421    */
1422   AV._getAVPath = function(path) {
1423     if (!AV.applicationId) {
1424       throw "You need to call AV.initialize before using AV.";
1425     }
1426     if (!path) {
1427       path = "";
1428     }
1429     if (!AV._.isString(path)) {
1430       throw "Tried to get a localStorage path that wasn't a String.";
1431     }
1432     if (path[0] === "/") {
1433       path = path.substring(1);
1434     }
1435     return "AV/" + AV.applicationId + "/" + path;
1436   };
1437 
1438   /**
1439    * Returns the unique string for this app on this machine.
1440    * Gets reset when localStorage is cleared.
1441    */
1442   AV._installationId = null;
1443   AV._getInstallationId = function() {
1444     // See if it's cached in RAM.
1445     if (AV._installationId) {
1446       return AV._installationId;
1447     }
1448 
1449     // Try to get it from localStorage.
1450     var path = AV._getAVPath("installationId");
1451     AV._installationId = AV.localStorage.getItem(path);
1452 
1453     if (!AV._installationId || AV._installationId === "") {
1454       // It wasn't in localStorage, so create a new one.
1455       var hexOctet = function() {
1456         return Math.floor((1+Math.random())*0x10000).toString(16).substring(1);
1457       };
1458       AV._installationId = (
1459         hexOctet() + hexOctet() + "-" +
1460         hexOctet() + "-" +
1461         hexOctet() + "-" +
1462         hexOctet() + "-" +
1463         hexOctet() + hexOctet() + hexOctet());
1464       AV.localStorage.setItem(path, AV._installationId);
1465     }
1466 
1467     return AV._installationId;
1468   };
1469 
1470   AV._parseDate = function(iso8601) {
1471     var regexp = new RegExp(
1472       "^([0-9]{1,4})-([0-9]{1,2})-([0-9]{1,2})" + "T" +
1473       "([0-9]{1,2}):([0-9]{1,2}):([0-9]{1,2})" +
1474       "(.([0-9]+))?" + "Z$");
1475     var match = regexp.exec(iso8601);
1476     if (!match) {
1477       return null;
1478     }
1479 
1480     var year = match[1] || 0;
1481     var month = (match[2] || 1) - 1;
1482     var day = match[3] || 0;
1483     var hour = match[4] || 0;
1484     var minute = match[5] || 0;
1485     var second = match[6] || 0;
1486     var milli = match[8] || 0;
1487 
1488     return new Date(Date.UTC(year, month, day, hour, minute, second, milli));
1489   };
1490 
1491   AV._ajaxIE8 = function(method, url, data) {
1492     var promise = new AV.Promise();
1493     var xdr = new XDomainRequest();
1494     xdr.onload = function() {
1495       var response;
1496       try {
1497         response = JSON.parse(xdr.responseText);
1498       } catch (e) {
1499         promise.reject(e);
1500       }
1501       if (response) {
1502         promise.resolve(response);
1503       }
1504     };
1505     xdr.onerror = xdr.ontimeout = function() {
1506       // Let's fake a real error message.
1507       var fakeResponse = {
1508         responseText: JSON.stringify({
1509           code: AV.Error.X_DOMAIN_REQUEST,
1510           error: "IE's XDomainRequest does not supply error info."
1511         })
1512       };
1513       promise.reject(xdr);
1514     };
1515     xdr.onprogress = function() {};
1516     xdr.open(method, url);
1517     xdr.send(data);
1518     return promise;
1519   };
1520 
1521    AV._useXDomainRequest = function() {
1522        if (typeof(XDomainRequest) !== "undefined") {
1523            // We're in IE 8+.
1524            if ('withCredentials' in new XMLHttpRequest()) {
1525                // We're in IE 10+.
1526                return false;
1527            }
1528            return true;
1529        }
1530        return false;
1531    };
1532 
1533   AV._ajax = function(method, url, data, success, error) {
1534     var options = {
1535       success: success,
1536       error: error
1537     };
1538 
1539     if (AV._useXDomainRequest()) {
1540       return AV._ajaxIE8(method, url, data)._thenRunCallbacks(options);
1541     }
1542 
1543     var promise = new AV.Promise();
1544     var handled = false;
1545 
1546     var xhr = new AV.XMLHttpRequest();
1547     xhr.onreadystatechange = function() {
1548       if (xhr.readyState === 4) {
1549         if (handled) {
1550           return;
1551         }
1552         handled = true;
1553 
1554         if (xhr.status >= 200 && xhr.status < 300) {
1555           var response;
1556           try {
1557             response = JSON.parse(xhr.responseText);
1558           } catch (e) {
1559             promise.reject(e);
1560           }
1561           if (response) {
1562             promise.resolve(response, xhr.status, xhr);
1563           }
1564         } else {
1565           promise.reject(xhr);
1566         }
1567       }
1568     };
1569     xhr.open(method, url, true);
1570     xhr.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "text/plain");  // avoid pre-flight.
1571     if (AV._isNode) {
1572       // Add a special user agent just for request from node.js.
1573       xhr.setRequestHeader("User-Agent",
1574                            "AV/" + AV.VERSION +
1575                            " (NodeJS " + process.versions.node + ")");
1576     }
1577     xhr.send(data);
1578     return promise._thenRunCallbacks(options);
1579   };
1580 
1581   // A self-propagating extend function.
1582   AV._extend = function(protoProps, classProps) {
1583     var child = inherits(this, protoProps, classProps);
1584     child.extend = this.extend;
1585     return child;
1586   };
1587 
1588   /**
1589    * route is classes, users, login, etc.
1590    * objectId is null if there is no associated objectId.
1591    * method is the http method for the REST API.
1592    * dataObject is the payload as an object, or null if there is none.
1593    * @ignore
1594    */
1595   AV._request = function(route, className, objectId, method, dataObject) {
1596     if (!AV.applicationId) {
1597       throw "You must specify your applicationId using AV.initialize";
1598     }
1599 
1600     if (!AV.applicationKey && !AV.masterKey) {
1601       throw "You must specify a key using AV.initialize";
1602     }
1603 
1604 
1605     if (route !== "batch" &&
1606         route !== "classes" &&
1607         route !== "files" &&
1608         route !== "functions" &&
1609         route !== "login" &&
1610         route !== "push" &&
1611         route !== "search/select" &&
1612         route !== "requestPasswordReset" &&
1613         route !== "requestEmailVerify" &&
1614         route !== "requestPasswordResetBySmsCode" &&
1615         route !== "resetPasswordBySmsCode" &&
1616         route !== "requestMobilePhoneVerify" &&
1617         route !== "requestLoginSmsCode" &&
1618         route !== "verifyMobilePhone" &&
1619         route !== "requestSmsCode" &&
1620         route !== "verifySmsCode" &&
1621         route !== "users" &&
1622         route !== "usersByMobilePhone" &&
1623         route !== "cloudQuery" &&
1624         route !== "qiniu" &&
1625         route !== "statuses" &&
1626         route !== 'search/select' &&
1627         route !== 'subscribe/statuses/count' &&
1628         route !== 'subscribe/statuses' &&
1629         !(/users\/[^\/]+\/updatePassword/.test(route)) &&
1630         !(/users\/[^\/]+\/friendship\/[^\/]+/.test(route))) {
1631       throw "Bad route: '" + route + "'.";
1632     }
1633 
1634     var url = AV.serverURL;
1635     if (url.charAt(url.length - 1) !== "/") {
1636       url += "/";
1637     }
1638     url += "1.1/" + route;
1639     if (className) {
1640       url += "/" + className;
1641     }
1642     if (objectId) {
1643       url += "/" + objectId;
1644     }
1645     if((route ==='users' || route === 'classes') && method === 'PUT' && dataObject._fetchWhenSave){
1646       delete dataObject._fetchWhenSave;
1647       url += '?new=true';
1648     }
1649 
1650     dataObject = AV._.clone(dataObject || {});
1651     if (method !== "POST") {
1652       dataObject._method = method;
1653       method = "POST";
1654     }
1655 
1656     dataObject._ApplicationId = AV.applicationId;
1657     dataObject._ApplicationKey = AV.applicationKey;
1658     if(!AV._isNullOrUndefined(AV.applicationProduction)) {
1659       dataObject._ApplicationProduction = AV.applicationProduction;
1660     }
1661     if(AV._useMasterKey)
1662         dataObject._MasterKey = AV.masterKey;
1663     dataObject._ClientVersion = AV.VERSION;
1664     dataObject._InstallationId = AV._getInstallationId();
1665     // Pass the session token on every request.
1666     var currentUser = AV.User.current();
1667     if (currentUser && currentUser._sessionToken) {
1668       dataObject._SessionToken = currentUser._sessionToken;
1669     }
1670     var data = JSON.stringify(dataObject);
1671 
1672     return AV._ajax(method, url, data).then(null, function(response) {
1673       // Transform the error into an instance of AV.Error by trying to parse
1674       // the error string as JSON.
1675       var error;
1676       if (response && response.responseText) {
1677         try {
1678           var errorJSON = JSON.parse(response.responseText);
1679           if (errorJSON) {
1680             error = new AV.Error(errorJSON.code, errorJSON.error);
1681           }
1682         } catch (e) {
1683           // If we fail to parse the error text, that's okay.
1684         }
1685       }
1686       error = error || new AV.Error(-1, response.responseText);
1687       // By explicitly returning a rejected Promise, this will work with
1688       // either jQuery or Promises/A semantics.
1689       return AV.Promise.error(error);
1690     });
1691   };
1692 
1693   // Helper function to get a value from a Backbone object as a property
1694   // or as a function.
1695   AV._getValue = function(object, prop) {
1696     if (!(object && object[prop])) {
1697       return null;
1698     }
1699     return AV._.isFunction(object[prop]) ? object[prop]() : object[prop];
1700   };
1701 
1702   /**
1703    * Converts a value in a AV Object into the appropriate representation.
1704    * This is the JS equivalent of Java's AV.maybeReferenceAndEncode(Object)
1705    * if seenObjects is falsey. Otherwise any AV.Objects not in
1706    * seenObjects will be fully embedded rather than encoded
1707    * as a pointer.  This array will be used to prevent going into an infinite
1708    * loop because we have circular references.  If <seenObjects>
1709    * is set, then none of the AV Objects that are serialized can be dirty.
1710    */
1711   AV._encode = function(value, seenObjects, disallowObjects) {
1712     var _ = AV._;
1713     if (value instanceof AV.Object) {
1714       if (disallowObjects) {
1715         throw "AV.Objects not allowed here";
1716       }
1717       if (!seenObjects || _.include(seenObjects, value) || !value._hasData) {
1718         return value._toPointer();
1719       }
1720       if (!value.dirty()) {
1721         seenObjects = seenObjects.concat(value);
1722         return AV._encode(value._toFullJSON(seenObjects),
1723                              seenObjects,
1724                              disallowObjects);
1725       }
1726       throw "Tried to save an object with a pointer to a new, unsaved object.";
1727     }
1728     if (value instanceof AV.ACL) {
1729       return value.toJSON();
1730     }
1731     if (_.isDate(value)) {
1732       return { "__type": "Date", "iso": value.toJSON() };
1733     }
1734     if (value instanceof AV.GeoPoint) {
1735       return value.toJSON();
1736     }
1737     if (_.isArray(value)) {
1738       return _.map(value, function(x) {
1739         return AV._encode(x, seenObjects, disallowObjects);
1740       });
1741     }
1742     if (_.isRegExp(value)) {
1743       return value.source;
1744     }
1745     if (value instanceof AV.Relation) {
1746       return value.toJSON();
1747     }
1748     if (value instanceof AV.Op) {
1749       return value.toJSON();
1750     }
1751     if (value instanceof AV.File) {
1752       if (!value.url() && !value.id) {
1753         throw "Tried to save an object containing an unsaved file.";
1754       }
1755       return {
1756         __type: "File",
1757         id:  value.id,
1758         name: value.name(),
1759         url: value.url()
1760       };
1761     }
1762     if (_.isObject(value)) {
1763       var output = {};
1764       AV._objectEach(value, function(v, k) {
1765         output[k] = AV._encode(v, seenObjects, disallowObjects);
1766       });
1767       return output;
1768     }
1769     return value;
1770   };
1771 
1772   /**
1773    * The inverse function of AV._encode.
1774    * TODO: make decode not mutate value.
1775    */
1776   AV._decode = function(key, value) {
1777     var _ = AV._;
1778     if (!_.isObject(value)) {
1779       return value;
1780     }
1781     if (_.isArray(value)) {
1782       AV._arrayEach(value, function(v, k) {
1783         value[k] = AV._decode(k, v);
1784       });
1785       return value;
1786     }
1787     if (value instanceof AV.Object) {
1788       return value;
1789     }
1790     if (value instanceof AV.File) {
1791       return value;
1792     }
1793     if (value instanceof AV.Op) {
1794       return value;
1795     }
1796     if (value.__op) {
1797       return AV.Op._decode(value);
1798     }
1799     if (value.__type === "Pointer") {
1800       var className = value.className;
1801       var pointer = AV.Object._create(className);
1802       if(value.createdAt){
1803           delete value.__type;
1804           delete value.className;
1805           pointer._finishFetch(value, true);
1806       }else{
1807           pointer._finishFetch({ objectId: value.objectId }, false);
1808       }
1809       return pointer;
1810     }
1811     if (value.__type === "Object") {
1812       // It's an Object included in a query result.
1813       var className = value.className;
1814       delete value.__type;
1815       delete value.className;
1816       var object = AV.Object._create(className);
1817       object._finishFetch(value, true);
1818       return object;
1819     }
1820     if (value.__type === "Date") {
1821       return AV._parseDate(value.iso);
1822     }
1823     if (value.__type === "GeoPoint") {
1824       return new AV.GeoPoint({
1825         latitude: value.latitude,
1826         longitude: value.longitude
1827       });
1828     }
1829     if (key === "ACL") {
1830       if (value instanceof AV.ACL) {
1831         return value;
1832       }
1833       return new AV.ACL(value);
1834     }
1835     if (value.__type === "Relation") {
1836       var relation = new AV.Relation(null, key);
1837       relation.targetClassName = value.className;
1838       return relation;
1839     }
1840     if (value.__type === "File") {
1841       var file = new AV.File(value.name);
1842       file._metaData = value.metaData || {};
1843       file._url = value.url;
1844       file.id = value.objectId;
1845       return file;
1846     }
1847     AV._objectEach(value, function(v, k) {
1848       value[k] = AV._decode(k, v);
1849     });
1850     return value;
1851   };
1852 
1853   AV._arrayEach = AV._.each;
1854 
1855   /**
1856    * Does a deep traversal of every item in object, calling func on every one.
1857    * @param {Object} object The object or array to traverse deeply.
1858    * @param {Function} func The function to call for every item. It will
1859    *     be passed the item as an argument. If it returns a truthy value, that
1860    *     value will replace the item in its parent container.
1861    * @returns {} the result of calling func on the top-level object itself.
1862    */
1863   AV._traverse = function(object, func, seen) {
1864     if (object instanceof AV.Object) {
1865       seen = seen || [];
1866       if (AV._.indexOf(seen, object) >= 0) {
1867         // We've already visited this object in this call.
1868         return;
1869       }
1870       seen.push(object);
1871       AV._traverse(object.attributes, func, seen);
1872       return func(object);
1873     }
1874     if (object instanceof AV.Relation || object instanceof AV.File) {
1875       // Nothing needs to be done, but we don't want to recurse into the
1876       // object's parent infinitely, so we catch this case.
1877       return func(object);
1878     }
1879     if (AV._.isArray(object)) {
1880       AV._.each(object, function(child, index) {
1881         var newChild = AV._traverse(child, func, seen);
1882         if (newChild) {
1883           object[index] = newChild;
1884         }
1885       });
1886       return func(object);
1887     }
1888     if (AV._.isObject(object)) {
1889       AV._each(object, function(child, key) {
1890         var newChild = AV._traverse(child, func, seen);
1891         if (newChild) {
1892           object[key] = newChild;
1893         }
1894       });
1895       return func(object);
1896     }
1897     return func(object);
1898   };
1899 
1900   /**
1901    * This is like _.each, except:
1902    * * it doesn't work for so-called array-like objects,
1903    * * it does work for dictionaries with a "length" attribute.
1904    */
1905   AV._objectEach = AV._each = function(obj, callback) {
1906     var _ = AV._;
1907     if (_.isObject(obj)) {
1908       _.each(_.keys(obj), function(key) {
1909         callback(obj[key], key);
1910       });
1911     } else {
1912       _.each(obj, callback);
1913     }
1914   };
1915 
1916   // Helper function to check null or undefined.
1917   AV._isNullOrUndefined = function(x) {
1918     return AV._.isNull(x) || AV._.isUndefined(x);
1919   };
1920 }(this));
1921 
1922 (function(root) {
1923   root.AV = root.AV || {};
1924   var AV = root.AV;
1925   var _ = AV._;
1926 
1927   /**
1928    * Constructs a new AV.Error object with the given code and message.
1929    * @param {Number} code An error code constant from <code>AV.Error</code>.
1930    * @param {String} message A detailed description of the error.
1931    * @class
1932    *
1933    * <p>Class used for all objects passed to error callbacks.</p>
1934    */
1935   AV.Error = function(code, message) {
1936     this.code = code;
1937     this.message = message;
1938   };
1939 
1940   _.extend(AV.Error, /** @lends AV.Error */ {
1941     /**
1942      * Error code indicating some error other than those enumerated here.
1943      * @constant
1944      */
1945     OTHER_CAUSE: -1,
1946 
1947     /**
1948      * Error code indicating that something has gone wrong with the server.
1949      * If you get this error code, it is AV's fault. Contact us at
1950      * https://avoscloud.com/help
1951      * @constant
1952      */
1953     INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR: 1,
1954 
1955     /**
1956      * Error code indicating the connection to the AV servers failed.
1957      * @constant
1958      */
1959     CONNECTION_FAILED: 100,
1960 
1961     /**
1962      * Error code indicating the specified object doesn't exist.
1963      * @constant
1964      */
1965     OBJECT_NOT_FOUND: 101,
1966 
1967     /**
1968      * Error code indicating you tried to query with a datatype that doesn't
1969      * support it, like exact matching an array or object.
1970      * @constant
1971      */
1972     INVALID_QUERY: 102,
1973 
1974     /**
1975      * Error code indicating a missing or invalid classname. Classnames are
1976      * case-sensitive. They must start with a letter, and a-zA-Z0-9_ are the
1977      * only valid characters.
1978      * @constant
1979      */
1980     INVALID_CLASS_NAME: 103,
1981 
1982     /**
1983      * Error code indicating an unspecified object id.
1984      * @constant
1985      */
1986     MISSING_OBJECT_ID: 104,
1987 
1988     /**
1989      * Error code indicating an invalid key name. Keys are case-sensitive. They
1990      * must start with a letter, and a-zA-Z0-9_ are the only valid characters.
1991      * @constant
1992      */
1993     INVALID_KEY_NAME: 105,
1994 
1995     /**
1996      * Error code indicating a malformed pointer. You should not see this unless
1997      * you have been mucking about changing internal AV code.
1998      * @constant
1999      */
2000     INVALID_POINTER: 106,
2001

2004      * either indicates you have done something unusual with modifying how
2005      * things encode to JSON, or the network is failing badly.
