2266 }(this));
2267 
2268 /*global _: false */
2269 (function() {
2270   var root = this;
2271   var AV = (root.AV || (root.AV = {}));
2272   var eventSplitter = /\s+/;
2273   var slice = Array.prototype.slice;
2274 
2275   /**
2276    * @class
2277    *
2278    * <p>AV.Events is a fork of Backbone's Events module, provided for your
2279    * convenience.</p>
2280    *
2281    * <p>A module that can be mixed in to any object in order to provide
2282    * it with custom events. You may bind callback functions to an event
2283    * with `on`, or remove these functions with `off`.
2284    * Triggering an event fires all callbacks in the order that `on` was
2285    * called.
2286    *
2287    * <pre>
2288    *     var object = {};
2289    *     _.extend(object, AV.Events);
2290    *     object.on('expand', function(){ alert('expanded'); });
2291    *     object.trigger('expand');</pre></p>
2292    *
2293    * <p>For more information, see the
2294    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#Events">Backbone
2295    * documentation</a>.</p>
2296    */
2297   AV.Events = {
2298     /**
2299      * Bind one or more space separated events, `events`, to a `callback`
2300      * function. Passing `"all"` will bind the callback to all events fired.
2301      */
2302     on: function(events, callback, context) {
2303 
2304       var calls, event, node, tail, list;
2305       if (!callback) {
2306         return this;
2307       }
2308       events = events.split(eventSplitter);
2309       calls = this._callbacks || (this._callbacks = {});
2310 
2311       // Create an immutable callback list, allowing traversal during
2312       // modification.  The tail is an empty object that will always be used
2313       // as the next node.
2314       event = events.shift();
2315       while (event) {
2316         list = calls[event];
2317         node = list ? list.tail : {};
2318         node.next = tail = {};
2319         node.context = context;
2320         node.callback = callback;
2321         calls[event] = {tail: tail, next: list ? list.next : node};
2322         event = events.shift();
2323       }
2324 
2325       return this;
2326     },
2327 
2328     /**
2329      * Remove one or many callbacks. If `context` is null, removes all callbacks
2330      * with that function. If `callback` is null, removes all callbacks for the
2331      * event. If `events` is null, removes all bound callbacks for all events.
2332      */
2333     off: function(events, callback, context) {
2334       var event, calls, node, tail, cb, ctx;
2335 
2336       // No events, or removing *all* events.
2337       if (!(calls = this._callbacks)) {
2338         return;
2339       }
2340       if (!(events || callback || context)) {
2341         delete this._callbacks;
2342         return this;
2343       }
2344 
2345       // Loop through the listed events and contexts, splicing them out of the
2346       // linked list of callbacks if appropriate.
2347       events = events ? events.split(eventSplitter) : _.keys(calls);
2348       event = events.shift();
2349       while (event) {
2350         node = calls[event];
2351         delete calls[event];
2352         if (!node || !(callback || context)) {
2353           continue;
2354         }
2355         // Create a new list, omitting the indicated callbacks.
2356         tail = node.tail;
2357         node = node.next;
2358         while (node !== tail) {
2359           cb = node.callback;
2360           ctx = node.context;
2361           if ((callback && cb !== callback) || (context && ctx !== context)) {
2362             this.on(event, cb, ctx);
2363           }
2364           node = node.next;
2365         }
2366         event = events.shift();
2367       }
2368 
2369       return this;
2370     },
2371 
2372     /**
2373      * Trigger one or many events, firing all bound callbacks. Callbacks are
2374      * passed the same arguments as `trigger` is, apart from the event name
2375      * (unless you're listening on `"all"`, which will cause your callback to
2376      * receive the true name of the event as the first argument).
2377      */
2378     trigger: function(events) {
2379       var event, node, calls, tail, args, all, rest;
2380       if (!(calls = this._callbacks)) {
2381         return this;
2382       }
2383       all = calls.all;
2384       events = events.split(eventSplitter);
2385       rest = slice.call(arguments, 1);
2386 
2387       // For each event, walk through the linked list of callbacks twice,
2388       // first to trigger the event, then to trigger any `"all"` callbacks.
2389       event = events.shift();
2390       while (event) {
2391         node = calls[event];
2392         if (node) {
2393           tail = node.tail;
2394           while ((node = node.next) !== tail) {
2395             node.callback.apply(node.context || this, rest);
2396           }
2397         }
2398         node = all;
2399         if (node) {
2400           tail = node.tail;
2401           args = [event].concat(rest);
2402           while ((node = node.next) !== tail) {
2403             node.callback.apply(node.context || this, args);
2404           }
2405         }
2406         event = events.shift();
2407       }
2408 
2409       return this;
2410     }
2411   };
2412 
2413   /**
2414    * @function
2415    */
2416   AV.Events.bind = AV.Events.on;
2417 
2418   /**
2419    * @function
2420    */
2421   AV.Events.unbind = AV.Events.off;
2422 }.call(this));
2423 
2424 /*global navigator: false */
2425 (function(root) {
2426   root.AV = root.AV || {};
2427   var AV = root.AV;
2428   var _ = AV._;
2429 
2430   /**
2431    * Creates a new GeoPoint with any of the following forms:<br>
2432    *   <pre>
2433    *   new GeoPoint(otherGeoPoint)
2434    *   new GeoPoint(30, 30)
2435    *   new GeoPoint([30, 30])
2436    *   new GeoPoint({latitude: 30, longitude: 30})
2437    *   new GeoPoint()  // defaults to (0, 0)
2438    *   </pre>
2439    * @class
2440    *
2441    * <p>Represents a latitude / longitude point that may be associated
2442    * with a key in a AVObject or used as a reference point for geo queries.
2443    * This allows proximity-based queries on the key.</p>
2444    *
2445    * <p>Only one key in a class may contain a GeoPoint.</p>
2446    *
2447    * <p>Example:<pre>
2448    *   var point = new AV.GeoPoint(30.0, -20.0);
2449    *   var object = new AV.Object("PlaceObject");
2450    *   object.set("location", point);
2451    *   object.save();</pre></p>
2452    */
2453   AV.GeoPoint = function(arg1, arg2) {
2454     if (_.isArray(arg1)) {
2455       AV.GeoPoint._validate(arg1[0], arg1[1]);
2456       this.latitude = arg1[0];
2457       this.longitude = arg1[1];
2458     } else if (_.isObject(arg1)) {
2459       AV.GeoPoint._validate(arg1.latitude, arg1.longitude);
2460       this.latitude = arg1.latitude;
2461       this.longitude = arg1.longitude;
2462     } else if (_.isNumber(arg1) && _.isNumber(arg2)) {
2463       AV.GeoPoint._validate(arg1, arg2);
2464       this.latitude = arg1;
2465       this.longitude = arg2;
2466     } else {
2467       this.latitude = 0;
2468       this.longitude = 0;
2469     }
2470 
2471     // Add properties so that anyone using Webkit or Mozilla will get an error
2472     // if they try to set values that are out of bounds.
2473     var self = this;
2474     if (this.__defineGetter__ && this.__defineSetter__) {
2475       // Use _latitude and _longitude to actually store the values, and add
2476       // getters and setters for latitude and longitude.
2477       this._latitude = this.latitude;
2478       this._longitude = this.longitude;
2479       this.__defineGetter__("latitude", function() {
2480         return self._latitude;
2481       });
2482       this.__defineGetter__("longitude", function() {
2483         return self._longitude;
2484       });
2485       this.__defineSetter__("latitude", function(val) {
2486         AV.GeoPoint._validate(val, self.longitude);
2487         self._latitude = val;
2488       });
2489       this.__defineSetter__("longitude", function(val) {
2490         AV.GeoPoint._validate(self.latitude, val);
2491         self._longitude = val;
2492       });
2493     }
2494   };
2495 
2496   /**
2497    * @lends AV.GeoPoint.prototype
2498    * @property {float} latitude North-south portion of the coordinate, in range
2499    *   [-90, 90].  Throws an exception if set out of range in a modern browser.
2500    * @property {float} longitude East-west portion of the coordinate, in range
2501    *   [-180, 180].  Throws if set out of range in a modern browser.
2502    */
2503 
2504   /**
2505    * Throws an exception if the given lat-long is out of bounds.
2506    */
2507   AV.GeoPoint._validate = function(latitude, longitude) {
2508     if (latitude < -90.0) {
2509       throw "AV.GeoPoint latitude " + latitude + " < -90.0.";
2510     }
2511     if (latitude > 90.0) {
2512       throw "AV.GeoPoint latitude " + latitude + " > 90.0.";
2513     }
2514     if (longitude < -180.0) {
2515       throw "AV.GeoPoint longitude " + longitude + " < -180.0.";
2516     }
2517     if (longitude > 180.0) {
2518       throw "AV.GeoPoint longitude " + longitude + " > 180.0.";
2519     }
2520   };
2521 
2522   /**
2523    * Creates a GeoPoint with the user's current location, if available.
2524    * Calls options.success with a new GeoPoint instance or calls options.error.
2525    * @param {Object} options An object with success and error callbacks.
2526    */
2527   AV.GeoPoint.current = function(options) {
2528     var promise = new AV.Promise();
2529     navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(function(location) {
2530       promise.resolve(new AV.GeoPoint({
2531         latitude: location.coords.latitude,
2532         longitude: location.coords.longitude
2533       }));
2534 
2535     }, function(error) {
2536       promise.reject(error);
2537     });
2538 
2539     return promise._thenRunCallbacks(options);
2540   };
2541 
2542   AV.GeoPoint.prototype = {
2543     /**
2544      * Returns a JSON representation of the GeoPoint, suitable for AV.
2545      * @return {Object}
2546      */
2547     toJSON: function() {
2548       AV.GeoPoint._validate(this.latitude, this.longitude);
2549       return {
2550         "__type": "GeoPoint",
2551         latitude: this.latitude,
2552         longitude: this.longitude
2553       };
2554     },
2555 
2556     /**
2557      * Returns the distance from this GeoPoint to another in radians.
2558      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point the other AV.GeoPoint.
2559      * @return {Number}
2560      */
2561     radiansTo: function(point) {
2562       var d2r = Math.PI / 180.0;
2563       var lat1rad = this.latitude * d2r;
2564       var long1rad = this.longitude * d2r;
2565       var lat2rad = point.latitude * d2r;
2566       var long2rad = point.longitude * d2r;
2567       var deltaLat = lat1rad - lat2rad;
2568       var deltaLong = long1rad - long2rad;
2569       var sinDeltaLatDiv2 = Math.sin(deltaLat / 2);
2570       var sinDeltaLongDiv2 = Math.sin(deltaLong / 2);
2571       // Square of half the straight line chord distance between both points.
2572       var a = ((sinDeltaLatDiv2 * sinDeltaLatDiv2) +
2573                (Math.cos(lat1rad) * Math.cos(lat2rad) *
2574                 sinDeltaLongDiv2 * sinDeltaLongDiv2));
2575       a = Math.min(1.0, a);
2576       return 2 * Math.asin(Math.sqrt(a));
2577     },
2578 
2579     /**
2580      * Returns the distance from this GeoPoint to another in kilometers.
2581      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point the other AV.GeoPoint.
2582      * @return {Number}
2583      */
2584     kilometersTo: function(point) {
2585       return this.radiansTo(point) * 6371.0;
2586     },
2587 
2588     /**
2589      * Returns the distance from this GeoPoint to another in miles.
2590      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point the other AV.GeoPoint.
2591      * @return {Number}
2592      */
2593     milesTo: function(point) {
2594       return this.radiansTo(point) * 3958.8;
2595     }
2596   };
2597 }(this));
2598 
2599 /*global navigator: false */
2600 (function(root) {
2601   root.AV = root.AV || {};
2602   var AV = root.AV;
2603   var _ = AV._;
2604 
2605   var PUBLIC_KEY = "*";
2606 
2607   /**
2608    * Creates a new ACL.
2609    * If no argument is given, the ACL has no permissions for anyone.
2610    * If the argument is a AV.User, the ACL will have read and write
2611    *   permission for only that user.
2612    * If the argument is any other JSON object, that object will be interpretted
2613    *   as a serialized ACL created with toJSON().
2614    * @see AV.Object#setACL
2615    * @class
2616    *
2617    * <p>An ACL, or Access Control List can be added to any
2618    * <code>AV.Object</code> to restrict access to only a subset of users
2619    * of your application.</p>
2620    */
2621   AV.ACL = function(arg1) {
2622     var self = this;
2623     self.permissionsById = {};
2624     if (_.isObject(arg1)) {
2625       if (arg1 instanceof AV.User) {
2626         self.setReadAccess(arg1, true);
2627         self.setWriteAccess(arg1, true);
2628       } else {
2629         if (_.isFunction(arg1)) {
2630           throw "AV.ACL() called with a function.  Did you forget ()?";
2631         }
2632         AV._objectEach(arg1, function(accessList, userId) {
2633           if (!_.isString(userId)) {
2634             throw "Tried to create an ACL with an invalid userId.";
2635           }
2636           self.permissionsById[userId] = {};
2637           AV._objectEach(accessList, function(allowed, permission) {
2638             if (permission !== "read" && permission !== "write") {
2639               throw "Tried to create an ACL with an invalid permission type.";
2640             }
2641             if (!_.isBoolean(allowed)) {
2642               throw "Tried to create an ACL with an invalid permission value.";
2643             }
2644             self.permissionsById[userId][permission] = allowed;
2645           });
2646         });
2647       }
2648     }
2649   };
2650 
2651   /**
2652    * Returns a JSON-encoded version of the ACL.
2653    * @return {Object}
2654    */
2655   AV.ACL.prototype.toJSON = function() {
2656     return _.clone(this.permissionsById);
2657   };
2658 
2659   AV.ACL.prototype._setAccess = function(accessType, userId, allowed) {
2660     if (userId instanceof AV.User) {
2661       userId = userId.id;
2662     } else if (userId instanceof AV.Role) {
2663       userId = "role:" + userId.getName();
2664     }
2665     if (!_.isString(userId)) {
2666       throw "userId must be a string.";
2667     }
2668     if (!_.isBoolean(allowed)) {
2669       throw "allowed must be either true or false.";
2670     }
2671     var permissions = this.permissionsById[userId];
2672     if (!permissions) {
2673       if (!allowed) {
2674         // The user already doesn't have this permission, so no action needed.
2675         return;
2676       } else {
2677         permissions = {};
2678         this.permissionsById[userId] = permissions;
2679       }
2680     }
2681 
2682     if (allowed) {
2683       this.permissionsById[userId][accessType] = true;
2684     } else {
2685       delete permissions[accessType];
2686       if (_.isEmpty(permissions)) {
2687         delete permissions[userId];
2688       }
2689     }
2690   };
2691 
2692   AV.ACL.prototype._getAccess = function(accessType, userId) {
2693     if (userId instanceof AV.User) {
2694       userId = userId.id;
2695     } else if (userId instanceof AV.Role) {
2696       userId = "role:" + userId.getName();
2697     }
2698     var permissions = this.permissionsById[userId];
2699     if (!permissions) {
2700       return false;
2701     }
2702     return permissions[accessType] ? true : false;
2703   };
2704 
2705   /**
2706    * Set whether the given user is allowed to read this object.
2707    * @param userId An instance of AV.User or its objectId.
2708    * @param {Boolean} allowed Whether that user should have read access.
2709    */
2710   AV.ACL.prototype.setReadAccess = function(userId, allowed) {
2711     this._setAccess("read", userId, allowed);
2712   };
2713 
2714   /**
2715    * Get whether the given user id is *explicitly* allowed to read this object.
2716    * Even if this returns false, the user may still be able to access it if
2717    * getPublicReadAccess returns true or a role that the user belongs to has
2718    * write access.
2719    * @param userId An instance of AV.User or its objectId, or a AV.Role.
2720    * @return {Boolean}
2721    */
2722   AV.ACL.prototype.getReadAccess = function(userId) {
2723     return this._getAccess("read", userId);
2724   };
2725 
2726   /**
2727    * Set whether the given user id is allowed to write this object.
2728    * @param userId An instance of AV.User or its objectId, or a AV.Role..
2729    * @param {Boolean} allowed Whether that user should have write access.
2730    */
2731   AV.ACL.prototype.setWriteAccess = function(userId, allowed) {
2732     this._setAccess("write", userId, allowed);
2733   };
2734 
2735   /**
2736    * Get whether the given user id is *explicitly* allowed to write this object.
2737    * Even if this returns false, the user may still be able to write it if
2738    * getPublicWriteAccess returns true or a role that the user belongs to has
2739    * write access.
2740    * @param userId An instance of AV.User or its objectId, or a AV.Role.
2741    * @return {Boolean}
2742    */
2743   AV.ACL.prototype.getWriteAccess = function(userId) {
2744     return this._getAccess("write", userId);
2745   };
2746 
2747   /**
2748    * Set whether the public is allowed to read this object.
2749    * @param {Boolean} allowed
2750    */
2751   AV.ACL.prototype.setPublicReadAccess = function(allowed) {
2752     this.setReadAccess(PUBLIC_KEY, allowed);
2753   };
2754 
2755   /**
2756    * Get whether the public is allowed to read this object.
2757    * @return {Boolean}
2758    */
2759   AV.ACL.prototype.getPublicReadAccess = function() {
2760     return this.getReadAccess(PUBLIC_KEY);
2761   };
2762 
2763   /**
2764    * Set whether the public is allowed to write this object.
2765    * @param {Boolean} allowed
2766    */
2767   AV.ACL.prototype.setPublicWriteAccess = function(allowed) {
2768     this.setWriteAccess(PUBLIC_KEY, allowed);
2769   };
2770 
2771   /**
2772    * Get whether the public is allowed to write this object.
2773    * @return {Boolean}
2774    */
2775   AV.ACL.prototype.getPublicWriteAccess = function() {
2776     return this.getWriteAccess(PUBLIC_KEY);
2777   };
2778 
2779   /**
2780    * Get whether users belonging to the given role are allowed
2781    * to read this object. Even if this returns false, the role may
2782    * still be able to write it if a parent role has read access.
2783    *
2784    * @param role The name of the role, or a AV.Role object.
2785    * @return {Boolean} true if the role has read access. false otherwise.
2786    * @throws {String} If role is neither a AV.Role nor a String.
2787    */
2788   AV.ACL.prototype.getRoleReadAccess = function(role) {
2789     if (role instanceof AV.Role) {
2790       // Normalize to the String name
2791       role = role.getName();
2792     }
2793     if (_.isString(role)) {
2794       return this.getReadAccess("role:" + role);
2795     }
2796     throw "role must be a AV.Role or a String";
2797   };
2798 
2799   /**
2800    * Get whether users belonging to the given role are allowed
2801    * to write this object. Even if this returns false, the role may
2802    * still be able to write it if a parent role has write access.
2803    *
2804    * @param role The name of the role, or a AV.Role object.
2805    * @return {Boolean} true if the role has write access. false otherwise.
2806    * @throws {String} If role is neither a AV.Role nor a String.
2807    */
2808   AV.ACL.prototype.getRoleWriteAccess = function(role) {
2809     if (role instanceof AV.Role) {
2810       // Normalize to the String name
2811       role = role.getName();
2812     }
2813     if (_.isString(role)) {
2814       return this.getWriteAccess("role:" + role);
2815     }
2816     throw "role must be a AV.Role or a String";
2817   };
2818 
2819   /**
2820    * Set whether users belonging to the given role are allowed
2821    * to read this object.
2822    *
2823    * @param role The name of the role, or a AV.Role object.
2824    * @param {Boolean} allowed Whether the given role can read this object.
2825    * @throws {String} If role is neither a AV.Role nor a String.
2826    */
2827   AV.ACL.prototype.setRoleReadAccess = function(role, allowed) {
2828     if (role instanceof AV.Role) {
2829       // Normalize to the String name
2830       role = role.getName();
2831     }
2832     if (_.isString(role)) {
2833       this.setReadAccess("role:" + role, allowed);
2834       return;
2835     }
2836     throw "role must be a AV.Role or a String";
2837   };
2838 
2839   /**
2840    * Set whether users belonging to the given role are allowed
2841    * to write this object.
2842    *
2843    * @param role The name of the role, or a AV.Role object.
2844    * @param {Boolean} allowed Whether the given role can write this object.
2845    * @throws {String} If role is neither a AV.Role nor a String.
2846    */
2847   AV.ACL.prototype.setRoleWriteAccess = function(role, allowed) {
2848     if (role instanceof AV.Role) {
2849       // Normalize to the String name
2850       role = role.getName();
2851     }
2852     if (_.isString(role)) {
2853       this.setWriteAccess("role:" + role, allowed);
2854       return;
2855     }
2856     throw "role must be a AV.Role or a String";
2857   };
2858 
2859 }(this));
2860 
2861 (function(root) {
2862   root.AV = root.AV || {};
2863   var AV = root.AV;
2864   var _ = AV._;
2865 
2866   /**
2867    * @class
2868    * A AV.Op is an atomic operation that can be applied to a field in a
2869    * AV.Object. For example, calling <code>object.set("foo", "bar")</code>
2870    * is an example of a AV.Op.Set. Calling <code>object.unset("foo")</code>
2871    * is a AV.Op.Unset. These operations are stored in a AV.Object and
2872    * sent to the server as part of <code>object.save()</code> operations.
2873    * Instances of AV.Op should be immutable.
2874    *
2875    * You should not create subclasses of AV.Op or instantiate AV.Op
2876    * directly.
2877    */
2878   AV.Op = function() {
2879     this._initialize.apply(this, arguments);
2880   };
2881 
2882   AV.Op.prototype = {
2883     _initialize: function() {}
2884   };
2885 
2886   _.extend(AV.Op, {
2887     /**
2888      * To create a new Op, call AV.Op._extend();
2889      */
2890     _extend: AV._extend,
2891 
2892     // A map of __op string to decoder function.
2893     _opDecoderMap: {},
2894 
2895     /**
2896      * Registers a function to convert a json object with an __op field into an
2897      * instance of a subclass of AV.Op.
2898      */
2899     _registerDecoder: function(opName, decoder) {
2900       AV.Op._opDecoderMap[opName] = decoder;
2901     },
2902 
2903     /**
2904      * Converts a json object into an instance of a subclass of AV.Op.
2905      */
2906     _decode: function(json) {
2907       var decoder = AV.Op._opDecoderMap[json.__op];
2908       if (decoder) {
2909         return decoder(json);
2910       } else {
2911         return undefined;
2912       }
2913     }
2914   });
2915 
2916   /*
2917    * Add a handler for Batch ops.
2918    */
2919   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Batch", function(json) {
2920     var op = null;
2921     AV._arrayEach(json.ops, function(nextOp) {
2922       nextOp = AV.Op._decode(nextOp);
2923       op = nextOp._mergeWithPrevious(op);
2924     });
2925     return op;
2926   });
2927 
2928   /**
2929    * @class
2930    * A Set operation indicates that either the field was changed using
2931    * AV.Object.set, or it is a mutable container that was detected as being
2932    * changed.
2933    */
2934   AV.Op.Set = AV.Op._extend(/** @lends AV.Op.Set.prototype */ {
2935     _initialize: function(value) {
2936       this._value = value;
2937     },
2938 
2939     /**
2940      * Returns the new value of this field after the set.
2941      */
2942     value: function() {
2943       return this._value;
2944     },
2945 
2946     /**
2947      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
2948      * @return {Object}
2949      */
2950     toJSON: function() {
2951       return AV._encode(this.value());
2952     },
2953 
2954     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
2955       return this;
2956     },
2957 
2958     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
2959       return this.value();
2960     }
2961   });
2962 
2963   /**
2964    * A sentinel value that is returned by AV.Op.Unset._estimate to
2965    * indicate the field should be deleted. Basically, if you find _UNSET as a
2966    * value in your object, you should remove that key.
2967    */
2968   AV.Op._UNSET = {};
2969 
2970   /**
2971    * @class
2972    * An Unset operation indicates that this field has been deleted from the
2973    * object.
2974    */
2975   AV.Op.Unset = AV.Op._extend(/** @lends AV.Op.Unset.prototype */ {
2976     /**
2977      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
2978      * @return {Object}
2979      */
2980     toJSON: function() {
2981       return { __op: "Delete" };
2982     },
2983 
2984     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
2985       return this;
2986     },
2987 
2988     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
2989       return AV.Op._UNSET;
2990     }
2991   });
2992 
2993   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Delete", function(json) {
2994     return new AV.Op.Unset();
2995   });
2996 
2997   /**
2998    * @class
2999    * An Increment is an atomic operation where the numeric value for the field
3000    * will be increased by a given amount.
3001    */
3002   AV.Op.Increment = AV.Op._extend(
3003       /** @lends AV.Op.Increment.prototype */ {
3004 
3005     _initialize: function(amount) {
3006       this._amount = amount;
3007     },
3008 
3009     /**
3010      * Returns the amount to increment by.
3011      * @return {Number} the amount to increment by.
3012      */
3013     amount: function() {
3014       return this._amount;
3015     },
3016 
3017     /**
3018      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
3019      * @return {Object}
3020      */
3021     toJSON: function() {
3022       return { __op: "Increment", amount: this._amount };
3023     },
3024 
3025     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
3026       if (!previous) {
3027         return this;
3028       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
3029         return new AV.Op.Set(this.amount());
3030       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Set) {
3031         return new AV.Op.Set(previous.value() + this.amount());
3032       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Increment) {
3033         return new AV.Op.Increment(this.amount() + previous.amount());
3034       } else {
3035         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3036       }
3037     },
3038 
3039     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
3040       if (!oldValue) {
3041         return this.amount();
3042       }
3043       return oldValue + this.amount();
3044     }
3045   });
3046 
3047   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Increment", function(json) {
3048     return new AV.Op.Increment(json.amount);
3049   });
3050 
3051   /**
3052    * @class
3053    * Add is an atomic operation where the given objects will be appended to the
3054    * array that is stored in this field.
3055    */
3056   AV.Op.Add = AV.Op._extend(/** @lends AV.Op.Add.prototype */ {
3057     _initialize: function(objects) {
3058       this._objects = objects;
3059     },
3060 
3061     /**
3062      * Returns the objects to be added to the array.
3063      * @return {Array} The objects to be added to the array.
3064      */
3065     objects: function() {
3066       return this._objects;
3067     },
3068 
3069     /**
3070      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
3071      * @return {Object}
3072      */
3073     toJSON: function() {
3074       return { __op: "Add", objects: AV._encode(this.objects()) };
3075     },
3076 
3077     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
3078       if (!previous) {
3079         return this;
3080       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
3081         return new AV.Op.Set(this.objects());
3082       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Set) {
3083         return new AV.Op.Set(this._estimate(previous.value()));
3084       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Add) {
3085         return new AV.Op.Add(previous.objects().concat(this.objects()));
3086       } else {
3087         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3088       }
3089     },
3090 
3091     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
3092       if (!oldValue) {
3093         return _.clone(this.objects());
3094       } else {
3095         return oldValue.concat(this.objects());
3096       }
3097     }
3098   });
3099 
3100   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Add", function(json) {
3101     return new AV.Op.Add(AV._decode(undefined, json.objects));
3102   });
3103 
3104   /**
3105    * @class
3106    * AddUnique is an atomic operation where the given items will be appended to
3107    * the array that is stored in this field only if they were not already
3108    * present in the array.
3109    */
3110   AV.Op.AddUnique = AV.Op._extend(
3111       /** @lends AV.Op.AddUnique.prototype */ {
3112 
3113     _initialize: function(objects) {
3114       this._objects = _.uniq(objects);
3115     },
3116 
3117     /**
3118      * Returns the objects to be added to the array.
3119      * @return {Array} The objects to be added to the array.
3120      */
3121     objects: function() {
3122       return this._objects;
3123     },
3124 
3125     /**
3126      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
3127      * @return {Object}
3128      */
3129     toJSON: function() {
3130       return { __op: "AddUnique", objects: AV._encode(this.objects()) };
3131     },
3132 
3133     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
3134       if (!previous) {
3135         return this;
3136       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
3137         return new AV.Op.Set(this.objects());
3138       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Set) {
3139         return new AV.Op.Set(this._estimate(previous.value()));
3140       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.AddUnique) {
3141         return new AV.Op.AddUnique(this._estimate(previous.objects()));
3142       } else {
3143         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3144       }
3145     },
3146 
3147     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
3148       if (!oldValue) {
3149         return _.clone(this.objects());
3150       } else {
3151         // We can't just take the _.uniq(_.union(...)) of oldValue and
3152         // this.objects, because the uniqueness may not apply to oldValue
3153         // (especially if the oldValue was set via .set())
3154         var newValue = _.clone(oldValue);
3155         AV._arrayEach(this.objects(), function(obj) {
3156           if (obj instanceof AV.Object && obj.id) {
3157             var matchingObj = _.find(newValue, function(anObj) {
3158               return (anObj instanceof AV.Object) && (anObj.id === obj.id);
3159             });
3160             if (!matchingObj) {
3161               newValue.push(obj);
3162             } else {
3163               var index = _.indexOf(newValue, matchingObj);
3164               newValue[index] = obj;
3165             }
3166           } else if (!_.contains(newValue, obj)) {
3167             newValue.push(obj);
3168           }
3169         });
3170         return newValue;
3171       }
3172     }
3173   });
3174 
3175   AV.Op._registerDecoder("AddUnique", function(json) {
3176     return new AV.Op.AddUnique(AV._decode(undefined, json.objects));
3177   });
3178 
3179   /**
3180    * @class
3181    * Remove is an atomic operation where the given objects will be removed from
3182    * the array that is stored in this field.
3183    */
3184   AV.Op.Remove = AV.Op._extend(/** @lends AV.Op.Remove.prototype */ {
3185     _initialize: function(objects) {
3186       this._objects = _.uniq(objects);
3187     },
3188 
3189     /**
3190      * Returns the objects to be removed from the array.
3191      * @return {Array} The objects to be removed from the array.
3192      */
3193     objects: function() {
3194       return this._objects;
3195     },
3196 
3197     /**
3198      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
3199      * @return {Object}
3200      */
3201     toJSON: function() {
3202       return { __op: "Remove", objects: AV._encode(this.objects()) };
3203     },
3204 
3205     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
3206       if (!previous) {
3207         return this;
3208       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
3209         return previous;
3210       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Set) {
3211         return new AV.Op.Set(this._estimate(previous.value()));
3212       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Remove) {
3213         return new AV.Op.Remove(_.union(previous.objects(), this.objects()));
3214       } else {
3215         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3216       }
3217     },
3218 
3219     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
3220       if (!oldValue) {
3221         return [];
3222       } else {
3223         var newValue = _.difference(oldValue, this.objects());
3224         // If there are saved AV Objects being removed, also remove them.
3225         AV._arrayEach(this.objects(), function(obj) {
3226           if (obj instanceof AV.Object && obj.id) {
3227             newValue = _.reject(newValue, function(other) {
3228               return (other instanceof AV.Object) && (other.id === obj.id);
3229             });
3230           }
3231         });
3232         return newValue;
3233       }
3234     }
3235   });
3236 
3237   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Remove", function(json) {
3238     return new AV.Op.Remove(AV._decode(undefined, json.objects));
3239   });
3240 
3241   /**
3242    * @class
3243    * A Relation operation indicates that the field is an instance of
3244    * AV.Relation, and objects are being added to, or removed from, that
3245    * relation.
3246    */
3247   AV.Op.Relation = AV.Op._extend(
3248       /** @lends AV.Op.Relation.prototype */ {
3249 
3250     _initialize: function(adds, removes) {
3251       this._targetClassName = null;
3252 
3253       var self = this;
3254 
3255       var pointerToId = function(object) {
3256         if (object instanceof AV.Object) {
3257           if (!object.id) {
3258             throw "You can't add an unsaved AV.Object to a relation.";
3259           }
3260           if (!self._targetClassName) {
3261             self._targetClassName = object.className;
3262           }
3263           if (self._targetClassName !== object.className) {
3264             throw "Tried to create a AV.Relation with 2 different types: " +
3265                   self._targetClassName + " and " + object.className + ".";
3266           }
3267           return object.id;
3268         }
3269         return object;
3270       };
3271 
3272       this.relationsToAdd = _.uniq(_.map(adds, pointerToId));
3273       this.relationsToRemove = _.uniq(_.map(removes, pointerToId));
3274     },
3275 
3276     /**
3277      * Returns an array of unfetched AV.Object that are being added to the
3278      * relation.
3279      * @return {Array}
3280      */
3281     added: function() {
3282       var self = this;
3283       return _.map(this.relationsToAdd, function(objectId) {
3284         var object = AV.Object._create(self._targetClassName);
3285         object.id = objectId;
3286         return object;
3287       });
3288     },
3289 
3290     /**
3291      * Returns an array of unfetched AV.Object that are being removed from
3292      * the relation.
3293      * @return {Array}
3294      */
3295     removed: function() {
3296       var self = this;
3297       return _.map(this.relationsToRemove, function(objectId) {
3298         var object = AV.Object._create(self._targetClassName);
3299         object.id = objectId;
3300         return object;
3301       });
3302     },
3303 
3304     /**
3305      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
3306      * @return {Object}
3307      */
3308     toJSON: function() {
3309       var adds = null;
3310       var removes = null;
3311       var self = this;
3312       var idToPointer = function(id) {
3313         return { __type: 'Pointer',
3314                  className: self._targetClassName,
3315                  objectId: id };
3316       };
3317       var pointers = null;
3318       if (this.relationsToAdd.length > 0) {
3319         pointers = _.map(this.relationsToAdd, idToPointer);
3320         adds = { "__op": "AddRelation", "objects": pointers };
3321       }
3322 
3323       if (this.relationsToRemove.length > 0) {
3324         pointers = _.map(this.relationsToRemove, idToPointer);
3325         removes = { "__op": "RemoveRelation", "objects": pointers };
3326       }
3327 
3328       if (adds && removes) {
3329         return { "__op": "Batch", "ops": [adds, removes]};
3330       }
3331 
3332       return adds || removes || {};
3333     },
3334 
3335     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
3336       if (!previous) {
3337         return this;
3338       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
3339         throw "You can't modify a relation after deleting it.";
3340       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Relation) {
3341         if (previous._targetClassName &&
3342             previous._targetClassName !== this._targetClassName) {
3343           throw "Related object must be of class " + previous._targetClassName +
3344               ", but " + this._targetClassName + " was passed in.";
3345         }
3346         var newAdd = _.union(_.difference(previous.relationsToAdd,
3347                                           this.relationsToRemove),
3348                              this.relationsToAdd);
3349         var newRemove = _.union(_.difference(previous.relationsToRemove,
3350                                              this.relationsToAdd),
3351                                 this.relationsToRemove);
3352 
3353         var newRelation = new AV.Op.Relation(newAdd, newRemove);
3354         newRelation._targetClassName = this._targetClassName;
3355         return newRelation;
3356       } else {
3357         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3358       }
3359     },
3360 
3361     _estimate: function(oldValue, object, key) {
3362       if (!oldValue) {
3363         var relation = new AV.Relation(object, key);
3364         relation.targetClassName = this._targetClassName;
3365       } else if (oldValue instanceof AV.Relation) {
3366         if (this._targetClassName) {
3367           if (oldValue.targetClassName) {
3368             if (oldValue.targetClassName !== this._targetClassName) {
3369               throw "Related object must be a " + oldValue.targetClassName +
3370                   ", but a " + this._targetClassName + " was passed in.";
3371             }
3372           } else {
3373             oldValue.targetClassName = this._targetClassName;
3374           }
3375         }
3376         return oldValue;
3377       } else {
3378         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3379       }
3380     }
3381   });
3382 
3383   AV.Op._registerDecoder("AddRelation", function(json) {
3384     return new AV.Op.Relation(AV._decode(undefined, json.objects), []);
3385   });
3386   AV.Op._registerDecoder("RemoveRelation", function(json) {
3387     return new AV.Op.Relation([], AV._decode(undefined, json.objects));
3388   });
3389 
3390 }(this));
3391 
3392 (function(root) {
3393   root.AV = root.AV || {};
3394   var AV = root.AV;
3395   var _ = AV._;
3396 
3397   /**
3398    * Creates a new Relation for the given parent object and key. This
3399    * constructor should rarely be used directly, but rather created by
3400    * AV.Object.relation.
3401    * @param {AV.Object} parent The parent of this relation.
3402    * @param {String} key The key for this relation on the parent.
3403    * @see AV.Object#relation
3404    * @class
3405    *
3406    * <p>
3407    * A class that is used to access all of the children of a many-to-many
3408    * relationship.  Each instance of AV.Relation is associated with a
3409    * particular parent object and key.
3410    * </p>
3411    */
3412   AV.Relation = function(parent, key) {
3413     this.parent = parent;
3414     this.key = key;
3415     this.targetClassName = null;
3416   };
3417 
3418   /**
3419    * Creates a query that can be used to query the parent objects in this relation.
3420    * @param {String} parentClass The parent class or name.
3421    * @param {String} relationKey The relation field key in parent.
3422    * @param {AV.Object} child The child object.
3423    * @return {AV.Query}
3424    */
3425   AV.Relation.reverseQuery = function(parentClass, relationKey, child){
3426     var query = new AV.Query(parentClass);
3427     query.equalTo(relationKey, child._toPointer());
3428     return query;
3429   };
3430 
3431   AV.Relation.prototype = {
3432     /**
3433      * Makes sure that this relation has the right parent and key.
3434      */
3435     _ensureParentAndKey: function(parent, key) {
3436       this.parent = this.parent || parent;
3437       this.key = this.key || key;
3438       if (this.parent !== parent) {
3439         throw "Internal Error. Relation retrieved from two different Objects.";
3440       }
3441       if (this.key !== key) {
3442         throw "Internal Error. Relation retrieved from two different keys.";
3443       }
3444     },
3445 
3446     /**
3447      * Adds a AV.Object or an array of AV.Objects to the relation.
3448      * @param {} objects The item or items to add.
3449      */
3450     add: function(objects) {
3451       if (!_.isArray(objects)) {
3452         objects = [objects];
3453       }
3454 
3455       var change = new AV.Op.Relation(objects, []);
3456       this.parent.set(this.key, change);
3457       this.targetClassName = change._targetClassName;
3458     },
3459 
3460     /**
3461      * Removes a AV.Object or an array of AV.Objects from this relation.
3462      * @param {} objects The item or items to remove.
3463      */
3464     remove: function(objects) {
3465       if (!_.isArray(objects)) {
3466         objects = [objects];
3467       }
3468 
3469       var change = new AV.Op.Relation([], objects);
3470       this.parent.set(this.key, change);
3471       this.targetClassName = change._targetClassName;
3472     },
3473 
3474     /**
3475      * Returns a JSON version of the object suitable for saving to disk.
3476      * @return {Object}
3477      */
3478     toJSON: function() {
3479       return { "__type": "Relation", "className": this.targetClassName };
3480     },
3481 
3482     /**
3483      * Returns a AV.Query that is limited to objects in this
3484      * relation.
3485      * @return {AV.Query}
3486      */
3487     query: function() {
3488       var targetClass;
3489       var query;
3490       if (!this.targetClassName) {
3491         targetClass = AV.Object._getSubclass(this.parent.className);
3492         query = new AV.Query(targetClass);
3493         query._extraOptions.redirectClassNameForKey = this.key;
3494       } else {
3495         targetClass = AV.Object._getSubclass(this.targetClassName);
3496         query = new AV.Query(targetClass);
3497       }
3498       query._addCondition("$relatedTo", "object", this.parent._toPointer());
3499       query._addCondition("$relatedTo", "key", this.key);
3500 
3501       return query;
3502     }
3503   };
3504 }(this));
3505 
3506 (function(root) {
3507   root.AV = root.AV || {};
3508   var AV = root.AV;
3509   var _ = AV._;
3510 
3511   /**
3512    * A Promise is returned by async methods as a hook to provide callbacks to be
3513    * called when the async task is fulfilled.
3514    *
3515    * <p>Typical usage would be like:<pre>
3516    *    query.find().then(function(results) {
3517    *      results[0].set("foo", "bar");
3518    *      return results[0].saveAsync();
3519    *    }).then(function(result) {
3520    *      console.log("Updated " + result.id);
3521    *    });
3522    * </pre></p>
3523    * <p>Another example:<pre>
3524    *    var promise = new AV.Promise(function(resolve, reject) {
3525    *      resolve(42);
3526    *    });
3527    *    promise.then(function(value){
3528    *      console.log(value);
3529    *    }).catch(function(error){
3530    *      console.error(error);
3531    *    });
3532    * </pre></p>
3533    * @param {Function} fn An optional function with two arguments resolve
3534    *                   and reject.The first argument fulfills the promise,
3535    *                   the second argument rejects it. We can call these
3536     *                  functions, once our operation is completed.
3537    * @see AV.Promise.prototype.then
3538    * @class
3539    */
3540   AV.Promise = function(fn) {
3541     this._resolved = false;
3542     this._rejected = false;
3543     this._resolvedCallbacks = [];
3544     this._rejectedCallbacks = [];
3545 
3546     this.doResolve(fn);
3547   };
3548 
3549   _.extend(AV.Promise, /** @lends AV.Promise */ {
3550 
3551     _isPromisesAPlusCompliant: false,
3552 
3553     /**
3554      * Returns true iff the given object fulfils the Promise interface.
3555      * @return {Boolean}
3556      */
3557     is: function(promise) {
3558       return promise && promise.then && _.isFunction(promise.then);
3559     },
3560 
3561     /**
3562      * Returns a new promise that is resolved with a given value.
3563      * @return {AV.Promise} the new promise.
3564      */
3565     as: function() {
3566       var promise = new AV.Promise();
3567       promise.resolve.apply(promise, arguments);
3568       return promise;
3569     },
3570 
3571     /**
3572      * Returns a new promise that is rejected with a given error.
3573      * @return {AV.Promise} the new promise.
3574      */
3575     error: function() {
3576       var promise = new AV.Promise();
3577       promise.reject.apply(promise, arguments);
3578       return promise;
3579     },
3580 
3581     /**
3582      * Returns a new promise that is fulfilled when all of the input promises
3583      * are resolved. If any promise in the list fails, then the returned promise
3584      * will fail with the last error. If they all succeed, then the returned
3585      * promise will succeed, with the results being the results of all the input
3586      * promises. For example: <pre>
3587      *   var p1 = AV.Promise.as(1);
3588      *   var p2 = AV.Promise.as(2);
3589      *   var p3 = AV.Promise.as(3);
3590      *
3591      *   AV.Promise.when(p1, p2, p3).then(function(r1, r2, r3) {
3592      *     console.log(r1);  // prints 1
3593      *     console.log(r2);  // prints 2
3594      *     console.log(r3);  // prints 3
3595      *   });</pre>
3596      *
3597      * The input promises can also be specified as an array: <pre>
3598      *   var promises = [p1, p2, p3];
3599      *   AV.Promise.when(promises).then(function(r1, r2, r3) {
3600      *     console.log(r1);  // prints 1
3601      *     console.log(r2);  // prints 2
3602      *     console.log(r3);  // prints 3
3603      *   });
3604      * </pre>
3605      * @param {Array} promises a list of promises to wait for.
3606      * @return {AV.Promise} the new promise.
3607      */
3608     when: function(promises) {
3609       // Allow passing in Promises as separate arguments instead of an Array.
3610       var objects;
3611       if (promises && AV._isNullOrUndefined(promises.length)) {
3612         objects = arguments;
3613       } else {
3614         objects = promises;
3615       }
3616       var isAll = _.last(arguments);
3617       isAll = AV._.isBoolean(isAll) ? isAll : false;
3618 
3619       var total = objects.length;
3620       var hadError = false;
3621       var results = [];
3622       var errors = [];
3623       results.length = objects.length;
3624       errors.length = objects.length;
3625 
3626       if (total === 0) {
3627         if(isAll) {
3628           return AV.Promise.as.call(this, results);
3629         } else {
3630           return AV.Promise.as.apply(this, results);
3631         }
3632       }
3633 
3634       var promise = new AV.Promise();
3635 
3636       var resolveOne = function(i) {
3637         total = total - 1;
3638         if(hadError && !promise._rejected && isAll) {
3639           promise.reject.call(promise, errors[i]);
3640           return;
3641         }
3642 
3643         if (total === 0) {
3644           if (hadError && !promise._rejected) {
3645             promise.reject.call(promise, errors);
3646           } else {
3647             if(isAll) {
3648               if(!promise._rejected) {
3649                 promise.resolve.call(promise, results);
3650               } else {
3651                 //It's rejected already, so we ignore it.
3652               }
3653             } else {
3654               promise.resolve.apply(promise, results);
3655             }
3656           }
3657         }
3658       };
3659 
3660       AV._arrayEach(objects, function(object, i) {
3661         if (AV.Promise.is(object)) {
3662           object.then(function(result) {
3663             results[i] = result;
3664             resolveOne(i);
3665           }, function(error) {
3666             errors[i] = error;
3667             hadError = true;
3668             resolveOne(i);
3669           });
3670         } else {
3671           results[i] = object;
3672           resolveOne(i);
3673         }
3674       });
3675 
3676       return promise;
3677     },
3678 
3679     /**
3680      * Returns a promise that resolves or rejects as soon as one
3681      * of the promises in the iterable resolves or rejects, with
3682      * the value or reason from that promise.Returns a new promise
3683      * that is fulfilled when one of the input promises.
3684      * For example: <pre>
3685      *   var p1 = AV.Promise.as(1);
3686      *   var p2 = AV.Promise.as(2);
3687      *   var p3 = AV.Promise.as(3);
3688      *
3689      *   AV.Promise.race(p1, p2, p3).then(function(result) {
3690      *     console.log(result);  // prints 1
3691      *   });</pre>
3692      *
3693      * The input promises can also be specified as an array: <pre>
3694      *   var promises = [p1, p2, p3];
3695      *   AV.Promise.when(promises).then(function(result) {
3696      *     console.log(result);  // prints 1
3697      *   });
3698      * </pre>
3699      * @param {Array} promises a list of promises to wait for.
3700      * @return {AV.Promise} the new promise.
3701      */
3702     race: function(promises) {
3703       // Allow passing in Promises as separate arguments instead of an Array.
3704       var objects;
3705       if (promises && AV._isNullOrUndefined(promises.length)) {
3706         objects = arguments;
3707       } else {
3708         objects = promises;
3709       }
3710 
3711       var total = objects.length;
3712       var hadError = false;
3713       var results = [];
3714       var errors = [];
3715 
3716       results.length = errors.length = objects.length;
3717 
3718       if (total === 0) {
3719         return AV.Promise.as.call(this);
3720       }
3721 
3722       var promise = new AV.Promise();
3723 
3724       var resolveOne = function(i) {
3725         if (!promise._resolved && !promise._rejected) {
3726           if (hadError) {
3727             promise.reject.call(promise, errors[i]);
3728           } else {
3729             promise.resolve.call(promise, results[i]);
3730           }
3731         }
3732       };
3733 
3734       AV._arrayEach(objects, function(object, i) {
3735         if (AV.Promise.is(object)) {
3736           object.then(function(result) {
3737             results[i] = result;
3738             resolveOne(i);
3739           }, function(error) {
3740             errors[i] = error;
3741             hadError = true;
3742             resolveOne(i);
3743           });
3744         } else {
3745           results[i] = object;
3746           resolveOne(i);
3747         }
3748       });
3749 
3750       return promise;
3751     },
3752 
3753     /**
3754      * Runs the given asyncFunction repeatedly, as long as the predicate
3755      * function returns a truthy value. Stops repeating if asyncFunction returns
3756      * a rejected promise.
3757      * @param {Function} predicate should return false when ready to stop.
3758      * @param {Function} asyncFunction should return a Promise.
3759      */
3760     _continueWhile: function(predicate, asyncFunction) {
3761       if (predicate()) {
3762         return asyncFunction().then(function() {
3763           return AV.Promise._continueWhile(predicate, asyncFunction);
3764         });
3765       }
3766       return AV.Promise.as();
3767     }
3768   });
3769 
3770   /**
3771    * Just like AV.Promise.when, but it calls resolveCallbck function
3772    * with one results array and calls rejectCallback function as soon as any one
3773    * of the input promises rejects.
3774    * @see AV.Promise.when
3775    */
3776   AV.Promise.all = function(promises) {
3777     return AV.Promise.when(promises, true);
3778   };
3779 
3780   _.extend(AV.Promise.prototype, /** @lends AV.Promise.prototype */ {
3781 
3782     /**
3783      * Marks this promise as fulfilled, firing any callbacks waiting on it.
3784      * @param {Object} result the result to pass to the callbacks.
3785      */
3786     resolve: function(result) {
3787       if (this._resolved || this._rejected) {
3788         throw "A promise was resolved even though it had already been " +
3789           (this._resolved ? "resolved" : "rejected") + ".";
3790       }
3791       this._resolved = true;
3792       this._result = arguments;
3793       var results = arguments;
3794       AV._arrayEach(this._resolvedCallbacks, function(resolvedCallback) {
3795         resolvedCallback.apply(this, results);
3796       });
3797       this._resolvedCallbacks = [];
3798       this._rejectedCallbacks = [];
3799     },
3800 
3801     doResolve: function(fn){
3802       if (!fn) return;
3803       var done = false;
3804       var self = this;
3805       try {
3806         fn(function (value) {
3807           if (done) return;
3808           done = true;
3809           self.resolve.call(self, value);
3810         }, function (reason) {
3811              if (done) return;
3812              done = true;
3813              self.reject.call(self, reason);
3814         })
3815       } catch (ex) {
3816         if (done) return;
3817         done = true;
3818         self.reject.call(self, ex);
3819       }
3820     },
3821 
3822     /**
3823      * Marks this promise as fulfilled, firing any callbacks waiting on it.
3824      * @param {Object} error the error to pass to the callbacks.
3825      */
3826     reject: function(error) {
3827       if (this._resolved || this._rejected) {
3828         throw "A promise was rejected even though it had already been " +
3829           (this._resolved ? "resolved" : "rejected") + ".";
3830       }
3831       this._rejected = true;
3832       this._error = error;
3833       AV._arrayEach(this._rejectedCallbacks, function(rejectedCallback) {
3834         rejectedCallback(error);
3835       });
3836       this._resolvedCallbacks = [];
3837       this._rejectedCallbacks = [];
3838     },
3839 
3840     /**
3841      * Adds callbacks to be called when this promise is fulfilled. Returns a new
3842      * Promise that will be fulfilled when the callback is complete. It allows
3843      * chaining. If the callback itself returns a Promise, then the one returned
3844      * by "then" will not be fulfilled until that one returned by the callback
3845      * is fulfilled.
3846      * @param {Function} resolvedCallback Function that is called when this
3847      * Promise is resolved. Once the callback is complete, then the Promise
3848      * returned by "then" will also be fulfilled.
3849      * @param {Function} rejectedCallback Function that is called when this
3850      * Promise is rejected with an error. Once the callback is complete, then
3851      * the promise returned by "then" with be resolved successfully. If
3852      * rejectedCallback is null, or it returns a rejected Promise, then the
3853      * Promise returned by "then" will be rejected with that error.
3854      * @return {AV.Promise} A new Promise that will be fulfilled after this
3855      * Promise is fulfilled and either callback has completed. If the callback
3856      * returned a Promise, then this Promise will not be fulfilled until that
3857      * one is.
3858      */
3859     then: function(resolvedCallback, rejectedCallback) {
3860       var promise = new AV.Promise();
3861 
3862       var wrappedResolvedCallback = function() {
3863         var result = arguments;
3864         if (resolvedCallback) {
3865           if (AV.Promise._isPromisesAPlusCompliant) {
3866             try {
3867               result = [resolvedCallback.apply(this, result)];
3868             } catch (e) {
3869               result = [AV.Promise.error(e)];
3870             }
3871           } else {
3872             result = [resolvedCallback.apply(this, result)];
3873           }
3874         }
3875         if (result.length === 1 && AV.Promise.is(result[0])) {
3876           result[0].then(function() {
3877             promise.resolve.apply(promise, arguments);
3878           }, function(error) {
3879             promise.reject(error);
3880           });
3881         } else {
3882           promise.resolve.apply(promise, result);
3883         }
3884       };
3885 
3886       var wrappedRejectedCallback = function(error) {
3887         var result = [];
3888         if (rejectedCallback) {
3889           if (AV.Promise._isPromisesAPlusCompliant) {
3890             try {
3891               result = [rejectedCallback(error)];
3892             } catch (e) {
3893               result = [AV.Promise.error(e)];
3894             }
3895           } else {
3896             result = [rejectedCallback(error)];
3897           }
3898           if (result.length === 1 && AV.Promise.is(result[0])) {
3899             result[0].then(function() {
3900               promise.resolve.apply(promise, arguments);
3901             }, function(error) {
3902               promise.reject(error);
3903             });
3904           } else {
3905             if (AV.Promise._isPromisesAPlusCompliant) {
3906               promise.resolve.apply(promise, result);
3907             } else {
3908               promise.reject(result[0]);
3909             }
3910           }
3911         } else {
3912           promise.reject(error);
3913         }
3914       };
3915 
3916       var runLater = function(func) {
3917         func.call();
3918       };
3919       if (AV.Promise._isPromisesAPlusCompliant) {
3920         if (typeof(setImmediate) !== 'undefined' && _.isFunction(setImmediate)) {
3921           runLater = setImmediate;
3922         } else if (typeof(setTimeout) !== 'undefined' && _.isFunction(setTimeout)) {
3923           runLater = function(func) {
3924             setTimeout(func, 0);
3925           }
3926         }
3927       }
3928 
3929       var self = this;
3930       if (this._resolved) {
3931         runLater(function() {
3932           wrappedResolvedCallback.apply(self, self._result);
3933         });
3934       } else if (this._rejected) {
3935         runLater(function() {
3936           wrappedRejectedCallback(self._error);
3937         });
3938       } else {
3939         this._resolvedCallbacks.push(wrappedResolvedCallback);
3940         this._rejectedCallbacks.push(wrappedRejectedCallback);
3941       }
3942 
3943       return promise;
3944     },
3945 
3946     /**
3947      * Add handlers to be called when the Promise object is rejected.
3948      *
3949      * @param {Function} rejectedCallback Function that is called when this
3950      *                   Promise is rejected with an error.
3951      * @return {AV.Promise} A new Promise that will be fulfilled after this
3952      *                   Promise is fulfilled and either callback has completed. If the callback
3953      * returned a Promise, then this Promise will not be fulfilled until that
3954      *                   one is.
3955      * @function
3956      */
3957     catch: function(onRejected) {
3958       return this.then(undefined, onRejected);
3959     },
3960 
3961     /**
3962      * Add handlers to be called when the promise
3963      * is either resolved or rejected
3964      */
3965     always: function(callback) {
3966       return this.then(callback, callback);
3967     },
3968 
3969     /**
3970      * Add handlers to be called when the Promise object is resolved
3971      */
3972     done: function(callback) {
3973       return this.then(callback);
3974     },
3975 
3976     /**
3977      * Add handlers to be called when the Promise object is rejected
3978      */
3979     fail: function(callback) {
3980       return this.then(null, callback);
3981     },
3982 
3983     /**
3984      * Run the given callbacks after this promise is fulfilled.
3985      * @param optionsOrCallback {} A Backbone-style options callback, or a
3986      * callback function. If this is an options object and contains a "model"
3987      * attributes, that will be passed to error callbacks as the first argument.
3988      * @param model {} If truthy, this will be passed as the first result of
3989      * error callbacks. This is for Backbone-compatability.
3990      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that will be resolved after the
3991      * callbacks are run, with the same result as this.
3992      */
3993     _thenRunCallbacks: function(optionsOrCallback, model) {
3994       var options;
3995       if (_.isFunction(optionsOrCallback)) {
3996         var callback = optionsOrCallback;
3997         options = {
3998           success: function(result) {
3999             callback(result, null);
4000           },
4001           error: function(error) {
4002             callback(null, error);
4003           }
4004         };
4005       } else {
4006         options = _.clone(optionsOrCallback);
4007       }
4008       options = options || {};
4009 
4010       return this.then(function(result) {
4011         if (options.success) {
4012           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
4013         } else if (model) {
4014           // When there's no callback, a sync event should be triggered.
4015           model.trigger('sync', model, result, options);
4016         }
4017         return AV.Promise.as.apply(AV.Promise, arguments);
4018       }, function(error) {
4019         if (options.error) {
4020           if (!_.isUndefined(model)) {
4021             options.error(model, error);
4022           } else {
4023             options.error(error);
4024           }
4025         } else if (model) {
4026           // When there's no error callback, an error event should be triggered.
4027           model.trigger('error', model, error, options);
4028         }
4029         // By explicitly returning a rejected Promise, this will work with
4030         // either jQuery or Promises/A semantics.
4031         return AV.Promise.error(error);
4032       });
4033     },
4034 
4035     /**
4036      * Adds a callback function that should be called regardless of whether
4037      * this promise failed or succeeded. The callback will be given either the
4038      * array of results for its first argument, or the error as its second,
4039      * depending on whether this Promise was rejected or resolved. Returns a
4040      * new Promise, like "then" would.
4041      * @param {Function} continuation the callback.
4042      */
4043     _continueWith: function(continuation) {
4044       return this.then(function() {
4045         return continuation(arguments, null);
4046       }, function(error) {
4047         return continuation(null, error);
4048       });
4049     }
4050 
4051   });
4052 
4053   /**
4054    * Alias of AV.Promise.prototype.always
4055    * @function
4056    * @see AV.Promise#always
4057    */
4058   AV.Promise.prototype.finally = AV.Promise.prototype.always;
4059 
4060   /**
4061    * Alias of AV.Promise.prototype.done
4062    * @function
4063    * @see AV.Promise#done
4064    */
4065   AV.Promise.prototype.try = AV.Promise.prototype.done;
4066 
4067 
4068 }(this));
4069 
4070 /*jshint bitwise:false *//*global FileReader: true, File: true */
4071 (function(root) {
4072   root.AV = root.AV || {};
4073   var AV = root.AV;
4074   var _ = AV._;
4075 
4076   var b64Digit = function(number) {
4077     if (number < 26) {
4078       return String.fromCharCode(65 + number);
4079     }
4080     if (number < 52) {
4081       return String.fromCharCode(97 + (number - 26));
4082     }
4083     if (number < 62) {
4084       return String.fromCharCode(48 + (number - 52));
4085     }
4086     if (number === 62) {
4087       return "+";
4088     }
4089     if (number === 63) {
4090       return "/";
4091     }
4092     throw "Tried to encode large digit " + number + " in base64.";
4093   };
4094 
4095   var encodeBase64 = function(array) {
4096     var chunks = [];
4097     chunks.length = Math.ceil(array.length / 3);
4098     _.times(chunks.length, function(i) {
4099       var b1 = array[i * 3];
4100       var b2 = array[i * 3 + 1] || 0;
4101       var b3 = array[i * 3 + 2] || 0;
4102 
4103       var has2 = (i * 3 + 1) < array.length;
4104       var has3 = (i * 3 + 2) < array.length;
4105 
4106       chunks[i] = [
4107         b64Digit((b1 >> 2) & 0x3F),
4108         b64Digit(((b1 << 4) & 0x30) | ((b2 >> 4) & 0x0F)),
4109         has2 ? b64Digit(((b2 << 2) & 0x3C) | ((b3 >> 6) & 0x03)) : "=",
4110         has3 ? b64Digit(b3 & 0x3F) : "="
4111       ].join("");
4112     });
4113     return chunks.join("");
4114   };
4115 
4116   // A list of file extensions to mime types as found here:
4117   // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/58510/using-net-how-can-you-find-the-
4118   //     mime-type-of-a-file-based-on-the-file-signature
4119   var mimeTypes = {
4120     ai: "application/postscript",
4121     aif: "audio/x-aiff",
4122     aifc: "audio/x-aiff",
4123     aiff: "audio/x-aiff",
4124     asc: "text/plain",
4125     atom: "application/atom+xml",
4126     au: "audio/basic",
4127     avi: "video/x-msvideo",
4128     bcpio: "application/x-bcpio",
4129     bin: "application/octet-stream",

4132     cgm: "image/cgm",
4133     "class": "application/octet-stream",

4137     css: "text/css",

4140     dir: "application/x-director",

4148           "document",

4150           "template",

4221     pic: "image/pict",
4222     pict: "image/pict",
4223     png: "image/png",
4224     pnm: "image/x-portable-anymap",

4230           "presentation",

4232           "template",

4234           "slideshow",

4303     xltx: "application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml." +
4304           "template",
4305     xlsm: "application/vnd.ms-excel.sheet.macroEnabled.12",
4306     xltm: "application/vnd.ms-excel.template.macroEnabled.12",
4307     xlam: "application/vnd.ms-excel.addin.macroEnabled.12",
4308     xlsb: "application/vnd.ms-excel.sheet.binary.macroEnabled.12",
4309     xslt: "application/xslt+xml",
4310     xul: "application/vnd.mozilla.xul+xml",

4315 
4316   /**
4317    * Reads a File using a FileReader.
4318    * @param file {File} the File to read.
4319    * @param type {String} (optional) the mimetype to override with.
4320    * @return {AV.Promise} A Promise that will be fulfilled with a
4321    *     base64-encoded string of the data and its mime type.
4322    */
4323   var readAsync = function(file, type) {
4324     var promise = new AV.Promise();
4325 
4326     if (typeof(FileReader) === "undefined") {
4327       return AV.Promise.error(new AV.Error(
4328           -1, "Attempted to use a FileReader on an unsupported browser."));
4329     }
4330 
4331     var reader = new FileReader();
4332     reader.onloadend = function() {
4333       if (reader.readyState !== 2) {
4334         promise.reject(new AV.Error(-1, "Error reading file."));
4335         return;
4336       }
4337 
4338       var dataURL = reader.result;
4339       var matches = /^data:([^;]*);base64,(.*)$/.exec(dataURL);
4340       if (!matches) {
4341         promise.reject(
4342             new AV.Error(-1, "Unable to interpret data URL: " + dataURL));
4343         return;
4344       }
4345 
4346       promise.resolve(matches[2], type || matches[1]);
4347     };
4348     reader.readAsDataURL(file);
4349     return promise;
4350   };
4351 
4352   /**
4353    * A AV.File is a local representation of a file that is saved to the AV
4354    * cloud.
4355    * @param name {String} The file's name. This will change to a unique value
4356    *     once the file has finished saving.
4357    * @param data {Array} The data for the file, as either:
4358    *     1. an Array of byte value Numbers, or
4359    *     2. an Object like { base64: "..." } with a base64-encoded String.
4360    *     3. a File object selected with a file upload control. (3) only works
4361    *        in Firefox 3.6+, Safari 6.0.2+, Chrome 7+, and IE 10+.
4362    *        For example:<pre>
4363    *     4.a Buffer object in Node.js runtime.
4364    * var fileUploadControl = $("#profilePhotoFileUpload")[0];
4365    * if (fileUploadControl.files.length > 0) {
4366    *   var file = fileUploadControl.files[0];
4367    *   var name = "photo.jpg";
4368    *   var parseFile = new AV.File(name, file);
4369    *   parseFile.save().then(function() {
4370    *     // The file has been saved to AV.
4371    *   }, function(error) {
4372    *     // The file either could not be read, or could not be saved to AV.
4373    *   });
4374    * }</pre>
4375    *
4376    * @class
4377    * @param type {String} Optional Content-Type header to use for the file. If
4378    *     this is omitted, the content type will be inferred from the name's
4379    *     extension.
4380    */
4381   AV.File = function(name, data, type) {
4382     this._name = name;
4383     var currentUser = AV.User.current();
4384     this._metaData = {
4385        owner: (currentUser !=null ? currentUser.id : 'unknown')
4386     };
4387 
4388     // Guess the content type from the extension if we need to.
4389     var extension = /\.([^.]*)$/.exec(name);
4390     if (extension) {
4391       extension = extension[1].toLowerCase();
4392     }
4393     var guessedType = type || mimeTypes[extension] || "text/plain";
4394     this._guessedType = guessedType;
4395 
4396     if (_.isArray(data)) {
4397       this._source = AV.Promise.as(encodeBase64(data), guessedType);
4398       this._metaData.size = data.length;
4399     } else if (data && data.base64) {
4400       this._source = AV.Promise.as(data.base64, guessedType);
4401     } else if (typeof(File) !== "undefined" && data instanceof File) {
4402       this._source = readAsync(data, type);
4403     } else if(AV._isNode && Buffer.isBuffer(data)) {
4404        this._source = AV.Promise.as(data.toString('base64'), guessedType);
4405        this._metaData.size = data.length;
4406     } else if (_.isString(data)) {
4407       throw "Creating a AV.File from a String is not yet supported.";
4408     }
4409   };
4410 
4411   /**
4412    * Creates a fresh AV.File object with exists url for saving to AVOS Cloud.
4413    * @param {String} name the file name
4414    * @param {String} url the file url.
4415    * @param {Object} metaData the file metadata object,it's optional.
4416    * @param {String} Optional Content-Type header to use for the file. If
4417    *     this is omitted, the content type will be inferred from the name's
4418    *     extension.
4419    * @return {AV.File} the file object
4420    */
4421   AV.File.withURL = function(name, url, metaData, type){
4422     if(!name || !url){
4423       throw "Please provide file name and url";
4424     }
4425     var file = new AV.File(name, null, type);
4426     //copy metaData properties to file.
4427     if(metaData){
4428       for(var prop in metaData){
4429         if(!file._metaData[prop])
4430           file._metaData[prop] = metaData[prop];
4431       }
4432     }
4433     file._url = url;
4434     //Mark the file is from external source.
4435     file._metaData['__source'] = 'external';
4436     return file;
4437   };
4438 
4439   /**
4440    * Creates a file object with exists objectId.
4441    * @param {String} objectId The objectId string
4442    * @return {AV.File} the file object
4443    */
4444   AV.File.createWithoutData = function(objectId){
4445     var file = new AV.File();
4446     file.id = objectId;
4447     return file;
4448   };
4449 
4450   AV.File.prototype = {
4451 
4452     /**
4453      * Returns the ACL for this file.
4454      * @returns {AV.ACL} An instance of AV.ACL.
4455      */
4456     getACL: function() {
4457       return this._acl;
4458     },
4459 
4460     /**
4461      * Sets the ACL to be used for this file.
4462      * @param {AV.ACL} acl An instance of AV.ACL.
4463      */
4464     setACL: function(acl) {
4465         if(!(acl instanceof AV.ACL)) {
4466           return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
4467                                "ACL must be a AV.ACL.");
4468         }
4469         this._acl = acl;
4470     },
4471 
4472     /**
4473      * Gets the name of the file. Before save is called, this is the filename
4474      * given by the user. After save is called, that name gets prefixed with a
4475      * unique identifier.
4476      */
4477     name: function() {
4478       return this._name;
4479     },
4480 
4481     /**
4482      * Gets the url of the file. It is only available after you save the file or
4483      * after you get the file from a AV.Object.
4484      * @return {String}
4485      */
4486     url: function() {
4487       return this._url;
4488     },
4489 
4490     /**
4491     * <p>Returns the file's metadata JSON object if no arguments is given.Returns the
4492     * metadata value if a key is given.Set metadata value if key and value are both given.</p>
4493     * <p><pre>
4494     *  var metadata = file.metaData(); //Get metadata JSON object.
4495     *  var size = file.metaData('size');  // Get the size metadata value.
4496     *  file.metaData('format', 'jpeg'); //set metadata attribute and value.
4497     *</pre></p>
4498     * @return {Object} The file's metadata JSON object.
4499     * @param {String} attr an optional metadata key.
4500     * @param {Object} value an optional metadata value.
4501     **/
4502     metaData: function(attr, value) {
4503       if(attr != null && value != null){
4504          this._metaData[attr] = value;
4505          return this;
4506       }else if(attr != null){
4507          return this._metaData[attr];
4508       }else{
4509         return this._metaData;
4510       }
4511     },
4512 
4513    /**
4514     * URL
4515     * @return {String} URL
4516     * @param {Number} width 
4517     * @param {Number} heigth 
4518     * @param {Number} quality 1-100100
4519     * @param {Number} scaleToFit true
4520     * @param {String} fmt pngjpeg,gif
4521     */
4522    thumbnailURL: function(width, height, quality, scaleToFit, fmt){
4523      if(!this.url()){
4524        throw "Invalid url.";
4525      }
4526      if(!width || !height || width<=0 || height <=0 ){
4527        throw "Invalid width or height value."
4528      }
4529      quality = quality || 100;
4530      scaleToFit = (scaleToFit == null) ? true: scaleToFit;
4531      if(quality<=0 || quality>100){
4532        throw "Invalid quality value."
4533      }
4534      fmt = fmt || 'png';
4535      var mode = scaleToFit ? 2: 1;
4536      return this.url() + '?imageView/' + mode + '/w/' + width + '/h/' + height
4537        + '/q/' + quality + '/format/' + fmt;
4538    },
4539 
4540     /**
4541     * Returns the file's size.
4542     * @return {Number} The file's size in bytes.
4543     **/
4544     size: function(){
4545       return this.metaData().size;
4546     },
4547 
4548     /**
4549      * Returns the file's owner.
4550      * @return {String} The file's owner id.
4551      */
4552     ownerId: function(){
4553       return this.metaData().owner;
4554     },
4555      /**
4556      * Destroy the file.
4557      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the destroy
4558      *     completes.
4559      */
4560     destroy: function(options){
4561       if(!this.id)
4562         return AV.Promise.error('The file id is not eixsts.')._thenRunCallbacks(options);
4563       var request = AV._request("files", null, this.id, 'DELETE');
4564       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
4565     },
4566 
4567     /**
4568      * Saves the file to the AV cloud.
4569      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
4570      * @return {AV.Promise} Promise that is resolved when the save finishes.
4571      */
4572     save: function(options) {
4573       var self = this;
4574       if (!self._previousSave) {
4575         if(self._source){
4576           if(AV._isNode){
4577             //Use qiniu sdk to upload files to qiniu.
4578             var qiniu = require('qiniu');
4579             var path = require('path');
4580             self._previousSave = self._source.then(function(base64, type) {
4581               //Create 16-bits uuid as qiniu key.
4582               var hexOctet = function() {
4583                 return Math.floor((1+Math.random())*0x10000).toString(16).substring(1);
4584               };
4585               var key = hexOctet() + hexOctet() + hexOctet() + hexOctet()
4586                           + path.extname(self._name);
4587               var data = {
4588                 key: key,
4589                 ACL: self._acl,
4590                 name:self._name,
4591                 mime_type: type,
4592                 metaData: self._metaData,
4593               };
4594               if(type && self._metaData.mime_type == null)
4595                 self._metaData.mime_type = type;
4596               self._qiniu_key = key;
4597               self._base64 = base64;
4598               return AV._request("qiniu", null, null, 'POST', data);
4599             }).then(function(response) {
4600               self._url = response.url;
4601               self._bucket = response.bucket;
4602               self.id = response.objectId;
4603               //Get the uptoken to upload files to qiniu.
4604               var uptoken = response.token;
4605               var promise = new AV.Promise();
4606               var extra = new qiniu.io.PutExtra();
4607               if(self._metaData.mime_type)
4608                 extra.mimeType = self._metaData.mime_type;
4609               var body = new Buffer(self._base64, 'base64');
4610               qiniu.io.put(uptoken, self._qiniu_key, body, extra, function(err, ret) {
4611                 delete self._qiniu_key;
4612                 delete self._base64;
4613                 if(!err) {
4614                    promise.resolve(self);
4615                 } else {
4616                    promise.reject(err);
4617                    //destroy this file object when upload fails.
4618                    self.destroy();
4619                 }
4620               });
4621               return promise;
4622             });
4623           } else {
4624             //use /files endpoint.
4625             self._previousSave = self._source.then(function(base64, type) {
4626               var data = {
4627                 base64: base64,
4628                 _ContentType: type,
4629                 ACL: self._acl,
