4630                 mime_type: type,
4631                 metaData: self._metaData,
4632               };
4633               return AV._request("files", self._name, null, 'POST', data);
4634             }).then(function(response) {
4635               self._name = response.name;
4636               self._url = response.url;
4637               self.id = response.objectId;
4638               if(response.size)
4639                 self._metaData.size = response.size;
4640               return self;
4641             });
4642           }
4643         } else if(self._url && self._metaData['__source'] == 'external') {
4644           //external link file.
4645           var data = {
4646             name: self._name,
4647             ACL: self._acl,
4648             metaData: self._metaData,
4649             mime_type: self._guessedType,
4650             url: self._url
4651           };
4652           self._previousSave = AV._request("files", self._name, null, 'POST', data).then(function(response) {
4653             self._name = response.name;
4654             self._url = response.url;
4655             self.id = response.objectId;
4656             if(response.size)
4657                 self._metaData.size = response.size;
4658             return self;
4659           });
4660         }
4661       }
4662       return self._previousSave._thenRunCallbacks(options);
4663     }
4664   };
4665 
4666 }(this));
4667 
4668 // AV.Object is analogous to the Java AVObject.
4669 // It also implements the same interface as a Backbone model.
4670 
4671 (function(root) {
4672   root.AV = root.AV || {};
4673   var AV = root.AV;
4674   var _ = AV._;
4675 
4676   /**
4677    * Creates a new model with defined attributes. A client id (cid) is
4678    * automatically generated and assigned for you.
4679    *
4680    * <p>You won't normally call this method directly.  It is recommended that
4681    * you use a subclass of <code>AV.Object</code> instead, created by calling
4682    * <code>extend</code>.</p>
4683    *
4684    * <p>However, if you don't want to use a subclass, or aren't sure which
4685    * subclass is appropriate, you can use this form:<pre>
4686    *     var object = new AV.Object("ClassName");
4687    * </pre>
4688    * That is basically equivalent to:<pre>
4689    *     var MyClass = AV.Object.extend("ClassName");
4690    *     var object = new MyClass();
4691    * </pre></p>
4692    *
4693    * @param {Object} attributes The initial set of data to store in the object.
4694    * @param {Object} options A set of Backbone-like options for creating the
4695    *     object.  The only option currently supported is "collection".
4696    * @see AV.Object.extend
4697    *
4698    * @class
4699    *
4700    * <p>The fundamental unit of AV data, which implements the Backbone Model
4701    * interface.</p>
4702    */
4703   AV.Object = function(attributes, options) {
4704     // Allow new AV.Object("ClassName") as a shortcut to _create.
4705     if (_.isString(attributes)) {
4706       return AV.Object._create.apply(this, arguments);
4707     }
4708 
4709     attributes = attributes || {};
4710     if (options && options.parse) {
4711       attributes = this.parse(attributes);
4712     }
4713     var defaults = AV._getValue(this, 'defaults');
4714     if (defaults) {
4715       attributes = _.extend({}, defaults, attributes);
4716     }
4717     if (options && options.collection) {
4718       this.collection = options.collection;
4719     }
4720 
4721     this._serverData = {};  // The last known data for this object from cloud.
4722     this._opSetQueue = [{}];  // List of sets of changes to the data.
4723     this.attributes = {};  // The best estimate of this's current data.
4724 
4725     this._hashedJSON = {};  // Hash of values of containers at last save.
4726     this._escapedAttributes = {};
4727     this.cid = _.uniqueId('c');
4728     this.changed = {};
4729     this._silent = {};
4730     this._pending = {};
4731     if (!this.set(attributes, {silent: true})) {
4732       throw new Error("Can't create an invalid AV.Object");
4733     }
4734     this.changed = {};
4735     this._silent = {};
4736     this._pending = {};
4737     this._hasData = true;
4738     this._previousAttributes = _.clone(this.attributes);
4739     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
4740   };
4741 
4742   /**
4743    * @lends AV.Object.prototype
4744    * @property {String} id The objectId of the AV Object.
4745    */
4746 
4747   /**
4748    * Saves the given list of AV.Object.
4749    * If any error is encountered, stops and calls the error handler.
4750    * There are two ways you can call this function.
4751    *
4752    * The Backbone way:<pre>
4753    *   AV.Object.saveAll([object1, object2, ...], {
4754    *     success: function(list) {
4755    *       // All the objects were saved.
4756    *     },
4757    *     error: function(error) {
4758    *       // An error occurred while saving one of the objects.
4759    *     },
4760    *   });
4761    * </pre>
4762    * A simplified syntax:<pre>
4763    *   AV.Object.saveAll([object1, object2, ...], function(list, error) {
4764    *     if (list) {
4765    *       // All the objects were saved.
4766    *     } else {
4767    *       // An error occurred.
4768    *     }
4769    *   });
4770    * </pre>
4771    *
4772    * @param {Array} list A list of <code>AV.Object</code>.
4773    * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style callback object.
4774    */
4775   AV.Object.saveAll = function(list, options) {
4776     return AV.Object._deepSaveAsync(list)._thenRunCallbacks(options);
4777   };
4778 
4779   // Attach all inheritable methods to the AV.Object prototype.
4780   _.extend(AV.Object.prototype, AV.Events,
4781            /** @lends AV.Object.prototype */ {
4782     _existed: false,
4783     _fetchWhenSave: false,
4784 
4785     /**
4786      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
4787      * initialization logic.
4788      */
4789     initialize: function(){},
4790 
4791    /**
4792      * Set whether to enable fetchWhenSave option when updating object.
4793      * When set true, SDK would fetch the latest object after saving.
4794      * Default is false.
4795      * @param {boolean} enable  true to enable fetchWhenSave option.
4796      */
4797     fetchWhenSave: function(enable){
4798       if (!_.isBoolean(enable)) {
4799         throw "Expect boolean value for fetchWhenSave";
4800       }
4801       this._fetchWhenSave = enable;
4802     },
4803 
4804    /**
4805     * Returns the object's objectId.
4806     * @return {String} the objectId.
4807     */
4808     getObjectId: function() {
4809       return this.id;
4810     },
4811 
4812    /**
4813     * Returns the object's createdAt attribute.
4814     * @return {Date}
4815     */
4816     getCreatedAt: function() {
4817       return this.createdAt || this.get('createdAt');
4818     },
4819 
4820    /**
4821     * Returns the object's updatedAt attribute.
4822     * @return {Date}
4823     */
4824     getUpdatedAt: function() {
4825       return this.updatedAt || this.get('updatedAt');
4826     },
4827 
4828     /**
4829      * Returns a JSON version of the object suitable for saving to AV.
4830      * @return {Object}
4831      */
4832     toJSON: function() {
4833       var json = this._toFullJSON();
4834       AV._arrayEach(["__type", "className"],
4835                        function(key) { delete json[key]; });
4836       return json;
4837     },
4838 
4839     _toFullJSON: function(seenObjects) {
4840       var json = _.clone(this.attributes);
4841       AV._objectEach(json, function(val, key) {
4842         json[key] = AV._encode(val, seenObjects);
4843       });
4844       AV._objectEach(this._operations, function(val, key) {
4845         json[key] = val;
4846       });
4847 
4848       if (_.has(this, "id")) {
4849         json.objectId = this.id;
4850       }
4851       if (_.has(this, "createdAt")) {
4852         if (_.isDate(this.createdAt)) {
4853           json.createdAt = this.createdAt.toJSON();
4854         } else {
4855           json.createdAt = this.createdAt;
4856         }
4857       }
4858 
4859       if (_.has(this, "updatedAt")) {
4860         if (_.isDate(this.updatedAt)) {
4861           json.updatedAt = this.updatedAt.toJSON();
4862         } else {
4863           json.updatedAt = this.updatedAt;
4864         }
4865       }
4866       json.__type = "Object";
4867       json.className = this.className;
4868       return json;
4869     },
4870 
4871     /**
4872      * Updates _hashedJSON to reflect the current state of this object.
4873      * Adds any changed hash values to the set of pending changes.
4874      */
4875     _refreshCache: function() {
4876       var self = this;
4877       if (self._refreshingCache) {
4878         return;
4879       }
4880       self._refreshingCache = true;
4881       AV._objectEach(this.attributes, function(value, key) {
4882         if (value instanceof AV.Object) {
4883           value._refreshCache();
4884         } else if (_.isObject(value)) {
4885           if (self._resetCacheForKey(key)) {
4886             self.set(key, new AV.Op.Set(value), { silent: true });
4887           }
4888         }
4889       });
4890       delete self._refreshingCache;
4891     },
4892 
4893     /**
4894      * Returns true if this object has been modified since its last
4895      * save/refresh.  If an attribute is specified, it returns true only if that
4896      * particular attribute has been modified since the last save/refresh.
4897      * @param {String} attr An attribute name (optional).
4898      * @return {Boolean}
4899      */
4900     dirty: function(attr) {
4901       this._refreshCache();
4902 
4903       var currentChanges = _.last(this._opSetQueue);
4904 
4905       if (attr) {
4906         return (currentChanges[attr] ? true : false);
4907       }
4908       if (!this.id) {
4909         return true;
4910       }
4911       if (_.keys(currentChanges).length > 0) {
4912         return true;
4913       }
4914       return false;
4915     },
4916 
4917     /**
4918      * Gets a Pointer referencing this Object.
4919      */
4920     _toPointer: function() {
4921       // if (!this.id) {
4922       //   throw new Error("Can't serialize an unsaved AV.Object");
4923       // }
4924       return { __type: "Pointer",
4925                className: this.className,
4926                objectId: this.id };
4927     },
4928 
4929     /**
4930      * Gets the value of an attribute.
4931      * @param {String} attr The string name of an attribute.
4932      */
4933     get: function(attr) {
4934       return this.attributes[attr];
4935     },
4936 
4937     /**
4938      * Gets a relation on the given class for the attribute.
4939      * @param String attr The attribute to get the relation for.
4940      */
4941     relation: function(attr) {
4942       var value = this.get(attr);
4943       if (value) {
4944         if (!(value instanceof AV.Relation)) {
4945           throw "Called relation() on non-relation field " + attr;
4946         }
4947         value._ensureParentAndKey(this, attr);
4948         return value;
4949       } else {
4950         return new AV.Relation(this, attr);
4951       }
4952     },
4953 
4954     /**
4955      * Gets the HTML-escaped value of an attribute.
4956      */
4957     escape: function(attr) {
4958       var html = this._escapedAttributes[attr];
4959       if (html) {
4960         return html;
4961       }
4962       var val = this.attributes[attr];
4963       var escaped;
4964       if (AV._isNullOrUndefined(val)) {
4965         escaped = '';
4966       } else {
4967         escaped = _.escape(val.toString());
4968       }
4969       this._escapedAttributes[attr] = escaped;
4970       return escaped;
4971     },
4972 
4973     /**
4974      * Returns <code>true</code> if the attribute contains a value that is not
4975      * null or undefined.
4976      * @param {String} attr The string name of the attribute.
4977      * @return {Boolean}
4978      */
4979     has: function(attr) {
4980       return !AV._isNullOrUndefined(this.attributes[attr]);
4981     },
4982 
4983     /**
4984      * Pulls "special" fields like objectId, createdAt, etc. out of attrs
4985      * and puts them on "this" directly.  Removes them from attrs.
4986      * @param attrs - A dictionary with the data for this AV.Object.
4987      */
4988     _mergeMagicFields: function(attrs) {
4989       // Check for changes of magic fields.
4990       var model = this;
4991       var specialFields = ["id", "objectId", "createdAt", "updatedAt"];
4992       AV._arrayEach(specialFields, function(attr) {
4993         if (attrs[attr]) {
4994           if (attr === "objectId") {
4995             model.id = attrs[attr];
4996           } else if ((attr === "createdAt" || attr === "updatedAt") &&
4997                      !_.isDate(attrs[attr])) {
4998             model[attr] = AV._parseDate(attrs[attr]);
4999           } else {
5000             model[attr] = attrs[attr];
5001           }
5002           delete attrs[attr];
5003         }
5004       });
5005     },
5006 
5007     /**
5008      * Returns the json to be sent to the server.
5009      */
5010     _startSave: function() {
5011       this._opSetQueue.push({});
5012     },
5013 
5014     /**
5015      * Called when a save fails because of an error. Any changes that were part
5016      * of the save need to be merged with changes made after the save. This
5017      * might throw an exception is you do conflicting operations. For example,
5018      * if you do:
5019      *   object.set("foo", "bar");
5020      *   object.set("invalid field name", "baz");
5021      *   object.save();
5022      *   object.increment("foo");
5023      * then this will throw when the save fails and the client tries to merge
5024      * "bar" with the +1.
5025      */
5026     _cancelSave: function() {
5027       var self = this;
5028       var failedChanges = _.first(this._opSetQueue);
5029       this._opSetQueue = _.rest(this._opSetQueue);
5030       var nextChanges = _.first(this._opSetQueue);
5031       AV._objectEach(failedChanges, function(op, key) {
5032         var op1 = failedChanges[key];
5033         var op2 = nextChanges[key];
5034         if (op1 && op2) {
5035           nextChanges[key] = op2._mergeWithPrevious(op1);
5036         } else if (op1) {
5037           nextChanges[key] = op1;
5038         }
5039       });
5040       this._saving = this._saving - 1;
5041     },
5042 
5043     /**
5044      * Called when a save completes successfully. This merges the changes that
5045      * were saved into the known server data, and overrides it with any data
5046      * sent directly from the server.
5047      */
5048     _finishSave: function(serverData) {
5049       // Grab a copy of any object referenced by this object. These instances
5050       // may have already been fetched, and we don't want to lose their data.
5051       // Note that doing it like this means we will unify separate copies of the
5052       // same object, but that's a risk we have to take.
5053       var fetchedObjects = {};
5054       AV._traverse(this.attributes, function(object) {
5055         if (object instanceof AV.Object && object.id && object._hasData) {
5056           fetchedObjects[object.id] = object;
5057         }
5058       });
5059 
5060       var savedChanges = _.first(this._opSetQueue);
5061       this._opSetQueue = _.rest(this._opSetQueue);
5062       this._applyOpSet(savedChanges, this._serverData);
5063       this._mergeMagicFields(serverData);
5064       var self = this;
5065       AV._objectEach(serverData, function(value, key) {
5066         self._serverData[key] = AV._decode(key, value);
5067 
5068         // Look for any objects that might have become unfetched and fix them
5069         // by replacing their values with the previously observed values.
5070         var fetched = AV._traverse(self._serverData[key], function(object) {
5071           if (object instanceof AV.Object && fetchedObjects[object.id]) {
5072             return fetchedObjects[object.id];
5073           }
5074         });
5075         if (fetched) {
5076           self._serverData[key] = fetched;
5077         }
5078       });
5079       this._rebuildAllEstimatedData();
5080       this._saving = this._saving - 1;
5081     },
5082 
5083     /**
5084      * Called when a fetch or login is complete to set the known server data to
5085      * the given object.
5086      */
5087     _finishFetch: function(serverData, hasData) {
5088       // Clear out any changes the user might have made previously.
5089       this._opSetQueue = [{}];
5090 
5091       // Bring in all the new server data.
5092       this._mergeMagicFields(serverData);
5093       var self = this;
5094       AV._objectEach(serverData, function(value, key) {
5095         self._serverData[key] = AV._decode(key, value);
5096       });
5097 
5098       // Refresh the attributes.
5099       this._rebuildAllEstimatedData();
5100 
5101       // Clear out the cache of mutable containers.
5102       this._refreshCache();
5103       this._opSetQueue = [{}];
5104 
5105       this._hasData = hasData;
5106     },
5107 
5108     /**
5109      * Applies the set of AV.Op in opSet to the object target.
5110      */
5111     _applyOpSet: function(opSet, target) {
5112       var self = this;
5113       AV._objectEach(opSet, function(change, key) {
5114         target[key] = change._estimate(target[key], self, key);
5115         if (target[key] === AV.Op._UNSET) {
5116           delete target[key];
5117         }
5118       });
5119     },
5120 
5121     /**
5122      * Replaces the cached value for key with the current value.
5123      * Returns true if the new value is different than the old value.
5124      */
5125     _resetCacheForKey: function(key) {
5126       var value = this.attributes[key];
5127       if (_.isObject(value) &&
5128           !(value instanceof AV.Object) &&
5129           !(value instanceof AV.File)) {
5130 
5131         value = value.toJSON ? value.toJSON() : value;
5132         var json = JSON.stringify(value);
5133         if (this._hashedJSON[key] !== json) {
5134           var wasSet = !! this._hashedJSON[key];
5135           this._hashedJSON[key] = json;
5136           return wasSet;
5137         }
5138       }
5139       return false;
5140     },
5141 
5142     /**
5143      * Populates attributes[key] by starting with the last known data from the
5144      * server, and applying all of the local changes that have been made to that
5145      * key since then.
5146      */
5147     _rebuildEstimatedDataForKey: function(key) {
5148       var self = this;
5149       delete this.attributes[key];
5150       if (this._serverData[key]) {
5151         this.attributes[key] = this._serverData[key];
5152       }
5153       AV._arrayEach(this._opSetQueue, function(opSet) {
5154         var op = opSet[key];
5155         if (op) {
5156           self.attributes[key] = op._estimate(self.attributes[key], self, key);
5157           if (self.attributes[key] === AV.Op._UNSET) {
5158             delete self.attributes[key];
5159           } else {
5160             self._resetCacheForKey(key);
5161           }
5162         }
5163       });
5164     },
5165 
5166     /**
5167      * Populates attributes by starting with the last known data from the
5168      * server, and applying all of the local changes that have been made since
5169      * then.
5170      */
5171     _rebuildAllEstimatedData: function() {
5172       var self = this;
5173 
5174       var previousAttributes = _.clone(this.attributes);
5175 
5176       this.attributes = _.clone(this._serverData);
5177       AV._arrayEach(this._opSetQueue, function(opSet) {
5178         self._applyOpSet(opSet, self.attributes);
5179         AV._objectEach(opSet, function(op, key) {
5180           self._resetCacheForKey(key);
5181         });
5182       });
5183 
5184       // Trigger change events for anything that changed because of the fetch.
5185       AV._objectEach(previousAttributes, function(oldValue, key) {
5186         if (self.attributes[key] !== oldValue) {
5187           self.trigger('change:' + key, self, self.attributes[key], {});
5188         }
5189       });
5190       AV._objectEach(this.attributes, function(newValue, key) {
5191         if (!_.has(previousAttributes, key)) {
5192           self.trigger('change:' + key, self, newValue, {});
5193         }
5194       });
5195     },
5196 
5197     /**
5198      * Sets a hash of model attributes on the object, firing
5199      * <code>"change"</code> unless you choose to silence it.
5200      *
5201      * <p>You can call it with an object containing keys and values, or with one
5202      * key and value.  For example:<pre>
5203      *   gameTurn.set({
5204      *     player: player1,
5205      *     diceRoll: 2
5206      *   }, {
5207      *     error: function(gameTurnAgain, error) {
5208      *       // The set failed validation.
5209      *     }
5210      *   });
5211      *
5212      *   game.set("currentPlayer", player2, {
5213      *     error: function(gameTurnAgain, error) {
5214      *       // The set failed validation.
5215      *     }
5216      *   });
5217      *
5218      *   game.set("finished", true);</pre></p>
5219      *
5220      * @param {String} key The key to set.
5221      * @param {} value The value to give it.
5222      * @param {Object} options A set of Backbone-like options for the set.
5223      *     The only supported options are <code>silent</code>,
5224      *     <code>error</code>, and <code>promise</code>.
5225      * @return {Boolean} true if the set succeeded.
5226      * @see AV.Object#validate
5227      * @see AV.Error
5228      */
5229     set: function(key, value, options) {
5230       var attrs, attr;
5231       if (_.isObject(key) || AV._isNullOrUndefined(key)) {
5232         attrs = key;
5233         AV._objectEach(attrs, function(v, k) {
5234           attrs[k] = AV._decode(k, v);
5235         });
5236         options = value;
5237       } else {
5238         attrs = {};
5239         attrs[key] = AV._decode(key, value);
5240       }
5241 
5242       // Extract attributes and options.
5243       options = options || {};
5244       if (!attrs) {
5245         return this;
5246       }
5247       if (attrs instanceof AV.Object) {
5248         attrs = attrs.attributes;
5249       }
5250 
5251       // If the unset option is used, every attribute should be a Unset.
5252       if (options.unset) {
5253         AV._objectEach(attrs, function(unused_value, key) {
5254           attrs[key] = new AV.Op.Unset();
5255         });
5256       }
5257 
5258       // Apply all the attributes to get the estimated values.
5259       var dataToValidate = _.clone(attrs);
5260       var self = this;
5261       AV._objectEach(dataToValidate, function(value, key) {
5262         if (value instanceof AV.Op) {
5263           dataToValidate[key] = value._estimate(self.attributes[key],
5264                                                 self, key);
5265           if (dataToValidate[key] === AV.Op._UNSET) {
5266             delete dataToValidate[key];
5267           }
5268         }
5269       });
5270 
5271       // Run validation.
5272       if (!this._validate(attrs, options)) {
5273         return false;
5274       }
5275 
5276       this._mergeMagicFields(attrs);
5277 
5278       options.changes = {};
5279       var escaped = this._escapedAttributes;
5280       var prev = this._previousAttributes || {};
5281 
5282       // Update attributes.
5283       AV._arrayEach(_.keys(attrs), function(attr) {
5284         var val = attrs[attr];
5285 
5286         // If this is a relation object we need to set the parent correctly,
5287         // since the location where it was parsed does not have access to
5288         // this object.
5289         if (val instanceof AV.Relation) {
5290           val.parent = self;
5291         }
5292 
5293         if (!(val instanceof AV.Op)) {
5294           val = new AV.Op.Set(val);
5295         }
5296 
5297         // See if this change will actually have any effect.
5298         var isRealChange = true;
5299         if (val instanceof AV.Op.Set &&
5300             _.isEqual(self.attributes[attr], val.value)) {
5301           isRealChange = false;
5302         }
5303 
5304         if (isRealChange) {
5305           delete escaped[attr];
5306           if (options.silent) {
5307             self._silent[attr] = true;
5308           } else {
5309             options.changes[attr] = true;
5310           }
5311         }
5312 
5313         var currentChanges = _.last(self._opSetQueue);
5314         currentChanges[attr] = val._mergeWithPrevious(currentChanges[attr]);
5315         self._rebuildEstimatedDataForKey(attr);
5316 
5317         if (isRealChange) {
5318           self.changed[attr] = self.attributes[attr];
5319           if (!options.silent) {
5320             self._pending[attr] = true;
5321           }
5322         } else {
5323           delete self.changed[attr];
5324           delete self._pending[attr];
5325         }
5326       });
5327 
5328       if (!options.silent) {
5329         this.change(options);
5330       }
5331       return this;
5332     },
5333 
5334     /**
5335      * Remove an attribute from the model, firing <code>"change"</code> unless
5336      * you choose to silence it. This is a noop if the attribute doesn't
5337      * exist.
5338      */
5339     unset: function(attr, options) {
5340       options = options || {};
5341       options.unset = true;
5342       return this.set(attr, null, options);
5343     },
5344 
5345     /**
5346      * Atomically increments the value of the given attribute the next time the
5347      * object is saved. If no amount is specified, 1 is used by default.
5348      *
5349      * @param attr {String} The key.
5350      * @param amount {Number} The amount to increment by.
5351      */
5352     increment: function(attr, amount) {
5353       if (_.isUndefined(amount) || _.isNull(amount)) {
5354         amount = 1;
5355       }
5356       return this.set(attr, new AV.Op.Increment(amount));
5357     },
5358 
5359     /**
5360      * Atomically add an object to the end of the array associated with a given
5361      * key.
5362      * @param attr {String} The key.
5363      * @param item {} The item to add.
5364      */
5365     add: function(attr, item) {
5366       return this.set(attr, new AV.Op.Add([item]));
5367     },
5368 
5369     /**
5370      * Atomically add an object to the array associated with a given key, only
5371      * if it is not already present in the array. The position of the insert is
5372      * not guaranteed.
5373      *
5374      * @param attr {String} The key.
5375      * @param item {} The object to add.
5376      */
5377     addUnique: function(attr, item) {
5378       return this.set(attr, new AV.Op.AddUnique([item]));
5379     },
5380 
5381     /**
5382      * Atomically remove all instances of an object from the array associated
5383      * with a given key.
5384      *
5385      * @param attr {String} The key.
5386      * @param item {} The object to remove.
5387      */
5388     remove: function(attr, item) {
5389       return this.set(attr, new AV.Op.Remove([item]));
5390     },
5391 
5392     /**
5393      * Returns an instance of a subclass of AV.Op describing what kind of
5394      * modification has been performed on this field since the last time it was
5395      * saved. For example, after calling object.increment("x"), calling
5396      * object.op("x") would return an instance of AV.Op.Increment.
5397      *
5398      * @param attr {String} The key.
5399      * @returns {AV.Op} The operation, or undefined if none.
5400      */
5401     op: function(attr) {
5402       return _.last(this._opSetQueue)[attr];
5403     },
5404 
5405     /**
5406      * Clear all attributes on the model, firing <code>"change"</code> unless
5407      * you choose to silence it.
5408      */
5409     clear: function(options) {
5410       options = options || {};
5411       options.unset = true;
5412       var keysToClear = _.extend(this.attributes, this._operations);
5413       return this.set(keysToClear, options);
5414     },
5415 
5416     /**
5417      * Returns a JSON-encoded set of operations to be sent with the next save
5418      * request.
5419      */
5420     _getSaveJSON: function() {
5421       var json = _.clone(_.first(this._opSetQueue));
5422       AV._objectEach(json, function(op, key) {
5423         json[key] = op.toJSON();
5424       });
5425       return json;
5426     },
5427 
5428     /**
5429      * Returns true if this object can be serialized for saving.
5430      */
5431     _canBeSerialized: function() {
5432       return AV.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue(this.attributes);
5433     },
5434 
5435     /**
5436      * Fetch the model from the server. If the server's representation of the
5437      * model differs from its current attributes, they will be overriden,
5438      * triggering a <code>"change"</code> event.
5439      * @param {Object} fetchOptions Optional options to set 'keys' and
5440      *      'include' option.
5441      * @param {Object} options Optional Backbone-like options object to be
5442      *     passed in to set.
5443      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the fetch
5444      *     completes.
5445      */
5446     fetch: function() {
5447       var options = null;
5448       var fetchOptions = {};
5449       if(arguments.length === 1) {
5450         options = arguments[0];
5451       } else if(arguments.length === 2) {
5452         fetchOptions = arguments[0];
5453         options = arguments[1];
5454       }
5455 
5456       var self = this;
5457       var request = AV._request("classes", this.className, this.id, 'GET',
5458                                 fetchOptions);
5459       return request.then(function(response, status, xhr) {
5460         self._finishFetch(self.parse(response, status, xhr), true);
5461         return self;
5462       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
5463     },
5464 
5465     /**
5466      * Set a hash of model attributes, and save the model to the server.
5467      * updatedAt will be updated when the request returns.
5468      * You can either call it as:<pre>
5469      *   object.save();</pre>
5470      * or<pre>
5471      *   object.save(null, options);</pre>
5472      * or<pre>
5473      *   object.save(attrs, options);</pre>
5474      * or<pre>
5475      *   object.save(key, value, options);</pre>
5476      *
5477      * For example, <pre>
5478      *   gameTurn.save({
5479      *     player: "Jake Cutter",
5480      *     diceRoll: 2
5481      *   }, {
5482      *     success: function(gameTurnAgain) {
5483      *       // The save was successful.
5484      *     },
5485      *     error: function(gameTurnAgain, error) {
5486      *       // The save failed.  Error is an instance of AV.Error.
5487      *     }
5488      *   });</pre>
5489      * or with promises:<pre>
5490      *   gameTurn.save({
5491      *     player: "Jake Cutter",
5492      *     diceRoll: 2
5493      *   }).then(function(gameTurnAgain) {
5494      *     // The save was successful.
5495      *   }, function(error) {
5496      *     // The save failed.  Error is an instance of AV.Error.
5497      *   });</pre>
5498      *
5499      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the save
5500      *     completes.
5501      * @see AV.Error
5502      */
5503     save: function(arg1, arg2, arg3) {
5504       var i, attrs, current, options, saved;
5505       if (_.isObject(arg1) || AV._isNullOrUndefined(arg1)) {
5506         attrs = arg1;
5507         options = arg2;
5508       } else {
5509         attrs = {};
5510         attrs[arg1] = arg2;
5511         options = arg3;
5512       }
5513 
5514       // Make save({ success: function() {} }) work.
5515       if (!options && attrs) {
5516         var extra_keys = _.reject(attrs, function(value, key) {
5517           return _.include(["success", "error", "wait"], key);
5518         });
5519         if (extra_keys.length === 0) {
5520           var all_functions = true;
5521           if (_.has(attrs, "success") && !_.isFunction(attrs.success)) {
5522             all_functions = false;
5523           }
5524           if (_.has(attrs, "error") && !_.isFunction(attrs.error)) {
5525             all_functions = false;
5526           }
5527           if (all_functions) {
5528             // This attrs object looks like it's really an options object,
5529             // and there's no other options object, so let's just use it.
5530             return this.save(null, attrs);
5531           }
5532         }
5533       }
5534 
5535       options = _.clone(options) || {};
5536       if (options.wait) {
5537         current = _.clone(this.attributes);
5538       }
5539 
5540       var setOptions = _.clone(options) || {};
5541       if (setOptions.wait) {
5542         setOptions.silent = true;
5543       }
5544       var setError;
5545       setOptions.error = function(model, error) {
5546         setError = error;
5547       };
5548       if (attrs && !this.set(attrs, setOptions)) {
5549         return AV.Promise.error(setError)._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
5550       }
5551 
5552       var model = this;
5553 
5554       // If there is any unsaved child, save it first.
5555       model._refreshCache();
5556 
5557 
5558 
5559       var unsavedChildren = [];
5560       var unsavedFiles = [];
5561       AV.Object._findUnsavedChildren(model.attributes,
5562                                         unsavedChildren,
5563                                         unsavedFiles);
5564       if (unsavedChildren.length + unsavedFiles.length > 0) {
5565         return AV.Object._deepSaveAsync(this.attributes, model).then(function() {
5566           return model.save(null, options);
5567         }, function(error) {
5568           return AV.Promise.error(error)._thenRunCallbacks(options, model);
5569         });
5570       }
5571 
5572       this._startSave();
5573       this._saving = (this._saving || 0) + 1;
5574 
5575       this._allPreviousSaves = this._allPreviousSaves || AV.Promise.as();
5576       this._allPreviousSaves = this._allPreviousSaves._continueWith(function() {
5577         var method = model.id ? 'PUT' : 'POST';
5578 
5579         var json = model._getSaveJSON();
5580 
5581         if(method === 'PUT' && model._fetchWhenSave){
5582           //Sepcial-case fetchWhenSave when updating object.
5583           json._fetchWhenSave = true;
5584         }
5585 
5586         var route = "classes";
5587         var className = model.className;
5588         if (model.className === "_User" && !model.id) {
5589           // Special-case user sign-up.
5590           route = "users";
5591           className = null;
5592         }
5593         //hook makeRequest in options.
5594         var makeRequest = options._makeRequest || AV._request;
5595         var request = makeRequest(route, className, model.id, method, json);
5596 
5597         request = request.then(function(resp, status, xhr) {
5598           var serverAttrs = model.parse(resp, status, xhr);
5599           if (options.wait) {
5600             serverAttrs = _.extend(attrs || {}, serverAttrs);
5601           }
5602           model._finishSave(serverAttrs);
5603           if (options.wait) {
5604             model.set(current, setOptions);
5605           }
5606           return model;
5607 
5608         }, function(error) {
5609           model._cancelSave();
5610           return AV.Promise.error(error);
5611 
5612         })._thenRunCallbacks(options, model);
5613 
5614         return request;
5615       });
5616       return this._allPreviousSaves;
5617     },
5618 
5619     /**
5620      * Destroy this model on the server if it was already persisted.
5621      * Optimistically removes the model from its collection, if it has one.
5622      * If `wait: true` is passed, waits for the server to respond
5623      * before removal.
5624      *
5625      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the destroy
5626      *     completes.
5627      */
5628     destroy: function(options) {
5629       options = options || {};
5630       var model = this;
5631 
5632       var triggerDestroy = function() {
5633         model.trigger('destroy', model, model.collection, options);
5634       };
5635 
5636       if (!this.id) {
5637         return triggerDestroy();
5638       }
5639 
5640       if (!options.wait) {
5641         triggerDestroy();
5642       }
5643 
5644       var request =
5645           AV._request("classes", this.className, this.id, 'DELETE');
5646       return request.then(function() {
5647         if (options.wait) {
5648           triggerDestroy();
5649         }
5650         return model;
5651       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
5652     },
5653 
5654     /**
5655      * Converts a response into the hash of attributes to be set on the model.
5656      * @ignore
5657      */
5658     parse: function(resp, status, xhr) {
5659       var output = _.clone(resp);
5660       _(["createdAt", "updatedAt"]).each(function(key) {
5661         if (output[key]) {
5662           output[key] = AV._parseDate(output[key]);
5663         }
5664       });
5665       if (!output.updatedAt) {
5666         output.updatedAt = output.createdAt;
5667       }
5668       if (status) {
5669         this._existed = (status !== 201);
5670       }
5671       return output;
5672     },
5673 
5674     /**
5675      * Creates a new model with identical attributes to this one.
5676      * @return {AV.Object}
5677      */
5678     clone: function() {
5679       return new this.constructor(this.attributes);
5680     },
5681 
5682     /**
5683      * Returns true if this object has never been saved to AV.
5684      * @return {Boolean}
5685      */
5686     isNew: function() {
5687       return !this.id;
5688     },
5689 
5690     /**
5691      * Call this method to manually fire a `"change"` event for this model and
5692      * a `"change:attribute"` event for each changed attribute.
5693      * Calling this will cause all objects observing the model to update.
5694      */
5695     change: function(options) {
5696       options = options || {};
5697       var changing = this._changing;
5698       this._changing = true;
5699 
5700       // Silent changes become pending changes.
5701       var self = this;
5702       AV._objectEach(this._silent, function(attr) {
5703         self._pending[attr] = true;
5704       });
5705 
5706       // Silent changes are triggered.
5707       var changes = _.extend({}, options.changes, this._silent);
5708       this._silent = {};
5709       AV._objectEach(changes, function(unused_value, attr) {
5710         self.trigger('change:' + attr, self, self.get(attr), options);
5711       });
5712       if (changing) {
5713         return this;
5714       }
5715 
5716       // This is to get around lint not letting us make a function in a loop.
5717       var deleteChanged = function(value, attr) {
5718         if (!self._pending[attr] && !self._silent[attr]) {
5719           delete self.changed[attr];
5720         }
5721       };
5722 
5723       // Continue firing `"change"` events while there are pending changes.
5724       while (!_.isEmpty(this._pending)) {
5725         this._pending = {};
5726         this.trigger('change', this, options);
5727         // Pending and silent changes still remain.
5728         AV._objectEach(this.changed, deleteChanged);
5729         self._previousAttributes = _.clone(this.attributes);
5730       }
5731 
5732       this._changing = false;
5733       return this;
5734     },
5735 
5736     /**
5737      * Returns true if this object was created by the AV server when the
5738      * object might have already been there (e.g. in the case of a Facebook
5739      * login)
5740      */
5741     existed: function() {
5742       return this._existed;
5743     },
5744 
5745     /**
5746      * Determine if the model has changed since the last <code>"change"</code>
5747      * event.  If you specify an attribute name, determine if that attribute
5748      * has changed.
5749      * @param {String} attr Optional attribute name
5750      * @return {Boolean}
5751      */
5752     hasChanged: function(attr) {
5753       if (!arguments.length) {
5754         return !_.isEmpty(this.changed);
5755       }
5756       return this.changed && _.has(this.changed, attr);
5757     },
5758 
5759     /**
5760      * Returns an object containing all the attributes that have changed, or
5761      * false if there are no changed attributes. Useful for determining what
5762      * parts of a view need to be updated and/or what attributes need to be
5763      * persisted to the server. Unset attributes will be set to undefined.
5764      * You can also pass an attributes object to diff against the model,
5765      * determining if there *would be* a change.
5766      */
5767     changedAttributes: function(diff) {
5768       if (!diff) {
5769         return this.hasChanged() ? _.clone(this.changed) : false;
5770       }
5771       var changed = {};
5772       var old = this._previousAttributes;
5773       AV._objectEach(diff, function(diffVal, attr) {
5774         if (!_.isEqual(old[attr], diffVal)) {
5775           changed[attr] = diffVal;
5776         }
5777       });
5778       return changed;
5779     },
5780 
5781     /**
5782      * Gets the previous value of an attribute, recorded at the time the last
5783      * <code>"change"</code> event was fired.
5784      * @param {String} attr Name of the attribute to get.
5785      */
5786     previous: function(attr) {
5787       if (!arguments.length || !this._previousAttributes) {
5788         return null;
5789       }
5790       return this._previousAttributes[attr];
5791     },
5792 
5793     /**
5794      * Gets all of the attributes of the model at the time of the previous
5795      * <code>"change"</code> event.
5796      * @return {Object}
5797      */
5798     previousAttributes: function() {
5799       return _.clone(this._previousAttributes);
5800     },
5801 
5802     /**
5803      * Checks if the model is currently in a valid state. It's only possible to
5804      * get into an *invalid* state if you're using silent changes.
5805      * @return {Boolean}
5806      */
5807     isValid: function() {
5808       return !this.validate(this.attributes);
5809     },
5810 
5811     /**
5812      * You should not call this function directly unless you subclass
5813      * <code>AV.Object</code>, in which case you can override this method
5814      * to provide additional validation on <code>set</code> and
5815      * <code>save</code>.  Your implementation should return
5816      *
5817      * @param {Object} attrs The current data to validate.
5818      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-like options object.
5819      * @return {} False if the data is valid.  An error object otherwise.
5820      * @see AV.Object#set
5821      */
5822     validate: function(attrs, options) {
5823       if (_.has(attrs, "ACL") && !(attrs.ACL instanceof AV.ACL)) {
5824         return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
5825                                "ACL must be a AV.ACL.");
5826       }
5827       return false;
5828     },
5829 
5830     /**
5831      * Run validation against a set of incoming attributes, returning `true`
5832      * if all is well. If a specific `error` callback has been passed,
5833      * call that instead of firing the general `"error"` event.
5834      */
5835     _validate: function(attrs, options) {
5836       if (options.silent || !this.validate) {
5837         return true;
5838       }
5839       attrs = _.extend({}, this.attributes, attrs);
5840       var error = this.validate(attrs, options);
5841       if (!error) {
5842         return true;
5843       }
5844       if (options && options.error) {
5845         options.error(this, error, options);
5846       } else {
5847         this.trigger('error', this, error, options);
5848       }
5849       return false;
5850     },
5851 
5852     /**
5853      * Returns the ACL for this object.
5854      * @returns {AV.ACL} An instance of AV.ACL.
5855      * @see AV.Object#get
5856      */
5857     getACL: function() {
5858       return this.get("ACL");
5859     },
5860 
5861     /**
5862      * Sets the ACL to be used for this object.
5863      * @param {AV.ACL} acl An instance of AV.ACL.
5864      * @param {Object} options Optional Backbone-like options object to be
5865      *     passed in to set.
5866      * @return {Boolean} Whether the set passed validation.
5867      * @see AV.Object#set
5868      */
5869     setACL: function(acl, options) {
5870       return this.set("ACL", acl, options);
5871     }
5872 
5873   });
5874 
5875    /**
5876     * Creates an instance of a subclass of AV.Object for the give classname
5877     * and id.
5878     * @param  {String} className The name of the AV class backing this model.
5879     * @param {String} id The object id of this model.
5880     * @return {AV.Object} A new subclass instance of AV.Object.
5881     */
5882    AV.Object.createWithoutData = function(className, id, hasData){
5883      var result = new AV.Object(className);
5884      result.id = id
5885      result._hasData = hasData;
5886      return result;
5887    };
5888    /**
5889     * Delete objects in batch.The objects className must be the same.
5890     * @param {Array} The ParseObject array to be deleted.
5891     * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
5892     *     callbacks.
5893     * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the save
5894     *     completes.
5895     */
5896    AV.Object.destroyAll = function(objects, options){
5897       if(objects == null || objects.length == 0){
5898 		  return AV.Promise.as()._thenRunCallbacks(options);
5899       }
5900       var className = objects[0].className;
5901       var id = "";
5902       var wasFirst = true;
5903       objects.forEach(function(obj){
5904         if(obj.className != className)
5905 			  throw "AV.Object.destroyAll requires the argument object array's classNames must be the same";
5906           if(!obj.id)
5907               throw "Could not delete unsaved object";
5908           if(wasFirst){
5909               id = obj.id;
5910               wasFirst = false;
5911           }else{
5912               id = id + ',' + obj.id;
5913           }
5914       });
5915       var request =
5916           AV._request("classes", className, id, 'DELETE');
5917       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
5918    };
5919 
5920   /**
5921    * Returns the appropriate subclass for making new instances of the given
5922    * className string.
5923    */
5924   AV.Object._getSubclass = function(className) {
5925     if (!_.isString(className)) {
5926       throw "AV.Object._getSubclass requires a string argument.";
5927     }
5928     var ObjectClass = AV.Object._classMap[className];
5929     if (!ObjectClass) {
5930       ObjectClass = AV.Object.extend(className);
5931       AV.Object._classMap[className] = ObjectClass;
5932     }
5933     return ObjectClass;
5934   };
5935 
5936   /**
5937    * Creates an instance of a subclass of AV.Object for the given classname.
5938    */
5939   AV.Object._create = function(className, attributes, options) {
5940     var ObjectClass = AV.Object._getSubclass(className);
5941     return new ObjectClass(attributes, options);
5942   };
5943 
5944   // Set up a map of className to class so that we can create new instances of
5945   // AV Objects from JSON automatically.
5946   AV.Object._classMap = {};
5947 
5948   AV.Object._extend = AV._extend;
5949 
5950   /**
5951    * Creates a new model with defined attributes,
5952    * It's the same with
5953    * <pre>
5954    *   new AV.Object(attributes, options);
5955    *  </pre>
5956    * @param {Object} attributes The initial set of data to store in the object.
5957    * @param {Object} options A set of Backbone-like options for creating the
5958    *     object.  The only option currently supported is "collection".
5959    * @return {AV.Object}
5960    * @since v0.4.4
5961    * @see AV.Object
5962    * @see AV.Object.extend
5963    */
5964   AV.Object.new = function(attributes, options){
5965     return new AV.Object(attributes, options);
5966   };
5967 
5968   /**
5969    * Creates a new subclass of AV.Object for the given AV class name.
5970    *
5971    * <p>Every extension of a AV class will inherit from the most recent
5972    * previous extension of that class. When a AV.Object is automatically
5973    * created by parsing JSON, it will use the most recent extension of that
5974    * class.</p>
5975    *
5976    * <p>You should call either:<pre>
5977    *     var MyClass = AV.Object.extend("MyClass", {
5978    *         <i>Instance properties</i>
5979    *     }, {
5980    *         <i>Class properties</i>
5981    *     });</pre>
5982    * or, for Backbone compatibility:<pre>
5983    *     var MyClass = AV.Object.extend({
5984    *         className: "MyClass",
5985    *         <i>Other instance properties</i>
5986    *     }, {
5987    *         <i>Class properties</i>
5988    *     });</pre></p>
5989    *
5990    * @param {String} className The name of the AV class backing this model.
5991    * @param {Object} protoProps Instance properties to add to instances of the
5992    *     class returned from this method.
5993    * @param {Object} classProps Class properties to add the class returned from
5994    *     this method.
5995    * @return {Class} A new subclass of AV.Object.
5996    */
5997   AV.Object.extend = function(className, protoProps, classProps) {
5998     // Handle the case with only two args.
5999     if (!_.isString(className)) {
6000       if (className && _.has(className, "className")) {
6001         return AV.Object.extend(className.className, className, protoProps);
6002       } else {
6003         throw new Error(
6004             "AV.Object.extend's first argument should be the className.");
6005       }
6006     }
6007 
6008     // If someone tries to subclass "User", coerce it to the right type.
6009     if (className === "User") {
6010       className = "_User";
6011     }
6012 
6013     var NewClassObject = null;
6014     if (_.has(AV.Object._classMap, className)) {
6015       var OldClassObject = AV.Object._classMap[className];
6016       // This new subclass has been told to extend both from "this" and from
6017       // OldClassObject. This is multiple inheritance, which isn't supported.
6018       // For now, let's just pick one.
6019       NewClassObject = OldClassObject._extend(protoProps, classProps);
6020     } else {
6021       protoProps = protoProps || {};
6022       protoProps.className = className;
6023       NewClassObject = this._extend(protoProps, classProps);
6024     }
6025     // Extending a subclass should reuse the classname automatically.
6026     NewClassObject.extend = function(arg0) {
6027       if (_.isString(arg0) || (arg0 && _.has(arg0, "className"))) {
6028         return AV.Object.extend.apply(NewClassObject, arguments);
6029       }
6030       var newArguments = [className].concat(AV._.toArray(arguments));
6031       return AV.Object.extend.apply(NewClassObject, newArguments);
6032     };
6033     NewClassObject.new = function(attributes, options){
6034       return new NewClassObject(attributes, options);
6035     };
6036     AV.Object._classMap[className] = NewClassObject;
6037     return NewClassObject;
6038   };
6039 
6040   AV.Object._findUnsavedChildren = function(object, children, files) {
6041     AV._traverse(object, function(object) {
6042       if (object instanceof AV.Object) {
6043         object._refreshCache();
6044         if (object.dirty()) {
6045           children.push(object);
6046         }
6047         return;
6048       }
6049 
6050       if (object instanceof AV.File) {
6051         if (!object.url() && !object.id) {
6052           files.push(object);
6053         }
6054         return;
6055       }
6056     });
6057   };
6058 
6059   AV.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue = function(object) {
6060     var canBeSerializedAsValue = true;
6061 
6062     if (object instanceof AV.Object) {
6063       canBeSerializedAsValue = !!object.id;
6064 
6065     } else if (_.isArray(object)) {
6066       AV._arrayEach(object, function(child) {
6067         if (!AV.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue(child)) {
6068           canBeSerializedAsValue = false;
6069         }
6070       });
6071 
6072     } else if (_.isObject(object)) {
6073       AV._objectEach(object, function(child) {
6074         if (!AV.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue(child)) {
6075           canBeSerializedAsValue = false;
6076         }
6077       });
6078     }
6079 
6080     return canBeSerializedAsValue;
6081   };
6082 
6083   AV.Object._deepSaveAsync = function(object, model) {
6084     var unsavedChildren = [];
6085     var unsavedFiles = [];
6086     AV.Object._findUnsavedChildren(object, unsavedChildren, unsavedFiles);
6087     if(model) {
6088       unsavedChildren = _.filter(unsavedChildren, function(object) {
6089         return object != model;
6090       });
6091     }
6092 
6093     var promise = AV.Promise.as();
6094     _.each(unsavedFiles, function(file) {
6095       promise = promise.then(function() {
6096         return file.save();
6097       });
6098     });
6099 
6100     var objects = _.uniq(unsavedChildren);
6101     var remaining = _.uniq(objects);
6102 
6103     return promise.then(function() {
6104       return AV.Promise._continueWhile(function() {
6105         return remaining.length > 0;
6106       }, function() {
6107 
6108         // Gather up all the objects that can be saved in this batch.
6109         var batch = [];
6110         var newRemaining = [];
6111         AV._arrayEach(remaining, function(object) {
6112           // Limit batches to 20 objects.
6113           if (batch.length > 20) {
6114             newRemaining.push(object);
6115             return;
6116           }
6117 
6118           if (object._canBeSerialized()) {
6119             batch.push(object);
6120           } else {
6121             newRemaining.push(object);
6122           }
6123         });
6124         remaining = newRemaining;
6125 
6126         // If we can't save any objects, there must be a circular reference.
6127         if (batch.length === 0) {
6128           return AV.Promise.error(
6129             new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6130                             "Tried to save a batch with a cycle."));
6131         }
6132 
6133         // Reserve a spot in every object's save queue.
6134         var readyToStart = AV.Promise.when(_.map(batch, function(object) {
6135           return object._allPreviousSaves || AV.Promise.as();
6136         }));
6137         var batchFinished = new AV.Promise();
6138         AV._arrayEach(batch, function(object) {
6139           object._allPreviousSaves = batchFinished;
6140         });
6141 
6142         // Save a single batch, whether previous saves succeeded or failed.
6143         return readyToStart._continueWith(function() {
6144           return AV._request("batch", null, null, "POST", {
6145             requests: _.map(batch, function(object) {
6146               var json = object._getSaveJSON();
6147               var method = "POST";
6148 
6149               var path = "/1.1/classes/" + object.className;
6150               if (object.id) {
6151                 path = path + "/" + object.id;
6152                 method = "PUT";
6153               }
6154 
6155               object._startSave();
6156 
6157               return {
6158                 method: method,
6159                 path: path,
6160                 body: json
6161               };
6162             })
6163 
6164           }).then(function(response, status, xhr) {
6165             var error;
6166             AV._arrayEach(batch, function(object, i) {
6167               if (response[i].success) {
6168                 object._finishSave(
6169                   object.parse(response[i].success, status, xhr));
6170               } else {
6171                 error = error || response[i].error;
6172                 object._cancelSave();
6173               }
6174             });
6175             if (error) {
6176               return AV.Promise.error(
6177                 new AV.Error(error.code, error.error));
6178             }
6179 
6180           }).then(function(results) {
6181             batchFinished.resolve(results);
6182             return results;
6183           }, function(error) {
6184             batchFinished.reject(error);
6185             return AV.Promise.error(error);
6186           });
6187         });
6188       });
6189     }).then(function() {
6190       return object;
6191     });
6192   };
6193 
6194 }(this));
6195 
6196 (function(root) {
6197   root.AV = root.AV || {};
6198   var AV = root.AV;
6199   var _ = AV._;
6200 
6201   /**
6202    * Represents a Role on the AV server. Roles represent groupings of
6203    * Users for the purposes of granting permissions (e.g. specifying an ACL
6204    * for an Object). Roles are specified by their sets of child users and
6205    * child roles, all of which are granted any permissions that the parent
6206    * role has.
6207    *
6208    * <p>Roles must have a name (which cannot be changed after creation of the
6209    * role), and must specify an ACL.</p>
6210    * @class
6211    * A AV.Role is a local representation of a role persisted to the AV
6212    * cloud.
6213    */
6214   AV.Role = AV.Object.extend("_Role", /** @lends AV.Role.prototype */ {
6215     // Instance Methods
6216 
6217     /**
6218      * Constructs a new AVRole with the given name and ACL.
6219      *
6220      * @param {String} name The name of the Role to create.
6221      * @param {AV.ACL} acl The ACL for this role. Roles must have an ACL.
6222      */
6223     constructor: function(name, acl) {
6224       if (_.isString(name) && (acl instanceof AV.ACL)) {
6225         AV.Object.prototype.constructor.call(this, null, null);
6226         this.setName(name);
6227         this.setACL(acl);
6228       } else {
6229         AV.Object.prototype.constructor.call(this, name, acl);
6230       }
6231     },
6232 
6233     /**
6234      * Gets the name of the role.  You can alternatively call role.get("name")
6235      *
6236      * @return {String} the name of the role.
6237      */
6238     getName: function() {
6239       return this.get("name");
6240     },
6241 
6242     /**
6243      * Sets the name for a role. This value must be set before the role has
6244      * been saved to the server, and cannot be set once the role has been
6245      * saved.
6246      *
6247      * <p>
6248      *   A role's name can only contain alphanumeric characters, _, -, and
6249      *   spaces.
6250      * </p>
6251      *
6252      * <p>This is equivalent to calling role.set("name", name)</p>
6253      *
6254      * @param {String} name The name of the role.
6255      * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
6256      *     callbacks.
6257      */
6258     setName: function(name, options) {
6259       return this.set("name", name, options);
6260     },
6261 
6262     /**
6263      * Gets the AV.Relation for the AV.Users that are direct
6264      * children of this role. These users are granted any privileges that this
6265      * role has been granted (e.g. read or write access through ACLs). You can
6266      * add or remove users from the role through this relation.
6267      *
6268      * <p>This is equivalent to calling role.relation("users")</p>
6269      *
6270      * @return {AV.Relation} the relation for the users belonging to this
6271      *     role.
6272      */
6273     getUsers: function() {
6274       return this.relation("users");
6275     },
6276 
6277     /**
6278      * Gets the AV.Relation for the AV.Roles that are direct
6279      * children of this role. These roles' users are granted any privileges that
6280      * this role has been granted (e.g. read or write access through ACLs). You
6281      * can add or remove child roles from this role through this relation.
6282      *
6283      * <p>This is equivalent to calling role.relation("roles")</p>
6284      *
6285      * @return {AV.Relation} the relation for the roles belonging to this
6286      *     role.
6287      */
6288     getRoles: function() {
6289       return this.relation("roles");
6290     },
6291 
6292     /**
6293      * @ignore
6294      */
6295     validate: function(attrs, options) {
6296       if ("name" in attrs && attrs.name !== this.getName()) {
6297         var newName = attrs.name;
6298         if (this.id && this.id !== attrs.objectId) {
6299           // Check to see if the objectId being set matches this.id.
6300           // This happens during a fetch -- the id is set before calling fetch.
6301           // Let the name be set in this case.
6302           return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6303               "A role's name can only be set before it has been saved.");
6304         }
6305         if (!_.isString(newName)) {
6306           return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6307               "A role's name must be a String.");
6308         }
6309         if (!(/^[0-9a-zA-Z\-_ ]+$/).test(newName)) {
6310           return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6311               "A role's name can only contain alphanumeric characters, _," +
6312               " -, and spaces.");
6313         }
6314       }
6315       if (AV.Object.prototype.validate) {
6316         return AV.Object.prototype.validate.call(this, attrs, options);
6317       }
6318       return false;
6319     }
6320   });
6321 }(this));
6322 
6323 (function(root) {
6324   root.AV = root.AV || {};
6325   var AV = root.AV;
6326   var _ = AV._;
6327 
6328   /**
6329    * @class
6330    *
6331    * <p>A AV.User object is a local representation of a user persisted to the
6332    * AV cloud. This class is a subclass of a AV.Object, and retains the
6333    * same functionality of a AV.Object, but also extends it with various
6334    * user specific methods, like authentication, signing up, and validation of
6335    * uniqueness.</p>
6336    */
6337   AV.User = AV.Object.extend("_User", /** @lends AV.User.prototype */ {
6338     // Instance Variables
6339     _isCurrentUser: false,
6340 
6341 
6342     // Instance Methods
6343 
6344     /**
6345      * Internal method to handle special fields in a _User response.
6346      */
6347     _mergeMagicFields: function(attrs) {
6348       if (attrs.sessionToken) {
6349         this._sessionToken = attrs.sessionToken;
6350         delete attrs.sessionToken;
6351       }
6352       AV.User.__super__._mergeMagicFields.call(this, attrs);
6353     },
6354 
6355     /**
6356      * Removes null values from authData (which exist temporarily for
6357      * unlinking)
6358      */
6359     _cleanupAuthData: function() {
6360       if (!this.isCurrent()) {
6361         return;
6362       }
6363       var authData = this.get('authData');
6364       if (!authData) {
6365         return;
6366       }
6367       AV._objectEach(this.get('authData'), function(value, key) {
6368         if (!authData[key]) {
6369           delete authData[key];
6370         }
6371       });
6372     },
6373 
6374     /**
6375      * Synchronizes authData for all providers.
6376      */
6377     _synchronizeAllAuthData: function() {
6378       var authData = this.get('authData');
6379       if (!authData) {
6380         return;
6381       }
6382 
6383       var self = this;
6384       AV._objectEach(this.get('authData'), function(value, key) {
6385         self._synchronizeAuthData(key);
6386       });
6387     },
6388 
6389     /**
6390      * Synchronizes auth data for a provider (e.g. puts the access token in the
6391      * right place to be used by the Facebook SDK).
6392      */
6393     _synchronizeAuthData: function(provider) {
6394       if (!this.isCurrent()) {
6395         return;
6396       }
6397       var authType;
6398       if (_.isString(provider)) {
6399         authType = provider;
6400         provider = AV.User._authProviders[authType];
6401       } else {
6402         authType = provider.getAuthType();
6403       }
6404       var authData = this.get('authData');
6405       if (!authData || !provider) {
6406         return;
6407       }
6408       var success = provider.restoreAuthentication(authData[authType]);
6409       if (!success) {
6410         this._unlinkFrom(provider);
6411       }
6412     },
6413 
6414     _handleSaveResult: function(makeCurrent) {
6415       // Clean up and synchronize the authData object, removing any unset values
6416       if (makeCurrent) {
6417         this._isCurrentUser = true;
6418       }
6419       this._cleanupAuthData();
6420       this._synchronizeAllAuthData();
6421       // Don't keep the password around.
6422       delete this._serverData.password;
6423       this._rebuildEstimatedDataForKey("password");
6424       this._refreshCache();
6425       if (makeCurrent || this.isCurrent()) {
6426         AV.User._saveCurrentUser(this);
6427       }
6428     },
6429 
6430     /**
6431      * Unlike in the Android/iOS SDKs, logInWith is unnecessary, since you can
6432      * call linkWith on the user (even if it doesn't exist yet on the server).
6433      */
6434     _linkWith: function(provider, options) {
6435       var authType;
6436       if (_.isString(provider)) {
6437         authType = provider;
6438         provider = AV.User._authProviders[provider];
6439       } else {
6440         authType = provider.getAuthType();
6441       }
6442       if (_.has(options, 'authData')) {
6443         var authData = this.get('authData') || {};
6444         authData[authType] = options.authData;
6445         this.set('authData', authData);
6446 
6447         // Overridden so that the user can be made the current user.
6448         var newOptions = _.clone(options) || {};
6449         newOptions.success = function(model) {
6450           model._handleSaveResult(true);
6451           if (options.success) {
6452             options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6453           }
6454         };
6455         return this.save({'authData': authData}, newOptions);
6456       } else {
6457         var self = this;
6458         var promise = new AV.Promise();
6459         provider.authenticate({
6460           success: function(provider, result) {
6461             self._linkWith(provider, {
6462               authData: result,
6463               success: options.success,
6464               error: options.error
6465             }).then(function() {
6466               promise.resolve(self);
6467             });
6468           },
6469           error: function(provider, error) {
6470             if (options.error) {
6471               options.error(self, error);
6472             }
6473             promise.reject(error);
6474           }
6475         });
6476         return promise;
6477       }
6478     },
6479 
6480     /**
6481      * Unlinks a user from a service.
6482      */
6483     _unlinkFrom: function(provider, options) {
6484       var authType;
6485       if (_.isString(provider)) {
6486         authType = provider;
6487         provider = AV.User._authProviders[provider];
6488       } else {
6489         authType = provider.getAuthType();
6490       }
6491       var newOptions = _.clone(options);
6492       var self = this;
6493       newOptions.authData = null;
6494       newOptions.success = function(model) {
6495         self._synchronizeAuthData(provider);
6496         if (options.success) {
6497           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6498         }
6499       };
6500       return this._linkWith(provider, newOptions);
6501     },
6502 
6503     /**
6504      * Checks whether a user is linked to a service.
6505      */
6506     _isLinked: function(provider) {
6507       var authType;
6508       if (_.isString(provider)) {
6509         authType = provider;
6510       } else {
6511         authType = provider.getAuthType();
6512       }
6513       var authData = this.get('authData') || {};
6514       return !!authData[authType];
6515     },
6516 
6517     /**
6518      * Deauthenticates all providers.
6519      */
6520     _logOutWithAll: function() {
6521       var authData = this.get('authData');
6522       if (!authData) {
6523         return;
6524       }
6525       var self = this;
6526       AV._objectEach(this.get('authData'), function(value, key) {
6527         self._logOutWith(key);
6528       });
6529     },
6530 
6531     /**
6532      * Deauthenticates a single provider (e.g. removing access tokens from the
6533      * Facebook SDK).
6534      */
6535     _logOutWith: function(provider) {
6536       if (!this.isCurrent()) {
6537         return;
6538       }
6539       if (_.isString(provider)) {
6540         provider = AV.User._authProviders[provider];
6541       }
6542       if (provider && provider.deauthenticate) {
6543         provider.deauthenticate();
6544       }
6545     },
6546 
6547     /**
6548      * Signs up a new user. You should call this instead of save for
6549      * new AV.Users. This will create a new AV.User on the server, and
6550      * also persist the session on disk so that you can access the user using
6551      * <code>current</code>.
6552      *
6553      * <p>A username and password must be set before calling signUp.</p>
6554      *
6555      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6556      *
6557      * @param {Object} attrs Extra fields to set on the new user, or null.
6558      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6559      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the signup
6560      *     finishes.
6561      * @see AV.User.signUp
6562      */
6563     signUp: function(attrs, options) {
6564       var error;
6565       options = options || {};
6566 
6567       var username = (attrs && attrs.username) || this.get("username");
6568       if (!username || (username === "")) {
6569         error = new AV.Error(
6570             AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6571             "Cannot sign up user with an empty name.");
6572         if (options && options.error) {
6573           options.error(this, error);
6574         }
6575         return AV.Promise.error(error);
6576       }
6577 
6578       var password = (attrs && attrs.password) || this.get("password");
6579       if (!password || (password === "")) {
6580         error = new AV.Error(
6581             AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6582             "Cannot sign up user with an empty password.");
6583         if (options && options.error) {
6584           options.error(this, error);
6585         }
6586         return AV.Promise.error(error);
6587       }
6588 
6589       // Overridden so that the user can be made the current user.
6590       var newOptions = _.clone(options);
6591       newOptions.success = function(model) {
6592         model._handleSaveResult(true);
6593         if (options.success) {
6594           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6595         }
6596       };
6597       return this.save(attrs, newOptions);
6598     },
6599 
6600     /**
6601      * Signs up a new user with mobile phone and sms code.
6602      * You should call this instead of save for
6603      * new AV.Users. This will create a new AV.User on the server, and
6604      * also persist the session on disk so that you can access the user using
6605      * <code>current</code>.
6606      *
6607      * <p>A username and password must be set before calling signUp.</p>
6608      *
6609      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6610      *
6611      * @param {Object} attrs Extra fields to set on the new user, or null.
6612      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6613      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the signup
6614      *     finishes.
6615      * @see AV.User.signUpOrlogInWithMobilePhone
6616      * @see AV.Cloud.requestSmsCode
6617      */
6618     signUpOrlogInWithMobilePhone: function(attrs, options) {
6619       var error;
6620       options = options || {};
6621 
6622       var mobilePhoneNumber = (attrs && attrs.mobilePhoneNumber) ||
6623                               this.get("mobilePhoneNumber");
6624       if (!mobilePhoneNumber || (mobilePhoneNumber === "")) {
6625         error = new AV.Error(
6626             AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6627             "Cannot sign up or login user by mobilePhoneNumber " +
6628             "with an empty mobilePhoneNumber.");
6629         if (options && options.error) {
6630           options.error(this, error);
6631         }
6632         return AV.Promise.error(error);
6633       }
6634 
6635       var smsCode = (attrs && attrs.smsCode) || this.get("smsCode");
6636       if (!smsCode || (smsCode === "")) {
6637         error = new AV.Error(
6638             AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6639              "Cannot sign up or login user by mobilePhoneNumber  " +
6640              "with an empty smsCode.");
6641         if (options && options.error) {
6642           options.error(this, error);
6643         }
6644         return AV.Promise.error(error);
6645       }
6646 
6647       // Overridden so that the user can be made the current user.
6648       var newOptions = _.clone(options);
6649       newOptions._makeRequest = function(route, className, id, method, json) {
6650         return AV._request('usersByMobilePhone', null, null, "POST", json);
6651       };
6652       newOptions.success = function(model) {
6653         model._handleSaveResult(true);
6654         delete model.attributes.smsCode;
6655         delete model._serverData.smsCode;
6656         if (options.success) {
6657           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6658         }
6659       };
6660       return this.save(attrs, newOptions);
6661     },
6662 
6663     /**
6664      * Logs in a AV.User. On success, this saves the session to localStorage,
6665      * so you can retrieve the currently logged in user using
6666      * <code>current</code>.
6667      *
6668      * <p>A username and password must be set before calling logIn.</p>
6669      *
6670      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6671      *
6672      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6673      * @see AV.User.logIn
6674      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled with the user when
6675      *     the login is complete.
6676      */
6677     logIn: function(options) {
6678       var model = this;
6679       var request = AV._request("login", null, null, "GET", this.toJSON());
6680       return request.then(function(resp, status, xhr) {
6681         var serverAttrs = model.parse(resp, status, xhr);
6682         model._finishFetch(serverAttrs);
6683         model._handleSaveResult(true);
6684         if(!serverAttrs.smsCode)
6685           delete model.attributes['smsCode'];
6686         return model;
6687       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
6688     },
6689 
6690     /**
6691      * @see AV.Object#save
6692      */
6693     save: function(arg1, arg2, arg3) {
6694       var i, attrs, current, options, saved;
6695       if (_.isObject(arg1) || _.isNull(arg1) || _.isUndefined(arg1)) {
6696         attrs = arg1;
6697         options = arg2;
6698       } else {
6699         attrs = {};
6700         attrs[arg1] = arg2;
6701         options = arg3;
6702       }
6703       options = options || {};
6704 
6705       var newOptions = _.clone(options);
6706       newOptions.success = function(model) {
6707         model._handleSaveResult(false);
6708         if (options.success) {
6709           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6710         }
6711       };
6712       return AV.Object.prototype.save.call(this, attrs, newOptions);
6713     },
6714 
6715     /**
6716      * Follow a user
6717      * @since 0.3.0
6718      * @param {} target The target user or user's objectId to follow.
6719      * @param {Object} options An optional Backbone-like options object with
6720      *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
6721      *     has finished.
6722      */
6723     follow: function(target, options){
6724       if(!this.id){
6725           throw "Please signin.";
6726       }
6727       if(!target){
6728           throw "Invalid target user.";
6729       }
6730       var userObjectId = _.isString(target) ? target: target.id;
6731       if(!userObjectId){
6732           throw "Invalid target user.";
6733       }
6734       var route = 'users/' + this.id + '/friendship/' + userObjectId;
6735       var request = AV._request(route, null, null, 'POST', null);
6736       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
6737     },
6738 
6739     /**
6740      * Unfollow a user.
6741      * @since 0.3.0
6742      * @param {} target The target user or user's objectId to unfollow.
6743      * @param options {Object} An optional Backbone-like options object with
6744      *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
6745      *     has finished.
6746      */
6747     unfollow: function(target, options){
6748       if(!this.id){
6749           throw "Please signin.";
6750       }
6751       if(!target){
6752           throw "Invalid target user.";
6753       }
6754       var userObjectId = _.isString(target) ? target: target.id;
6755       if(!userObjectId){
6756           throw "Invalid target user.";
6757       }
6758       var route = 'users/' + this.id + '/friendship/' + userObjectId;
6759       var request = AV._request(route, null, null, 'DELETE', null);
6760       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
6761     },
6762 
6763     /**
6764      *Create a follower query to query the user's followers.
6765      * @since 0.3.0
6766      * @see AV.User#followerQuery
6767      */
6768     followerQuery: function() {
6769         return AV.User.followerQuery(this.id);
6770     },
6771 
6772     /**
6773      *Create a followee query to query the user's followees.
6774      * @since 0.3.0
6775      * @see AV.User#followeeQuery
6776      */
6777     followeeQuery: function() {
6778         return AV.User.followeeQuery(this.id);
6779     },
6780 
6781     /**
6782      * @see AV.Object#fetch
6783      */
6784     fetch: function(options) {
6785       var newOptions = options ? _.clone(options) : {};
6786       newOptions.success = function(model) {
6787         model._handleSaveResult(false);
6788         if (options && options.success) {
6789           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6790         }
6791       };
6792       return AV.Object.prototype.fetch.call(this, newOptions);
6793     },
6794 
6795     /**
6796      * Update user's new password safely based on old password.
6797      * @param {String} oldPassword, the old password.
6798      * @param {String} newPassword, the new password.
6799      * @param {Object} An optional Backbone-like options object with
6800      *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
6801      *     has finished.
6802      */
6803     updatePassword: function(oldPassword, newPassword, options) {
6804       var route = 'users/' + this.id + '/updatePassword';
6805       var params = {
6806         old_password: oldPassword,
6807         new_password: newPassword
6808       };
6809       var request = AV._request(route, null, null, 'PUT', params);
6810       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
6811     },
6812 
6813     /**
6814      * Returns true if <code>current</code> would return this user.
6815      * @see AV.User#current
6816      */
6817     isCurrent: function() {
