6818       return this._isCurrentUser;
6819     },
6820 
6821     /**
6822      * Returns get("username").
6823      * @return {String}
6824      * @see AV.Object#get
6825      */
6826     getUsername: function() {
6827       return this.get("username");
6828     },
6829 
6830     /**
6831      * Returns get("mobilePhoneNumber").
6832      * @return {String}
6833      * @see AV.Object#get
6834      */
6835     getMobilePhoneNumber: function(){
6836       return this.get("mobilePhoneNumber");
6837     },
6838 
6839     /**
6840      * Calls set("mobilePhoneNumber", phoneNumber, options) and returns the result.
6841      * @param {String} mobilePhoneNumber
6842      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6843      * @return {Boolean}
6844      * @see AV.Object.set
6845      */
6846     setMobilePhoneNumber: function(phone, options) {
6847       return this.set("mobilePhoneNumber", phone, options);
6848     },
6849 
6850     /**
6851      * Calls set("username", username, options) and returns the result.
6852      * @param {String} username
6853      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6854      * @return {Boolean}
6855      * @see AV.Object.set
6856      */
6857     setUsername: function(username, options) {
6858       return this.set("username", username, options);
6859     },
6860 
6861     /**
6862      * Calls set("password", password, options) and returns the result.
6863      * @param {String} password
6864      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6865      * @return {Boolean}
6866      * @see AV.Object.set
6867      */
6868     setPassword: function(password, options) {
6869       return this.set("password", password, options);
6870     },
6871 
6872     /**
6873      * Returns get("email").
6874      * @return {String}
6875      * @see AV.Object#get
6876      */
6877     getEmail: function() {
6878       return this.get("email");
6879     },
6880 
6881     /**
6882      * Calls set("email", email, options) and returns the result.
6883      * @param {String} email
6884      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6885      * @return {Boolean}
6886      * @see AV.Object.set
6887      */
6888     setEmail: function(email, options) {
6889       return this.set("email", email, options);
6890     },
6891 
6892     /**
6893      * Checks whether this user is the current user and has been authenticated.
6894      * @return (Boolean) whether this user is the current user and is logged in.
6895      */
6896     authenticated: function() {
6897       return !!this._sessionToken &&
6898           (AV.User.current() && AV.User.current().id === this.id);
6899     }
6900 
6901   }, /** @lends AV.User */ {
6902     // Class Variables
6903 
6904     // The currently logged-in user.
6905     _currentUser: null,
6906 
6907     // Whether currentUser is known to match the serialized version on disk.
6908     // This is useful for saving a localstorage check if you try to load
6909     // _currentUser frequently while there is none stored.
6910     _currentUserMatchesDisk: false,
6911 
6912     // The localStorage key suffix that the current user is stored under.
6913     _CURRENT_USER_KEY: "currentUser",
6914 
6915     // The mapping of auth provider names to actual providers
6916     _authProviders: {},
6917 
6918 
6919     // Class Methods
6920 
6921     /**
6922      * Signs up a new user with a username (or email) and password.
6923      * This will create a new AV.User on the server, and also persist the
6924      * session in localStorage so that you can access the user using
6925      * {@link #current}.
6926      *
6927      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6928      *
6929      * @param {String} username The username (or email) to sign up with.
6930      * @param {String} password The password to sign up with.
6931      * @param {Object} attrs Extra fields to set on the new user.
6932      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6933      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled with the user when
6934      *     the signup completes.
6935      * @see AV.User#signUp
6936      */
6937     signUp: function(username, password, attrs, options) {
6938       attrs = attrs || {};
6939       attrs.username = username;
6940       attrs.password = password;
6941       var user = AV.Object._create("_User");
6942       return user.signUp(attrs, options);
6943     },
6944 
6945     /**
6946      * Logs in a user with a username (or email) and password. On success, this
6947      * saves the session to disk, so you can retrieve the currently logged in
6948      * user using <code>current</code>.
6949      *
6950      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6951      *
6952      * @param {String} username The username (or email) to log in with.
6953      * @param {String} password The password to log in with.
6954      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6955      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled with the user when
6956      *     the login completes.
6957      * @see AV.User#logIn
6958      */
6959     logIn: function(username, password, options) {
6960       var user = AV.Object._create("_User");
6961       user._finishFetch({ username: username, password: password });
6962       return user.logIn(options);
6963     },
6964 
6965     /**
6966      * Logs in a user with a session token. On success, this saves the session
6967      * to disk, so you can retrieve the currently logged in user using
6968      * <code>current</code>.
6969      *
6970      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6971      *
6972      * @param {String} sessionToken The sessionToken to log in with.
6973      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6974      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled with the user when
6975      *     the login completes.
6976      */
6977     become: function(sessionToken, options) {
6978       options = options || {};
6979 
6980       var user = AV.Object._create("_User");
6981       return AV._request(
6982           "users",
6983           "me",
6984           null,
6985           "GET",
6986           {
6987             useMasterKey: options.useMasterKey,
6988             session_token: sessionToken
6989           }
6990       ).then(function(resp, status, xhr) {
6991           var serverAttrs = user.parse(resp, status, xhr);
6992           user._finishFetch(serverAttrs);
6993           user._handleSaveResult(true);
6994           return user;
6995 
6996       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, user);
6997     },
6998 
6999     /**
7000      * Logs in a user with a mobile phone number and sms code sent by
7001      * AV.User.requestLoginSmsCode.On success, this
7002      * saves the session to disk, so you can retrieve the currently logged in
7003      * user using <code>current</code>.
7004      *
7005      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
7006      *
7007      * @param {String} mobilePhone The user's mobilePhoneNumber
7008      * @param {String} smsCode The sms code sent by AV.User.requestLoginSmsCode
7009      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7010      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled with the user when
7011      *     the login completes.
7012      * @see AV.User#logIn
7013      */
7014    logInWithMobilePhoneSmsCode: function(mobilePhone, smsCode, options){
7015       var user = AV.Object._create("_User");
7016       user._finishFetch({ mobilePhoneNumber: mobilePhone, smsCode: smsCode });
7017       return user.logIn(options);
7018    },
7019 
7020     /**
7021      * Sign up or logs in a user with a mobilePhoneNumber and smsCode.
7022      * On success, this saves the session to disk, so you can retrieve the currently
7023      * logged in user using <code>current</code>.
7024      *
7025      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
7026      *
7027      * @param {String} mobilePhoneNumber The user's mobilePhoneNumber.
7028      * @param {String} smsCode The sms code sent by AV.Cloud.requestSmsCode
7029      * @param {Object} attributes  The user's other attributes such as username etc.
7030      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7031      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled with the user when
7032      *     the login completes.
7033      * @see AV.User#signUpOrlogInWithMobilePhone
7034      * @see AV.Cloud.requestSmsCode
7035      */
7036     signUpOrlogInWithMobilePhone: function(mobilePhoneNumber, smsCode, attrs, options) {
7037       attrs = attrs || {};
7038       attrs.mobilePhoneNumber = mobilePhoneNumber;
7039       attrs.smsCode = smsCode;
7040       var user = AV.Object._create("_User");
7041       return user.signUpOrlogInWithMobilePhone(attrs, options);
7042     },
7043 
7044 
7045     /**
7046      * Logs in a user with a mobile phone number and password. On success, this
7047      * saves the session to disk, so you can retrieve the currently logged in
7048      * user using <code>current</code>.
7049      *
7050      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
7051      *
7052      * @param {String} mobilePhone The user's mobilePhoneNumber
7053      * @param {String} password The password to log in with.
7054      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7055      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled with the user when
7056      *     the login completes.
7057      * @see AV.User#logIn
7058      */
7059    logInWithMobilePhone: function(mobilePhone, password, options){
7060       var user = AV.Object._create("_User");
7061       user._finishFetch({ mobilePhoneNumber: mobilePhone, password: password });
7062       return user.logIn(options);
7063    },
7064 
7065     /**
7066      * Logs out the currently logged in user session. This will remove the
7067      * session from disk, log out of linked services, and future calls to
7068      * <code>current</code> will return <code>null</code>.
7069      */
7070     logOut: function() {
7071       if (AV.User._currentUser !== null) {
7072         AV.User._currentUser._logOutWithAll();
7073         AV.User._currentUser._isCurrentUser = false;
7074       }
7075       AV.User._currentUserMatchesDisk = true;
7076       AV.User._currentUser = null;
7077       AV.localStorage.removeItem(
7078           AV._getAVPath(AV.User._CURRENT_USER_KEY));
7079     },
7080 
7081     /**
7082      *Create a follower query for special user to query the user's followers.
7083      * @param userObjectId {String} The user object id.
7084      * @since 0.3.0
7085      */
7086     followerQuery: function(userObjectId) {
7087         if(!userObjectId || !_.isString(userObjectId)) {
7088           throw "Invalid user object id.";
7089         }
7090         var query = new AV.FriendShipQuery('_Follower');
7091         query._friendshipTag ='follower';
7092         query.equalTo('user', AV.Object.createWithoutData('_User', userObjectId));
7093         return query;
7094     },
7095 
7096     /**
7097      *Create a followee query for special user to query the user's followees.
7098      * @param userObjectId {String} The user object id.
7099      * @since 0.3.0
7100      */
7101     followeeQuery: function(userObjectId) {
7102         if(!userObjectId || !_.isString(userObjectId)) {
7103           throw "Invalid user object id.";
7104         }
7105         var query = new AV.FriendShipQuery('_Followee');
7106         query._friendshipTag ='followee';
7107         query.equalTo('user', AV.Object.createWithoutData('_User', userObjectId));
7108         return query;
7109     },
7110 
7111     /**
7112      * Requests a password reset email to be sent to the specified email address
7113      * associated with the user account. This email allows the user to securely
7114      * reset their password on the AV site.
7115      *
7116      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
7117      *
7118      * @param {String} email The email address associated with the user that
7119      *     forgot their password.
7120      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7121      */
7122     requestPasswordReset: function(email, options) {
7123       var json = { email: email };
7124       var request = AV._request("requestPasswordReset", null, null, "POST",
7125                                    json);
7126       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7127     },
7128 
7129     /**
7130      * Requests a verify email to be sent to the specified email address
7131      * associated with the user account. This email allows the user to securely
7132      * verify their email address on the AV site.
7133      *
7134      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
7135      *
7136      * @param {String} email The email address associated with the user that
7137      *     doesn't verify their email address.
7138      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7139      */
7140     requestEmailVerify: function(email, options) {
7141       var json = { email: email };
7142       var request = AV._request("requestEmailVerify", null, null, "POST",
7143                                    json);
7144       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7145     },
7146 
7147    /**
7148     * @Deprecated typo error, please use requestEmailVerify
7149     */
7150     requestEmailVerfiy: function(email, options) {
7151       var json = { email: email };
7152       var request = AV._request("requestEmailVerify", null, null, "POST",
7153                                    json);
7154       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7155     },
7156 
7157     /**
7158      * Requests a verify sms code to be sent to the specified mobile phone
7159      * number associated with the user account. This sms code allows the user to
7160      * verify their mobile phone number by calling AV.User.verifyMobilePhone
7161      *
7162      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
7163      *
7164      * @param {String} mobilePhone The mobile phone number  associated with the
7165      *                  user that doesn't verify their mobile phone number.
7166      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7167      */
7168     requestMobilePhoneVerify: function(mobilePhone, options){
7169       var json = { mobilePhoneNumber: mobilePhone };
7170       var request = AV._request("requestMobilePhoneVerify", null, null, "POST",
7171                                    json);
7172       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7173     },
7174 
7175 
7176     /**
7177      * Requests a reset password sms code to be sent to the specified mobile phone
7178      * number associated with the user account. This sms code allows the user to
7179      * reset their account's password by calling AV.User.resetPasswordBySmsCode
7180      *
7181      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
7182      *
7183      * @param {String} mobilePhone The mobile phone number  associated with the
7184      *                  user that doesn't verify their mobile phone number.
7185      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7186      */
7187     requestPasswordResetBySmsCode: function(mobilePhone, options){
7188       var json = { mobilePhoneNumber: mobilePhone };
7189       var request = AV._request("requestPasswordResetBySmsCode", null, null, "POST",
7190                                    json);
7191       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7192     },
7193 
7194     /**
7195      * Makes a call to reset user's account password by sms code and new password.
7196     * The sms code is sent by AV.User.requestPasswordResetBySmsCode.
7197      * @param {String} code The sms code sent by AV.User.Cloud.requestSmsCode
7198      * @param {String} password The new password.
7199      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object
7200      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that will be resolved with the result
7201      * of the function.
7202      */
7203     resetPasswordBySmsCode: function(code, password, options){
7204       var json = { password: password};
7205       var request = AV._request("resetPasswordBySmsCode", null, code, "PUT",
7206                                 json);
7207       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7208     },
7209 
7210     /**
7211      * Makes a call to verify sms code that sent by AV.User.Cloud.requestSmsCode
7212      * If verify successfully,the user mobilePhoneVerified attribute will be true.
7213      * @param {String} code The sms code sent by AV.User.Cloud.requestSmsCode
7214      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object
7215      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that will be resolved with the result
7216      * of the function.
7217      */
7218     verifyMobilePhone: function(code, options){
7219       var request = AV._request("verifyMobilePhone", null, code, "POST",
7220                                 null);
7221       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7222     },
7223 
7224     /**
7225      * Requests a logIn sms code to be sent to the specified mobile phone
7226      * number associated with the user account. This sms code allows the user to
7227      * login by AV.User.logInWithMobilePhoneSmsCode function.
7228      *
7229      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
7230      *
7231      * @param {String} mobilePhone The mobile phone number  associated with the
7232      *           user that want to login by AV.User.logInWithMobilePhoneSmsCode
7233      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7234      */
7235     requestLoginSmsCode: function(mobilePhone, options){
7236       var json = { mobilePhoneNumber: mobilePhone };
7237       var request = AV._request("requestLoginSmsCode", null, null, "POST",
7238                                    json);
7239       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7240     },
7241 
7242     /**
7243      * Retrieves the currently logged in AVUser with a valid session,
7244      * either from memory or localStorage, if necessary.
7245      * @return {AV.Object} The currently logged in AV.User.
7246      */
7247     current: function() {
7248       if (AV.User._currentUser) {
7249         return AV.User._currentUser;
7250       }
7251 
7252       if (AV.User._currentUserMatchesDisk) {
7253 
7254         return AV.User._currentUser;
7255       }
7256 
7257       // Load the user from local storage.
7258       AV.User._currentUserMatchesDisk = true;
7259 
7260       var userData = AV.localStorage.getItem(AV._getAVPath(
7261           AV.User._CURRENT_USER_KEY));
7262       if (!userData) {
7263 
7264         return null;
7265       }
7266       AV.User._currentUser = AV.Object._create("_User");
7267       AV.User._currentUser._isCurrentUser = true;
7268 
7269       var json = JSON.parse(userData);
7270       AV.User._currentUser.id = json._id;
7271       delete json._id;
7272       AV.User._currentUser._sessionToken = json._sessionToken;
7273       delete json._sessionToken;
7274       AV.User._currentUser._finishFetch(json);
7275       //AV.User._currentUser.set(json);
7276 
7277       AV.User._currentUser._synchronizeAllAuthData();
7278       AV.User._currentUser._refreshCache();
7279       AV.User._currentUser._opSetQueue = [{}];
7280       return AV.User._currentUser;
7281     },
7282 
7283     /**
7284      * Persists a user as currentUser to localStorage, and into the singleton.
7285      */
7286     _saveCurrentUser: function(user) {
7287       if (AV.User._currentUser !== user) {
7288         AV.User.logOut();
7289       }
7290       user._isCurrentUser = true;
7291       AV.User._currentUser = user;
7292       AV.User._currentUserMatchesDisk = true;
7293 
7294       var json = user.toJSON();
7295       json._id = user.id;
7296       json._sessionToken = user._sessionToken;
7297       AV.localStorage.setItem(
7298           AV._getAVPath(AV.User._CURRENT_USER_KEY),
7299           JSON.stringify(json));
7300     },
7301 
7302     _registerAuthenticationProvider: function(provider) {
7303       AV.User._authProviders[provider.getAuthType()] = provider;
7304       // Synchronize the current user with the auth provider.
7305       if (AV.User.current()) {
7306         AV.User.current()._synchronizeAuthData(provider.getAuthType());
7307       }
7308     },
7309 
7310     _logInWith: function(provider, options) {
7311       var user = AV.Object._create("_User");
7312       return user._linkWith(provider, options);
7313     }
7314 
7315   });
7316 }(this));
7317 
7318 // AV.Query is a way to create a list of AV.Objects.
7319 (function(root) {
7320   root.AV = root.AV || {};
7321   var AV = root.AV;
7322   var _ = AV._;
7323 
7324   /**
7325    * Creates a new avoscloud AV.Query for the given AV.Object subclass.
7326    * @param objectClass -
7327    *   An instance of a subclass of AV.Object, or a AV className string.
7328    * @class
7329    *
7330    * <p>AV.Query defines a query that is used to fetch AV.Objects. The
7331    * most common use case is finding all objects that match a query through the
7332    * <code>find</code> method. For example, this sample code fetches all objects
7333    * of class <code>MyClass</code>. It calls a different function depending on
7334    * whether the fetch succeeded or not.
7335    *
7336    * <pre>
7337    * var query = new AV.Query(MyClass);
7338    * query.find({
7339    *   success: function(results) {
7340    *     // results is an array of AV.Object.
7341    *   },
7342    *
7343    *   error: function(error) {
7344    *     // error is an instance of AV.Error.
7345    *   }
7346    * });</pre></p>
7347    *
7348    * <p>A AV.Query can also be used to retrieve a single object whose id is
7349    * known, through the get method. For example, this sample code fetches an
7350    * object of class <code>MyClass</code> and id <code>myId</code>. It calls a
7351    * different function depending on whether the fetch succeeded or not.
7352    *
7353    * <pre>
7354    * var query = new AV.Query(MyClass);
7355    * query.get(myId, {
7356    *   success: function(object) {
7357    *     // object is an instance of AV.Object.
7358    *   },
7359    *
7360    *   error: function(object, error) {
7361    *     // error is an instance of AV.Error.
7362    *   }
7363    * });</pre></p>
7364    *
7365    * <p>A AV.Query can also be used to count the number of objects that match
7366    * the query without retrieving all of those objects. For example, this
7367    * sample code counts the number of objects of the class <code>MyClass</code>
7368    * <pre>
7369    * var query = new AV.Query(MyClass);
7370    * query.count({
7371    *   success: function(number) {
7372    *     // There are number instances of MyClass.
7373    *   },
7374    *
7375    *   error: function(error) {
7376    *     // error is an instance of AV.Error.
7377    *   }
7378    * });</pre></p>
7379    */
7380   AV.Query = function(objectClass) {
7381     if (_.isString(objectClass)) {
7382       objectClass = AV.Object._getSubclass(objectClass);
7383     }
7384 
7385     this.objectClass = objectClass;
7386 
7387     this.className = objectClass.prototype.className;
7388 
7389     this._where = {};
7390     this._include = [];
7391     this._limit = -1; // negative limit means, do not send a limit
7392     this._skip = 0;
7393     this._extraOptions = {};
7394   };
7395 
7396   /**
7397    * Constructs a AV.Query that is the OR of the passed in queries.  For
7398    * example:
7399    * <pre>var compoundQuery = AV.Query.or(query1, query2, query3);</pre>
7400    *
7401    * will create a compoundQuery that is an or of the query1, query2, and
7402    * query3.
7403    * @param {...AV.Query} var_args The list of queries to OR.
7404    * @return {AV.Query} The query that is the OR of the passed in queries.
7405    */
7406   AV.Query.or = function() {
7407     var queries = _.toArray(arguments);
7408     var className = null;
7409     AV._arrayEach(queries, function(q) {
7410       if (_.isNull(className)) {
7411         className = q.className;
7412       }
7413 
7414       if (className !== q.className) {
7415         throw "All queries must be for the same class";
7416       }
7417     });
7418     var query = new AV.Query(className);
7419     query._orQuery(queries);
7420     return query;
7421   };
7422 
7423   /**
7424    * Constructs a AV.Query that is the AND of the passed in queries.  For
7425    * example:
7426    * <pre>var compoundQuery = AV.Query.and(query1, query2, query3);</pre>
7427    *
7428    * will create a compoundQuery that is an 'and' of the query1, query2, and
7429    * query3.
7430    * @param {...AV.Query} var_args The list of queries to AND.
7431    * @return {AV.Query} The query that is the AND of the passed in queries.
7432    */
7433   AV.Query.and = function() {
7434     var queries = _.toArray(arguments);
7435     var className = null;
7436     AV._arrayEach(queries, function(q) {
7437       if (_.isNull(className)) {
7438         className = q.className;
7439       }
7440 
7441       if (className !== q.className) {
7442         throw "All queries must be for the same class";
7443       }
7444     });
7445     var query = new AV.Query(className);
7446     query._andQuery(queries);
7447     return query;
7448   };
7449 
7450   /**
7451    * Retrieves a list of AVObjects that satisfy the CQL.
7452    * CQL syntax please see <a href='https://cn.avoscloud.com/docs/cql_guide.html'>CQL Guide.</a>
7453    * Either options.success or options.error is called when the find
7454    * completes.
7455    *
7456    * @param {String} cql,  A CQL string, see <a href='https://cn.avoscloud.com/docs/cql_guide.html'>CQL Guide.</a>
7457    * @param {Array} pvalues, An array contains placeholder values.
7458    * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object,it's optional.
7459    * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the results when
7460    * the query completes,it's optional.
7461    */
7462   AV.Query.doCloudQuery = function(cql, pvalues, options) {
7463     var params = { cql: cql };
7464     if(_.isArray(pvalues)){
7465       params.pvalues = pvalues;
7466     } else {
7467       options = pvalues;
7468     }
7469 
7470     var request = AV._request("cloudQuery", null, null, 'GET', params);
7471     return request.then(function(response) {
7472       //query to process results.
7473       var query = new AV.Query(response.className);
7474       var results = _.map(response.results, function(json) {
7475         var obj = query._newObject(response);
7476         obj._finishFetch(query._processResult(json), true);
7477           return obj;
7478       });
7479       return {
7480         results: results,
7481         count:  response.count,
7482         className: response.className
7483       };
7484     })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7485   };
7486 
7487   AV.Query._extend = AV._extend;
7488 
7489   AV.Query.prototype = {
7490      //hook to iterate result. Added by dennis<xzhuang@avoscloud.com>.
7491      _processResult: function(obj){
7492         return obj;
7493     },
7494 
7495     /**
7496      * Constructs a AV.Object whose id is already known by fetching data from
7497      * the server.  Either options.success or options.error is called when the
7498      * find completes.
7499      *
7500      * @param {} objectId The id of the object to be fetched.
7501      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7502      */
7503     get: function(objectId, options) {
7504       var self = this;
7505       self.equalTo('objectId', objectId);
7506 
7507       return self.first().then(function(response) {
7508         if (response) {
7509           return response;
7510         }
7511 
7512         var errorObject = new AV.Error(AV.Error.OBJECT_NOT_FOUND,
7513                                           "Object not found.");
7514         return AV.Promise.error(errorObject);
7515 
7516       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, null);
7517     },
7518 
7519     /**
7520      * Returns a JSON representation of this query.
7521      * @return {Object}
7522      */
7523     toJSON: function() {
7524       var params = {
7525         where: this._where
7526       };
7527 
7528       if (this._include.length > 0) {
7529         params.include = this._include.join(",");
7530       }
7531       if (this._select) {
7532         params.keys = this._select.join(",");
7533       }
7534       if (this._limit >= 0) {
7535         params.limit = this._limit;
7536       }
7537       if (this._skip > 0) {
7538         params.skip = this._skip;
7539       }
7540       if (this._order !== undefined) {
7541         params.order = this._order;
7542       }
7543 
7544       AV._objectEach(this._extraOptions, function(v, k) {
7545         params[k] = v;
7546       });
7547 
7548       return params;
7549     },
7550 
7551     _newObject: function(response){
7552       var obj;
7553       if (response && response.className) {
7554         obj = new AV.Object(response.className);
7555       } else {
7556         obj = new this.objectClass();
7557       }
7558       return obj;
7559     },
7560     _createRequest: function(params){
7561       return AV._request("classes", this.className, null, "GET",
7562                                    params || this.toJSON());
7563     },
7564 
7565     /**
7566      * Retrieves a list of AVObjects that satisfy this query.
7567      * Either options.success or options.error is called when the find
7568      * completes.
7569      *
7570      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7571      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the results when
7572      * the query completes.
7573      */
7574     find: function(options) {
7575       var self = this;
7576 
7577       var request = this._createRequest();
7578 
7579       return request.then(function(response) {
7580         return _.map(response.results, function(json) {
7581           var obj = self._newObject(response);
7582           obj._finishFetch(self._processResult(json), true);
7583           return obj;
7584         });
7585       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7586     },
7587 
7588    /**
7589     * Delete objects retrieved by this query.
7590     * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
7591     *     callbacks.
7592     * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the save
7593     *     completes.
7594     */
7595      destroyAll: function(options){
7596        var self = this;
7597        return self.find().then(function(objects){
7598            return AV.Object.destroyAll(objects);
7599        })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7600      },
7601 
7602     /**
7603      * Counts the number of objects that match this query.
7604      * Either options.success or options.error is called when the count
7605      * completes.
7606      *
7607      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7608      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the count when
7609      * the query completes.
7610      */
7611     count: function(options) {
7612       var params = this.toJSON();
7613       params.limit = 0;
7614       params.count = 1;
7615       var request = this._createRequest(params);
7616 
7617       return request.then(function(response) {
7618         return response.count;
7619       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7620     },
7621 
7622     /**
7623      * Retrieves at most one AV.Object that satisfies this query.
7624      *
7625      * Either options.success or options.error is called when it completes.
7626      * success is passed the object if there is one. otherwise, undefined.
7627      *
7628      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7629      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the object when
7630      * the query completes.
7631      */
7632     first: function(options) {
7633       var self = this;
7634 
7635       var params = this.toJSON();
7636       params.limit = 1;
7637       var request = this._createRequest(params);
7638 
7639       return request.then(function(response) {
7640         return _.map(response.results, function(json) {
7641           var obj = self._newObject();
7642           obj._finishFetch(self._processResult(json), true);
7643           return obj;
7644         })[0];
7645       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7646     },
7647 
7648     /**
7649      * Returns a new instance of AV.Collection backed by this query.
7650      * @return {AV.Collection}
7651      */
7652     collection: function(items, options) {
7653       options = options || {};
7654       return new AV.Collection(items, _.extend(options, {
7655         model: this._objectClass || this.objectClass,
7656         query: this
7657       }));
7658     },
7659 
7660     /**
7661      * Sets the number of results to skip before returning any results.
7662      * This is useful for pagination.
7663      * Default is to skip zero results.
7664      * @param {Number} n the number of results to skip.
7665      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7666      */
7667     skip: function(n) {
7668       this._skip = n;
7669       return this;
7670     },
7671 
7672     /**
7673      * Sets the limit of the number of results to return. The default limit is
7674      * 100, with a maximum of 1000 results being returned at a time.
7675      * @param {Number} n the number of results to limit to.
7676      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7677      */
7678     limit: function(n) {
7679       this._limit = n;
7680       return this;
7681     },
7682 
7683     /**
7684      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7685      * be equal to the provided value.
7686      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7687      * @param value The value that the AV.Object must contain.
7688      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7689      */
7690     equalTo: function(key, value) {
7691       this._where[key] = AV._encode(value);
7692       return this;
7693     },
7694 
7695     /**
7696      * Helper for condition queries
7697      */
7698     _addCondition: function(key, condition, value) {
7699       // Check if we already have a condition
7700       if (!this._where[key]) {
7701         this._where[key] = {};
7702       }
7703       this._where[key][condition] = AV._encode(value);
7704       return this;
7705     },
7706 
7707     /**
7708      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular
7709      * <strong>array</strong> key's length to be equal to the provided value.
7710      * @param {String} key The array key to check.
7711      * @param value The length value.
7712      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7713      */
7714     sizeEqualTo: function(key, value) {
7715       this._addCondition(key, "$size", value);
7716     },
7717 
7718     /**
7719      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7720      * be not equal to the provided value.
7721      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7722      * @param value The value that must not be equalled.
7723      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7724      */
7725     notEqualTo: function(key, value) {
7726       this._addCondition(key, "$ne", value);
7727       return this;
7728     },
7729 
7730     /**
7731      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7732      * be less than the provided value.
7733      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7734      * @param value The value that provides an upper bound.
7735      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7736      */
7737     lessThan: function(key, value) {
7738       this._addCondition(key, "$lt", value);
7739       return this;
7740     },
7741 
7742     /**
7743      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7744      * be greater than the provided value.
7745      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7746      * @param value The value that provides an lower bound.
7747      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7748      */
7749     greaterThan: function(key, value) {
7750       this._addCondition(key, "$gt", value);
7751       return this;
7752     },
7753 
7754     /**
7755      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7756      * be less than or equal to the provided value.
7757      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7758      * @param value The value that provides an upper bound.
7759      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7760      */
7761     lessThanOrEqualTo: function(key, value) {
7762       this._addCondition(key, "$lte", value);
7763       return this;
7764     },
7765 
7766     /**
7767      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7768      * be greater than or equal to the provided value.
7769      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7770      * @param value The value that provides an lower bound.
7771      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7772      */
7773     greaterThanOrEqualTo: function(key, value) {
7774       this._addCondition(key, "$gte", value);
7775       return this;
7776     },
7777 
7778     /**
7779      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7780      * be contained in the provided list of values.
7781      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7782      * @param {Array} values The values that will match.
7783      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7784      */
7785     containedIn: function(key, values) {
7786       this._addCondition(key, "$in", values);
7787       return this;
7788     },
7789 
7790     /**
7791      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7792      * not be contained in the provided list of values.
7793      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7794      * @param {Array} values The values that will not match.
7795      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7796      */
7797     notContainedIn: function(key, values) {
7798       this._addCondition(key, "$nin", values);
7799       return this;
7800     },
7801 
7802     /**
7803      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7804      * contain each one of the provided list of values.
7805      * @param {String} key The key to check.  This key's value must be an array.
7806      * @param {Array} values The values that will match.
7807      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7808      */
7809     containsAll: function(key, values) {
7810       this._addCondition(key, "$all", values);
7811       return this;
7812     },
7813 
7814 
7815     /**
7816      * Add a constraint for finding objects that contain the given key.
7817      * @param {String} key The key that should exist.
7818      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7819      */
7820     exists: function(key) {
7821       this._addCondition(key, "$exists", true);
7822       return this;
7823     },
7824 
7825     /**
7826      * Add a constraint for finding objects that do not contain a given key.
7827      * @param {String} key The key that should not exist
7828      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7829      */
7830     doesNotExist: function(key) {
7831       this._addCondition(key, "$exists", false);
7832       return this;
7833     },
7834 
7835     /**
7836      * Add a regular expression constraint for finding string values that match
7837      * the provided regular expression.
7838      * This may be slow for large datasets.
7839      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
7840      * @param {RegExp} regex The regular expression pattern to match.
7841      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7842      */
7843     matches: function(key, regex, modifiers) {
7844       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", regex);
7845       if (!modifiers) { modifiers = ""; }
7846       // Javascript regex options support mig as inline options but store them
7847       // as properties of the object. We support mi & should migrate them to
7848       // modifiers
7849       if (regex.ignoreCase) { modifiers += 'i'; }
7850       if (regex.multiline) { modifiers += 'm'; }
7851 
7852       if (modifiers && modifiers.length) {
7853         this._addCondition(key, "$options", modifiers);
7854       }
7855       return this;
7856     },
7857 
7858     /**
7859      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value matches a AV.Query
7860      * constraint.
7861      * @param {String} key The key that the contains the object to match the
7862      *                     query.
7863      * @param {AV.Query} query The query that should match.
7864      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7865      */
7866     matchesQuery: function(key, query) {
7867       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
7868       queryJSON.className = query.className;
7869       this._addCondition(key, "$inQuery", queryJSON);
7870       return this;
7871     },
7872 
7873    /**
7874      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value not matches a
7875      * AV.Query constraint.
7876      * @param {String} key The key that the contains the object to match the
7877      *                     query.
7878      * @param {AV.Query} query The query that should not match.
7879      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7880      */
7881     doesNotMatchQuery: function(key, query) {
7882       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
7883       queryJSON.className = query.className;
7884       this._addCondition(key, "$notInQuery", queryJSON);
7885       return this;
7886     },
7887 
7888 
7889     /**
7890      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value matches a value in
7891      * an object returned by a different AV.Query.
7892      * @param {String} key The key that contains the value that is being
7893      *                     matched.
7894      * @param {String} queryKey The key in the objects returned by the query to
7895      *                          match against.
7896      * @param {AV.Query} query The query to run.
7897      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7898      */
7899     matchesKeyInQuery: function(key, queryKey, query) {
7900       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
7901       queryJSON.className = query.className;
7902       this._addCondition(key, "$select",
7903                          { key: queryKey, query: queryJSON });
7904       return this;
7905     },
7906 
7907     /**
7908      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value not match a value in
7909      * an object returned by a different AV.Query.
7910      * @param {String} key The key that contains the value that is being
7911      *                     excluded.
7912      * @param {String} queryKey The key in the objects returned by the query to
7913      *                          match against.
7914      * @param {AV.Query} query The query to run.
7915      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7916      */
7917     doesNotMatchKeyInQuery: function(key, queryKey, query) {
7918       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
7919       queryJSON.className = query.className;
7920       this._addCondition(key, "$dontSelect",
7921                          { key: queryKey, query: queryJSON });
7922       return this;
7923     },
7924 
7925     /**
7926      * Add constraint that at least one of the passed in queries matches.
7927      * @param {Array} queries
7928      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7929      */
7930     _orQuery: function(queries) {
7931       var queryJSON = _.map(queries, function(q) {
7932         return q.toJSON().where;
7933       });
7934 
7935       this._where.$or = queryJSON;
7936       return this;
7937     },
7938 
7939     /**
7940      * Add constraint that both of the passed in queries matches.
7941      * @param {Array} queries
7942      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7943      */
7944     _andQuery: function(queries) {
7945       var queryJSON = _.map(queries, function(q) {
7946         return q.toJSON().where;
7947       });
7948 
7949       this._where.$and = queryJSON;
7950       return this;
7951     },
7952 
7953 
7954     /**
7955      * Converts a string into a regex that matches it.
7956      * Surrounding with \Q .. \E does this, we just need to escape \E's in
7957      * the text separately.
7958      */
7959     _quote: function(s) {
7960       return "\\Q" + s.replace("\\E", "\\E\\\\E\\Q") + "\\E";
7961     },
7962 
7963     /**
7964      * Add a constraint for finding string values that contain a provided
7965      * string.  This may be slow for large datasets.
7966      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
7967      * @param {String} substring The substring that the value must contain.
7968      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7969      */
7970     contains: function(key, value) {
7971       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", this._quote(value));
7972       return this;
7973     },
7974 
7975     /**
7976      * Add a constraint for finding string values that start with a provided
7977      * string.  This query will use the backend index, so it will be fast even
7978      * for large datasets.
7979      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
7980      * @param {String} prefix The substring that the value must start with.
7981      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7982      */
7983     startsWith: function(key, value) {
7984       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", "^" + this._quote(value));
7985       return this;
7986     },
7987 
7988     /**
7989      * Add a constraint for finding string values that end with a provided
7990      * string.  This will be slow for large datasets.
7991      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
7992      * @param {String} suffix The substring that the value must end with.
7993      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7994      */
7995     endsWith: function(key, value) {
7996       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", this._quote(value) + "$");
7997       return this;
7998     },
7999 
8000     /**
8001      * Sorts the results in ascending order by the given key.
8002      *
8003      * @param {String} key The key to order by.
8004      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8005      */
8006     ascending: function(key) {
8007       this._order = key;
8008       return this;
8009     },
8010 
8011   /**
8012    * Also sorts the results in ascending order by the given key. The previous sort keys have
8013    * precedence over this key.
8014    *
8015    * @param {String} key The key to order by
8016    * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query so you can chain this call.
8017    */
8018    addAscending: function(key){
8019      if(this._order)
8020        this._order +=  ','  + key;
8021     else
8022        this._order = key;
8023     return this;
8024    },
8025 
8026     /**
8027      * Sorts the results in descending order by the given key.
8028      *
8029      * @param {String} key The key to order by.
8030      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8031      */
8032     descending: function(key) {
8033       this._order = "-" + key;
8034       return this;
8035     },
8036 
8037      /**
8038    * Also sorts the results in descending order by the given key. The previous sort keys have
8039    * precedence over this key.
8040    *
8041    * @param {String} key The key to order by
8042    * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query so you can chain this call.
8043    */
8044    addDescending: function(key){
8045      if(this._order)
8046        this._order += ',-' + key;
8047      else
8048        this._order = '-' + key;
8049      return key;
8050    },
8051 
8052     /**
8053      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
8054      * values near the point given.
8055      * @param {String} key The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
8056      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
8057      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8058      */
8059     near: function(key, point) {
8060       if (!(point instanceof AV.GeoPoint)) {
8061         // Try to cast it to a GeoPoint, so that near("loc", [20,30]) works.
8062         point = new AV.GeoPoint(point);
8063       }
8064       this._addCondition(key, "$nearSphere", point);
8065       return this;
8066     },
8067 
8068     /**
8069      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
8070      * values near the point given and within the maximum distance given.
8071      * @param {String} key The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
8072      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
8073      * @param maxDistance Maximum distance (in radians) of results to return.
8074      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8075      */
8076     withinRadians: function(key, point, distance) {
8077       this.near(key, point);
8078       this._addCondition(key, "$maxDistance", distance);
8079       return this;
8080     },
8081 
8082     /**
8083      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
8084      * values near the point given and within the maximum distance given.
8085      * Radius of earth used is 3958.8 miles.
8086      * @param {String} key The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
8087      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
8088      * @param {Number} maxDistance Maximum distance (in miles) of results to
8089      *     return.
8090      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8091      */
8092     withinMiles: function(key, point, distance) {
8093       return this.withinRadians(key, point, distance / 3958.8);
8094     },
8095 
8096     /**
8097      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
8098      * values near the point given and within the maximum distance given.
8099      * Radius of earth used is 6371.0 kilometers.
8100      * @param {String} key The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
8101      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
8102      * @param {Number} maxDistance Maximum distance (in kilometers) of results
8103      *     to return.
8104      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8105      */
8106     withinKilometers: function(key, point, distance) {
8107       return this.withinRadians(key, point, distance / 6371.0);
8108     },
8109 
8110     /**
8111      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's
8112      * coordinates be contained within a given rectangular geographic bounding
8113      * box.
8114      * @param {String} key The key to be constrained.
8115      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} southwest
8116      *     The lower-left inclusive corner of the box.
8117      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} northeast
8118      *     The upper-right inclusive corner of the box.
8119      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8120      */
8121     withinGeoBox: function(key, southwest, northeast) {
8122       if (!(southwest instanceof AV.GeoPoint)) {
8123         southwest = new AV.GeoPoint(southwest);
8124       }
8125       if (!(northeast instanceof AV.GeoPoint)) {
8126         northeast = new AV.GeoPoint(northeast);
8127       }
8128       this._addCondition(key, '$within', { '$box': [southwest, northeast] });
8129       return this;
8130     },
8131 
8132     /**
8133      * Include nested AV.Objects for the provided key.  You can use dot
8134      * notation to specify which fields in the included object are also fetch.
8135      * @param {String} key The name of the key to include.
8136      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8137      */
8138     include: function() {
8139       var self = this;
8140       AV._arrayEach(arguments, function(key) {
8141         if (_.isArray(key)) {
8142           self._include = self._include.concat(key);
8143         } else {
8144           self._include.push(key);
8145         }
8146       });
8147       return this;
8148     },
8149 
8150     /**
8151      * Restrict the fields of the returned AV.Objects to include only the
8152      * provided keys.  If this is called multiple times, then all of the keys
8153      * specified in each of the calls will be included.
8154      * @param {Array} keys The names of the keys to include.
8155      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8156      */
8157     select: function() {
8158       var self = this;
8159       this._select = this._select || [];
8160       AV._arrayEach(arguments, function(key) {
8161         if (_.isArray(key)) {
8162           self._select = self._select.concat(key);
8163         } else {
8164           self._select.push(key);
8165         }
8166       });
8167       return this;
8168     },
8169 
8170     /**
8171      * Iterates over each result of a query, calling a callback for each one. If
8172      * the callback returns a promise, the iteration will not continue until
8173      * that promise has been fulfilled. If the callback returns a rejected
8174      * promise, then iteration will stop with that error. The items are
8175      * processed in an unspecified order. The query may not have any sort order,
8176      * and may not use limit or skip.
8177      * @param callback {Function} Callback that will be called with each result
8178      *     of the query.
8179      * @param options {Object} An optional Backbone-like options object with
8180      *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
8181      *     has finished.
8182      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that will be fulfilled once the
8183      *     iteration has completed.
8184      */
8185     each: function(callback, options) {
8186       options = options || {};
8187 
8188       if (this._order || this._skip || (this._limit >= 0)) {
8189         var error =
8190           "Cannot iterate on a query with sort, skip, or limit.";
8191         return AV.Promise.error(error)._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8192       }
8193 
8194       var promise = new AV.Promise();
8195 
8196       var query = new AV.Query(this.objectClass);
8197       // We can override the batch size from the options.
8198       // This is undocumented, but useful for testing.
8199       query._limit = options.batchSize || 100;
8200       query._where = _.clone(this._where);
8201       query._include = _.clone(this._include);
8202 
8203       query.ascending('objectId');
8204 
8205       var finished = false;
8206       return AV.Promise._continueWhile(function() {
8207         return !finished;
8208 
8209       }, function() {
8210         return query.find().then(function(results) {
8211           var callbacksDone = AV.Promise.as();
8212           AV._.each(results, function(result) {
8213             callbacksDone = callbacksDone.then(function() {
8214               return callback(result);
8215             });
8216           });
8217 
8218           return callbacksDone.then(function() {
8219             if (results.length >= query._limit) {
8220               query.greaterThan("objectId", results[results.length - 1].id);
8221             } else {
8222               finished = true;
8223             }
8224           });
8225         });
8226       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8227     }
8228   };
8229 
8230    AV.FriendShipQuery = AV.Query._extend({
8231      _objectClass: AV.User,
8232      _newObject: function(){
8233       return new AV.User();
8234     },
8235      _processResult: function(json){
8236       var user = json[this._friendshipTag];
8237       if(user.__type === 'Pointer' && user.className === '_User'){
8238         delete user.__type;
8239         delete user.className;
8240       }
8241       return user;
8242     },
8243    });
8244 }(this));
8245 
8246 (function(root) {
8247   root.AV = root.AV || {};
8248   var AV = root.AV;
8249   var _ = AV._;
8250 
8251   /**
8252    * @namespace Contains functions for calling and declaring
8253    * <a href="/docs/cloud_code_guide#functions">cloud functions</a>.
8254    * <p><strong><em>
8255    *   Some functions are only available from Cloud Code.
8256    * </em></strong></p>
8257    */
8258   AV.Cloud = AV.Cloud || {};
8259 
8260   _.extend(AV.Cloud, /** @lends AV.Cloud */ {
8261     /**
8262      * Makes a call to a cloud function.
8263      * @param {String} name The function name.
8264      * @param {Object} data The parameters to send to the cloud function.
8265      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object
8266      * options.success, if set, should be a function to handle a successful
8267      * call to a cloud function.  options.error should be a function that
8268      * handles an error running the cloud function.  Both functions are
8269      * optional.  Both functions take a single argument.
8270      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that will be resolved with the result
8271      * of the function.
8272      */
8273     run: function(name, data, options) {
8274       var request = AV._request("functions", name, null, 'POST',
8275                                    AV._encode(data, null, true));
8276 
8277       return request.then(function(resp) {
8278         return AV._decode(null, resp).result;
8279       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8280     },
8281 
8282     /**
8283      * Makes a call to request a sms code for operation verification.
8284      * @param {Object} data The mobile phone number string or a JSON
8285      *    object that contains mobilePhoneNumber,template,op,ttl,name etc.
8286      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object
8287      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that will be resolved with the result
8288      * of the function.
8289      */
8290     requestSmsCode: function(data, options){
8291       if(_.isString(data)) {
8292         data = { mobilePhoneNumber: data };
8293       }
8294       if(!data.mobilePhoneNumber) {
8295         throw "Missing mobilePhoneNumber.";
8296       }
8297       var request = AV._request("requestSmsCode", null, null, 'POST',
8298                                     data);
8299       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8300     },
8301 
8302     /**
8303      * Makes a call to verify sms code that sent by AV.Cloud.requestSmsCode
8304      * @param {String} code The sms code sent by AV.Cloud.requestSmsCode
8305      * @param {phone} phone The mobile phoner number(optional).
8306      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object
8307      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that will be resolved with the result
8308      * of the function.
8309      */
8310     verifySmsCode: function(code, phone, options){
8311       if(!code)
8312         throw "Missing sms code.";
8313       var params = {};
8314       if(AV._.isString(phone)) {
8315          params['mobilePhoneNumber'] = phone;
8316       } else {
8317         // To be compatible with old versions.
8318          options = phone;
8319       }
8320 
8321       var request = AV._request("verifySmsCode", code, null, 'POST',
8322                                    params);
8323       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8324     }
8325   });
8326 }(this));
8327 
8328 (function(root) {
8329   root.AV = root.AV || {};
8330   var AV = root.AV;
8331 
8332   AV.Installation = AV.Object.extend("_Installation");
8333 
8334   /**
8335    * Contains functions to deal with Push in AV
8336    * @name AV.Push
8337    * @namespace
8338    */
8339   AV.Push = AV.Push || {};
8340 
8341   /**
8342    * Sends a push notification.
8343    * @param {Object} data -  The data of the push notification.  Valid fields
8344    * are:
8345    *   <ol>
8346    *     <li>channels - An Array of channels to push to.</li>
8347    *     <li>push_time - A Date object for when to send the push.</li>
8348    *     <li>expiration_time -  A Date object for when to expire
8349    *         the push.</li>
8350    *     <li>expiration_interval - The seconds from now to expire the push.</li>
8351    *     <li>where - A AV.Query over AV.Installation that is used to match
8352    *         a set of installations to push to.</li>
8353    *     <li>cql - A CQL statement over AV.Installation that is used to match
8354    *         a set of installations to push to.</li>
8355    *     <li>data - The data to send as part of the push</li>
8356    *   <ol>
8357    * @param {Object} options An object that has an optional success function,
8358    * that takes no arguments and will be called on a successful push, and
8359    * an error function that takes a AV.Error and will be called if the push
8360    * failed.
8361    */
8362   AV.Push.send = function(data, options) {
8363     if (data.where) {
8364       data.where = data.where.toJSON().where;
8365     }
8366 
8367     if(data.where && data.cql){
8368       throw "Both where and cql can't be set";
8369     }
8370 
8371     if (data.push_time) {
8372       data.push_time = data.push_time.toJSON();
8373     }
8374 
8375     if (data.expiration_time) {
8376       data.expiration_time = data.expiration_time.toJSON();
8377     }
8378 
8379     if (data.expiration_time && data.expiration_time_interval) {
8380       throw "Both expiration_time and expiration_time_interval can't be set";
8381     }
8382 
8383     var request = AV._request('push', null, null, 'POST', data);
8384     return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8385   };
8386 }(this));
8387 
8388 (function(root) {
8389   root.AV = root.AV || {};
8390   var AV = root.AV;
8391   var _ = AV._;
8392 
8393 
8394   /**
8395    * Contains functions to deal with Status in AVOS Cloud.
8396    * @name AV.Status
8397    * @namespace
8398    */
8399   AV.Status = function(imageUrl, message) {
8400     this.data = {};
8401     this.inboxType = 'default';
8402     this.query = null;
8403     if(imageUrl && typeof imageUrl === 'object') {
8404         this.data = imageUrl;
8405     } else {
8406       if(imageUrl){
8407         this.data.image = imageUrl;
8408       }
8409       if(message){
8410         this.data.message = message;
8411       }
8412     }
8413     return this;
8414   };
8415 
8416   AV.Status.prototype = {
8417     /**
8418      * Gets the value of an attribute in status data.
8419      * @param {String} attr The string name of an attribute.
8420      */
8421     get: function(attr){
8422       return this.data[attr];
8423     },
8424     /**
8425      * Sets a hash of model attributes on the status data.
8426      * @param {String} key The key to set.
8427      * @param {} value The value to give it.
8428      */
8429     set: function(key, value){
8430       this.data[key] = value;
8431       return this;
8432     },
8433     /**
8434      * Destroy this status,then it will not be avaiable in other user's inboxes.
8435      * @param {Object} options An optional Backbone-like options object with
8436      *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
8437      *     has finished.
8438      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the destroy
8439      *     completes.
8440      */
8441     destroy: function(options){
8442       if(!this.id)
8443         return AV.Promise.error('The status id is not exists.')._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8444       var request = AV._request("statuses", null, this.id, 'DELETE');
8445       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8446     },
8447     /**
8448       * Cast the AV.Status object to an AV.Object pointer.
8449       * @return {AV.Object} A AV.Object pointer.
8450       */
8451     toObject: function(){
8452       if(!this.id)
8453           return null;
8454       return AV.Object.createWithoutData('_Status', this.id);
8455     },
8456     _getDataJSON: function() {
8457       var json = AV._.clone(this.data);
8458       return AV._encode(json);
8459     },
8460    /**
8461     * Send  a status by a AV.Query object.
8462     * <p>For example,send a status to male users:<br/><pre>
8463     *     var status = new AVStatus('image url', 'a message');
8464     *     status.query = new AV.Query('_User');
8465     *     status.query.equalTo('gender', 'male');
8466     *     status.send().then(function(){
8467     *              //send status successfully.
8468     *      }, function(err){
8469     *             //an error threw.
8470     *             console.dir(err);
8471     *      });
8472     * </pre></p>
8473     * @since 0.3.0
8474     * @param {Object} options An optional Backbone-like options object with
8475     *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
8476     *     has finished.
8477     * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the send
8478     *     completes.
8479     */
8480     send: function(options){
8481       if(!AV.User.current()){
8482         throw 'Please signin an user.';
8483       }
8484       if(!this.query){
8485         return AV.Status.sendStatusToFollowers(this, options);
8486       }
8487 
8488       var query = this.query.toJSON();
8489       query.className = this.query.className;
8490       var data = {};
8491       data.query = query;
8492       this.data = this.data || {};
8493       var currUser =  AV.Object.createWithoutData('_User', AV.User.current().id)._toPointer();
8494       this.data.source =  this.data.source || currUser;
8495       data.data = this._getDataJSON();
8496       data.inboxType = this.inboxType || 'default';
8497 
8498       var request = AV._request('statuses', null, null, 'POST', data);
8499       var self = this;
8500       return request.then(function(response){
8501         self.id = response.objectId;
8502         self.createdAt = AV._parseDate(response.createdAt);
8503         return self;
8504       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8505     },
8506 
8507     _finishFetch: function(serverData){
8508         this.id = serverData.objectId;
8509         this.createdAt = AV._parseDate(serverData.createdAt);
8510         this.updatedAt = AV._parseDate(serverData.updatedAt);
8511         this.messageId = serverData.messageId;
8512         delete serverData.messageId;
8513         delete serverData.objectId;
8514         delete serverData.createdAt;
8515         delete serverData.updatedAt;
8516         this.data = AV._decode(undefined, serverData);
8517     }
8518   };
8519 
8520   /**
8521    * Send  a status to current signined user's followers.For example:
8522    * <p><pre>
8523    *     var status = new AVStatus('image url', 'a message');
8524    *     AV.Status.sendStatusToFollowers(status).then(function(){
8525    *              //send status successfully.
8526    *      }, function(err){
8527    *             //an error threw.
8528    *             console.dir(err);
8529    *      });
8530    * </pre></p>
8531    * @since 0.3.0
8532    * @param {AV.Status} status  A status object to be send to followers.
8533    * @param {Object} options An optional Backbone-like options object with
8534    *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
8535    *     has finished.
8536    * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the send
8537    *     completes.
8538    */
8539   AV.Status.sendStatusToFollowers = function(status, options) {
8540     if(!AV.User.current()){
8541       throw 'Please signin an user.';
8542     }
8543     var query = {};
8544     query.className = '_Follower';
8545     query.keys = 'follower';
8546     var currUser =  AV.Object.createWithoutData('_User', AV.User.current().id). _toPointer();
8547     query.where = {user: currUser};
8548     var data = {};
8549     data.query = query;
8550     status.data = status.data || {};
8551     status.data.source =  status.data.source || currUser;
8552     data.data = status._getDataJSON();
8553     data.inboxType = status.inboxType || 'default';
8554 
8555     var request = AV._request('statuses', null, null, 'POST', data);
8556     return request.then(function(response){
8557       status.id = response.objectId;
8558       status.createdAt = AV._parseDate(response.createdAt);
8559       return status;
8560     })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8561   };
8562 
8563   /**
8564    * <p>Send  a status from current signined user to other user's private status inbox.</p>
8565    * <p>For example,send a private status to user '52e84e47e4b0f8de283b079b':<br/>
8566    * <pre>
8567    *    var status = new AVStatus('image url', 'a message');
8568    *     AV.Status.sendPrivateStatus(status, '52e84e47e4b0f8de283b079b').then(function(){
8569    *              //send status successfully.
8570    *      }, function(err){
8571    *             //an error threw.
8572    *             console.dir(err);
8573    *      });
8574    * </pre></p>
8575    * @since 0.3.0
8576    * @param {AV.Status} status  A status object to be send to followers.
8577    * @param {} target The target user or user's objectId.
8578    * @param {Object} options An optional Backbone-like options object with
8579    *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
8580    *     has finished.
8581    * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the send
8582    *     completes.
8583    */
8584   AV.Status.sendPrivateStatus = function(status, target, options) {
8585     if(!AV.User.current()){
8586       throw 'Please signin an user.';
8587     }
8588     if(!target){
8589           throw "Invalid target user.";
8590     }
8591     var userObjectId = _.isString(target) ? target: target.id;
8592     if(!userObjectId){
8593         throw "Invalid target user.";
8594     }
8595 
8596     var query = {};
8597     query.className = '_User';
8598     var currUser =  AV.Object.createWithoutData('_User', AV.User.current().id). _toPointer();
8599     query.where = {objectId: userObjectId};
8600     var data = {};
8601     data.query = query;
8602     status.data = status.data || {};
8603     status.data.source =  status.data.source || currUser;
8604     data.data = status._getDataJSON();
8605     data.inboxType = 'private';
8606     status.inboxType = 'private';
8607 
8608     var request = AV._request('statuses', null, null, 'POST', data);
8609     return request.then(function(response){
8610       status.id = response.objectId;
8611       status.createdAt = AV._parseDate(response.createdAt);
8612       return status;
8613     })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8614   };
8615 
8616   /**
8617    * Count unread statuses in someone's inbox.For example:<br/>
8618    * <p><pre>
8619    *  AV.Status.countUnreadStatuses(AV.User.current()).then(function(response){
8620    *    console.log(response.unread); //unread statuses number.
8621    *    console.log(response.total);  //total statuses number.
8622    *  });
8623    * </pre></p>
8624    * @since 0.3.0
8625    * @param {Object} source The status source.
8626    * @return {AV.Query} The query object for status.
8627    * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the count
8628    *     completes.
8629    */
8630   AV.Status.countUnreadStatuses = function(owner){
8631     if(!AV.User.current() && owner == null){
8632       throw 'Please signin an user or pass the owner objectId.';
8633     }
8634     owner = owner || AV.User.current();
8635     var options = !_.isString(arguments[1]) ? arguments[1] : arguments[2];
8636     var inboxType =  !_.isString(arguments[1]) ? 'default' : arguments[1];
8637     var params = {};
8638     params.inboxType = AV._encode(inboxType);
8639     params.owner = AV._encode(owner);
8640     var request = AV._request('subscribe/statuses/count', null, null, 'GET', params);
8641     return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8642   };
8643 
8644   /**
8645    * Create a status query to find someone's published statuses.For example:<br/>
8646    * <p><pre>
8647    *   //Find current user's published statuses.
8648    *   var query = AV.Status.statusQuery(AV.User.current());
8649    *   query.find().then(function(statuses){
8650    *      //process statuses
8651    *   });
8652    * </pre></p>
8653    * @since 0.3.0
8654    * @param {Object} source The status source.
8655    * @return {AV.Query} The query object for status.
8656    */
8657   AV.Status.statusQuery = function(source){
8658     var query = new AV.Query('_Status');
8659     if(source){
8660       query.equalTo('source', source);
8661     }
8662     return query;
8663   };
8664 
8665    /**
8666     * <p>AV.InboxQuery defines a query that is used to fetch somebody's inbox statuses.</p>
8667     * @see AV.Status#inboxQuery
8668     * @class
8669     */
8670    AV.InboxQuery = AV.Query._extend(/** @lends AV.InboxQuery.prototype */{
8671      _objectClass: AV.Status,
8672      _sinceId: 0,
8673      _maxId:  0,
8674      _inboxType: 'default',
8675      _owner: null,
8676      _newObject: function(){
8677       return new AV.Status();
8678     },
8679     _createRequest: function(params){
8680       return AV._request("subscribe/statuses", null, null, "GET",
8681                                    params || this.toJSON());
8682     },
8683 
8684 
8685     /**
8686      * Sets the messageId of results to skip before returning any results.
8687      * This is useful for pagination.
8688      * Default is zero.
8689      * @param {Number} n the mesage id.
8690      * @return {AV.InboxQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8691      */
8692     sinceId: function(id){
8693       this._sinceId = id;
8694       return this;
8695     },
8696     /**
8697      * Sets the maximal messageId of results
8698      * This is useful for pagination.
8699      * Default is zero that is no limition.
8700      * @param {Number} n the mesage id.
8701      * @return {AV.InboxQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8702      */
8703     maxId: function(id){
8704       this._maxId = id;
8705       return this;
8706     },
8707     /**
8708      * Sets the owner of the querying inbox.
8709      * @param {Object} owner The inbox owner.
8710      * @return {AV.InboxQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8711      */
8712     owner: function(owner){
8713       this._owner = owner;
8714       return this;
8715     },
8716     /**
8717      * Sets the querying inbox type.default is 'default'.
8718      * @param {Object} owner The inbox type.
8719      * @return {AV.InboxQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8720      */
8721     inboxType: function(type){
8722       this._inboxType = type;
8723       return this;
8724     },
8725     toJSON: function(){
8726       var params = AV.InboxQuery.__super__.toJSON.call(this);
8727       params.owner = AV._encode(this._owner);
8728       params.inboxType = AV._encode(this._inboxType);
8729       params.sinceId = AV._encode(this._sinceId);
8730       params.maxId = AV._encode(this._maxId);
8731       return params;
8732     }
8733    });
8734 
8735   /**
8736    * Create a inbox status query to find someone's inbox statuses.For example:<br/>
8737    * <p><pre>
8738    *   //Find current user's default inbox statuses.
8739    *   var query = AV.Status.inboxQuery(AV.User.current());
8740    *   //find the statuses after the last message id
8741    *   query.sinceId(lastMessageId);
8742    *   query.find().then(function(statuses){
8743    *      //process statuses
8744    *   });
8745    * </pre></p>
8746    * @since 0.3.0
8747    * @param {Object} owner The inbox's owner
8748    * @param {String} inboxType The inbox type,'default' by default.
8749    * @return {AV.InboxQuery} The inbox query object.
8750    * @see AV.InboxQuery
8751    */
8752   AV.Status.inboxQuery = function(owner, inboxType){
8753     var query = new AV.InboxQuery(AV.Status);
8754     if(owner){
8755       query._owner = owner;
8756     }
8757     if(inboxType){
8758       query._inboxType = inboxType;
8759     }
8760     return query;
8761   };
8762 
8763 }(this));
8764 
8765 (function(root) {
8766   root.AV = root.AV || {};
8767   var AV = root.AV;
8768   var _ = AV._;
8769 
8770   /**
8771    * A builder to generate sort string for app searching.For example:
8772    * <pre><code>
8773    *   var builder = new AV.SearchSortBuilder();
8774    *   builder.ascending('key1').descending('key2','max');
8775    *   var query = new AV.SearchQuery('Player');
8776    *   query.sortBy(builder);
8777    *   query.find().then ...
8778    * </code></pre>
8779    * @class
8780    * @since 0.5.1
8781    */
8782   AV.SearchSortBuilder = function() {
8783     this._sortFields = [];
8784   };
8785 
8786   AV.SearchSortBuilder.prototype = {
8787     _addField: function(key, order, mode, missing) {
8788       var field = {};
8789       field[key] = {
8790         order: order || 'asc',
8791         mode: mode ||'avg',
8792         missing: '_' + (missing || 'last')
8793       };
8794       this._sortFields.push(field);
8795       return this;
8796     },
8797 
8798 
8799     /**
8800      * Sorts the results in ascending order by the given key and options.
8801      *
8802      * @param {String} key The key to order by.
8803      * @param {String} mode The sort mode, default is 'avg', you can choose
8804      *                  'max' or 'min' too.
8805      * @param {String} missing The missing key behaviour, default is 'last',
8806      *                  you can choose 'first' too.
8807      * @return {AV.SearchSortBuilder} Returns the builder, so you can chain this call.
8808      */
8809     ascending: function(key, mode, missing) {
8810       return this._addField(key, 'asc', mode, missing);
8811     },
8812 
8813     /**
8814      * Sorts the results in descending order by the given key and options.
8815      *
8816      * @param {String} key The key to order by.
8817      * @param {String} mode The sort mode, default is 'avg', you can choose
8818      *                  'max' or 'min' too.
8819      * @param {String} missing The missing key behaviour, default is 'last',
8820      *                  you can choose 'first' too.
8821      * @return {AV.SearchSortBuilder} Returns the builder, so you can chain this call.
8822      */
8823     descending: function(key, mode, missing) {
8824       return this._addField(key, 'desc', mode, missing);
8825     },
8826 
8827     /**
8828      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
8829      * values near the point given.
8830      * @param {String} key The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
8831      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
8832      * @param {Object} options The other options such as mode,order, unit etc.
8833      * @return {AV.SearchSortBuilder} Returns the builder, so you can chain this call.
8834      */
8835     whereNear: function(key, point, options) {
8836       options = options || {};
8837       var field = {};
8838       var geo = {
8839         lat: point.latitude,
