8840         lon: point.longitude
8841       };
8842       var m = {
8843         order: options.order || 'asc',
8844         mode: options.mode || 'avg',
8845         unit: options.unit || 'km'
8846       };
8847       m[key] = geo;
8848       field['_geo_distance'] = m;
8849 
8850       this._sortFields.push(field);
8851       return this;
8852     },
8853 
8854     /**
8855      * Build a sort string by configuration.
8856      * @return {String} the sort string.
8857      */
8858     build: function() {
8859       return JSON.stringify(AV._encode(this._sortFields));
8860     }
8861   };
8862 
8863   /**
8864    * App searching query.Use just like AV.Query:
8865    * <pre><code>
8866    *   var query = new AV.SearchQuery('Player');
8867    *   query.queryString('*');
8868    *   query.find().then(function(results) {
8869    *     console.log('Found %d objects', query.hits());
8870    *     //Process results
8871    *   });
8872    *
8873    * </code></pre>
8874    * Visite <a href='https://leancloud.cn/docs/app_search_guide.html'>App Searching Guide</a>
8875    * for more details.
8876    * @class
8877    * @since 0.5.1
8878    *
8879    */
8880   AV.SearchQuery = AV.Query._extend(/** @lends AV.SearchQuery.prototype */{
8881      _sid: null,
8882      _hits:  0,
8883      _queryString: null,
8884      _highlights: null,
8885      _sortBuilder: null,
8886     _createRequest: function(params){
8887       return AV._request("search/select", null, null, "GET",
8888                                    params || this.toJSON());
8889     },
8890 
8891     /**
8892      * Sets the sid of app searching query.Default is null.
8893      * @param {String} sid  Scroll id for searching.
8894      * @return {AV.SearchQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8895      */
8896     sid: function(sid) {
8897       this._sid = sid;
8898       return this;
8899     },
8900 
8901     /**
8902      * Sets the query string of app searching.
8903      * @param {String} q  The query string.
8904      * @return {AV.SearchQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8905      */
8906     queryString: function(q) {
8907       this._queryString = q;
8908       return this;
8909     },
8910 
8911 
8912     /**
8913      * Sets the highlight fields. Such as
8914      * <pre><code>
8915      *   query.highlights('title');
8916      *   //or pass an array.
8917      *   query.highlights(['title', 'content'])
8918      * </code></pre>
8919      * @param {Array} highlights a list of fields.
8920      * @return {AV.SearchQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8921      */
8922     highlights: function(highlights) {
8923       var objects;
8924       if (highlights && _.isString(highlights)) {
8925         objects = arguments;
8926       } else {
8927         objects = highlights;
8928       }
8929       this._highlights = objects;
8930       return this;
8931     },
8932 
8933     /**
8934      * Sets the sort builder for this query.
8935      * @see AV.SearchSortBuilder
8936      * @param { AV.SearchSortBuilder} builder The sort builder.
8937      * @return {AV.SearchQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
8938      *
8939      */
8940     sortBy: function(builder) {
8941       this._sortBuilder = builder;
8942       return this;
8943     },
8944 
8945     /**
8946      * Returns the number of objects that match this query.
8947      * @return {Number}
8948      */
8949     hits: function() {
8950        if (!this._hits) {
8951         this._hits = 0;
8952       }
8953       return this._hits;
8954     },
8955 
8956     _processResult: function(json){
8957        delete json['className'];
8958        delete json['_app_url'];
8959        delete json['_deeplink'];
8960        return json;
8961     },
8962 
8963     /**
8964      * Retrieves a list of AVObjects that satisfy this query.
8965      * Either options.success or options.error is called when the find
8966      * completes.
8967      *
8968      * @see AV.Query#find
8969      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
8970      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the results when
8971      * the query completes.
8972      */
8973     find: function(options) {
8974       var self = this;
8975 
8976       var request = this._createRequest();
8977 
8978       return request.then(function(response) {
8979         //update sid for next querying.
8980         if(response.sid) {
8981           self._oldSid = self._sid;
8982           self._sid = response.sid;
8983         }
8984         self._hits = response.hits || 0;
8985 
8986         return _.map(response.results, function(json) {
8987           if(json.className) {
8988             response.className = json.className;
8989           }
8990           var obj = self._newObject(response);
8991           obj.appURL = json['_app_url'];
8992           obj._finishFetch(self._processResult(json), true);
8993           return obj;
8994         });
8995       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
8996     },
8997 
8998     toJSON: function(){
8999       var params = AV.SearchQuery.__super__.toJSON.call(this);
9000       delete params.where;
9001       if(this.className) {
9002         params.clazz = this.className;
9003       }
9004       if(this._sid) {
9005         params.sid = this._sid;
9006       }
9007       if(!this._queryString) {
9008         throw 'Please set query string.';
9009       } else {
9010         params.q = this._queryString;
9011       }
9012       if(this._highlights) {
9013         params.highlights = this._highlights.join(',');
9014       }
9015       if(this._sortBuilder && params.order) {
9016         throw 'sort and order can not be set at same time.';
9017       }
9018       if(this._sortBuilder) {
9019         params.sort = this._sortBuilder.build();
9020       }
9021 
9022       return params;
9023     }
9024   });
9025 })(this);
9026 
9027 /*global FB: false , console: false*/
9028 (function(root) {
9029   root.AV = root.AV || {};
9030   var AV = root.AV;
9031   var _ = AV._;
9032 
9033   var PUBLIC_KEY = "*";
9034 
9035   var initialized = false;
9036   var requestedPermissions;
9037   var initOptions;
9038   var provider = {
9039     authenticate: function(options) {
9040       var self = this;
9041       FB.login(function(response) {
9042         if (response.authResponse) {
9043           if (options.success) {
9044             options.success(self, {
9045               id: response.authResponse.userID,
9046               access_token: response.authResponse.accessToken,
9047               expiration_date: new Date(response.authResponse.expiresIn * 1000 +
9048                   (new Date()).getTime()).toJSON()
9049             });
9050           }
9051         } else {
9052           if (options.error) {
9053             options.error(self, response);
9054           }
9055         }
9056       }, {
9057         scope: requestedPermissions
9058       });
9059     },
9060     restoreAuthentication: function(authData) {
9061       if (authData) {
9062         var authResponse = {
9063           userID: authData.id,
9064           accessToken: authData.access_token,
9065           expiresIn: (AV._parseDate(authData.expiration_date).getTime() -
9066               (new Date()).getTime()) / 1000
9067         };
9068         var newOptions = _.clone(initOptions);
9069         newOptions.authResponse = authResponse;
9070 
9071         // Suppress checks for login status from the browser.
9072         newOptions.status = false;
9073         FB.init(newOptions);
9074       }
9075       return true;
9076     },
9077     getAuthType: function() {
9078       return "facebook";
9079     },
9080     deauthenticate: function() {
9081       this.restoreAuthentication(null);
9082       FB.logout();
9083     }
9084   };
9085 
9086   /**
9087    * Provides a set of utilities for using AV with Facebook.
9088    * @namespace
9089    * Provides a set of utilities for using AV with Facebook.
9090    */
9091   AV.FacebookUtils = {
9092     /**
9093      * Initializes AV Facebook integration.  Call this function after you
9094      * have loaded the Facebook Javascript SDK with the same parameters
9095      * as you would pass to<code>
9096      * <a href=
9097      * "https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/javascript/FB.init/">
9098      * FB.init()</a></code>.  AV.FacebookUtils will invoke FB.init() for you
9099      * with these arguments.
9100      *
9101      * @param {Object} options Facebook options argument as described here:
9102      *   <a href=
9103      *   "https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/javascript/FB.init/">
9104      *   FB.init()</a>. The status flag will be coerced to 'false' because it
9105      *   interferes with AV Facebook integration. Call FB.getLoginStatus()
9106      *   explicitly if this behavior is required by your application.
9107      */
9108     init: function(options) {
9109       if (typeof(FB) === 'undefined') {
9110         throw "The Facebook JavaScript SDK must be loaded before calling init.";
9111       }
9112       initOptions = _.clone(options) || {};
9113       if (initOptions.status && typeof(console) !== "undefined") {
9114         var warn = console.warn || console.log || function() {};
9115         warn.call(console, "The 'status' flag passed into" +
9116           " FB.init, when set to true, can interfere with AV Facebook" +
9117           " integration, so it has been suppressed. Please call" +
9118           " FB.getLoginStatus() explicitly if you require this behavior.");
9119       }
9120       initOptions.status = false;
9121       FB.init(initOptions);
9122       AV.User._registerAuthenticationProvider(provider);
9123       initialized = true;
9124     },
9125 
9126     /**
9127      * Gets whether the user has their account linked to Facebook.
9128      *
9129      * @param {AV.User} user User to check for a facebook link.
9130      *     The user must be logged in on this device.
9131      * @return {Boolean} <code>true</code> if the user has their account
9132      *     linked to Facebook.
9133      */
9134     isLinked: function(user) {
9135       return user._isLinked("facebook");
9136     },
9137 
9138     /**
9139      * Logs in a user using Facebook. This method delegates to the Facebook
9140      * SDK to authenticate the user, and then automatically logs in (or
9141      * creates, in the case where it is a new user) a AV.User.
9142      *
9143      * @param {String, Object} permissions The permissions required for Facebook
9144      *    log in.  This is a comma-separated string of permissions.
9145      *    Alternatively, supply a Facebook authData object as described in our
9146      *    REST API docs if you want to handle getting facebook auth tokens
9147      *    yourself.
9148      * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
9149      *    callbacks.
9150      */
9151     logIn: function(permissions, options) {
9152       if (!permissions || _.isString(permissions)) {
9153         if (!initialized) {
9154           throw "You must initialize FacebookUtils before calling logIn.";
9155         }
9156         requestedPermissions = permissions;
9157         return AV.User._logInWith("facebook", options);
9158       } else {
9159         var newOptions = _.clone(options) || {};
9160         newOptions.authData = permissions;
9161         return AV.User._logInWith("facebook", newOptions);
9162       }
9163     },
9164 
9165     /**
9166      * Links Facebook to an existing PFUser. This method delegates to the
9167      * Facebook SDK to authenticate the user, and then automatically links
9168      * the account to the AV.User.
9169      *
9170      * @param {AV.User} user User to link to Facebook. This must be the
9171      *     current user.
9172      * @param {String, Object} permissions The permissions required for Facebook
9173      *    log in.  This is a comma-separated string of permissions.
9174      *    Alternatively, supply a Facebook authData object as described in our
9175      *    REST API docs if you want to handle getting facebook auth tokens
9176      *    yourself.
9177      * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
9178      *    callbacks.
9179      */
9180     link: function(user, permissions, options) {
9181       if (!permissions || _.isString(permissions)) {
9182         if (!initialized) {
9183           throw "You must initialize FacebookUtils before calling link.";
9184         }
9185         requestedPermissions = permissions;
9186         return user._linkWith("facebook", options);
9187       } else {
9188         var newOptions = _.clone(options) || {};
9189         newOptions.authData = permissions;
9190         return user._linkWith("facebook", newOptions);
9191       }
9192     },
9193 
9194     /**
9195      * Unlinks the AV.User from a Facebook account.
9196      *
9197      * @param {AV.User} user User to unlink from Facebook. This must be the
9198      *     current user.
9199      * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
9200      *    callbacks.
9201      */
9202     unlink: function(user, options) {
9203       if (!initialized) {
9204         throw "You must initialize FacebookUtils before calling unlink.";
9205       }
9206       return user._unlinkFrom("facebook", options);
9207     }
9208   };
9209 
9210 }(this));
9211 
9212 /*global _: false, document: false, window: false, navigator: false */
9213 (function(root) {
9214   root.AV = root.AV || {};
9215   var AV = root.AV;
9216   var _ = AV._;
9217 
9218   /**
9219    * History serves as a global router (per frame) to handle hashchange
9220    * events or pushState, match the appropriate route, and trigger
9221    * callbacks. You shouldn't ever have to create one of these yourself
9222    *  you should use the reference to <code>AV.history</code>
9223    * that will be created for you automatically if you make use of
9224    * Routers with routes.
9225    * @class
9226    *
9227    * <p>A fork of Backbone.History, provided for your convenience.  If you
9228    * use this class, you must also include jQuery, or another library
9229    * that provides a jQuery-compatible $ function.  For more information,
9230    * see the <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#History">
9231    * Backbone documentation</a>.</p>
9232    * <p><strong><em>Available in the client SDK only.</em></strong></p>
9233    */
9234   AV.History = function() {
9235     this.handlers = [];
9236     _.bindAll(this, 'checkUrl');
9237   };
9238 
9239   // Cached regex for cleaning leading hashes and slashes .
9240   var routeStripper = /^[#\/]/;
9241 
9242   // Cached regex for detecting MSIE.
9243   var isExplorer = /msie [\w.]+/;
9244 
9245   // Has the history handling already been started?
9246   AV.History.started = false;
9247 
9248   // Set up all inheritable **AV.History** properties and methods.
9249   _.extend(AV.History.prototype, AV.Events,
9250            /** @lends AV.History.prototype */ {
9251 
9252     // The default interval to poll for hash changes, if necessary, is
9253     // twenty times a second.
9254     interval: 50,
9255 
9256     // Gets the true hash value. Cannot use location.hash directly due to bug
9257     // in Firefox where location.hash will always be decoded.
9258     getHash: function(windowOverride) {
9259       var loc = windowOverride ? windowOverride.location : window.location;
9260       var match = loc.href.match(/#(.*)$/);
9261       return match ? match[1] : '';
9262     },
9263 
9264     // Get the cross-browser normalized URL fragment, either from the URL,
9265     // the hash, or the override.
9266     getFragment: function(fragment, forcePushState) {
9267       if (AV._isNullOrUndefined(fragment)) {
9268         if (this._hasPushState || forcePushState) {
9269           fragment = window.location.pathname;
9270           var search = window.location.search;
9271           if (search) {
9272             fragment += search;
9273           }
9274         } else {
9275           fragment = this.getHash();
9276         }
9277       }
9278       if (!fragment.indexOf(this.options.root)) {
9279         fragment = fragment.substr(this.options.root.length);
9280       }
9281       return fragment.replace(routeStripper, '');
9282     },
9283 
9284     /**
9285      * Start the hash change handling, returning `true` if the current
9286      * URL matches an existing route, and `false` otherwise.
9287      */
9288     start: function(options) {
9289       if (AV.History.started) {
9290         throw new Error("AV.history has already been started");
9291       }
9292       AV.History.started = true;
9293 
9294       // Figure out the initial configuration. Do we need an iframe?
9295       // Is pushState desired ... is it available?
9296       this.options = _.extend({}, {root: '/'}, this.options, options);
9297       this._wantsHashChange = this.options.hashChange !== false;
9298       this._wantsPushState = !!this.options.pushState;
9299       this._hasPushState = !!(this.options.pushState &&
9300                               window.history &&
9301                               window.history.pushState);
9302       var fragment = this.getFragment();
9303       var docMode = document.documentMode;
9304       var oldIE = (isExplorer.exec(navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase()) &&
9305                    (!docMode || docMode <= 7));
9306 
9307       if (oldIE) {
9308         this.iframe = AV.$('<iframe src="javascript:0" tabindex="-1" />')
9309                       .hide().appendTo('body')[0].contentWindow;
9310         this.navigate(fragment);
9311       }
9312 
9313       // Depending on whether we're using pushState or hashes, and whether
9314       // 'onhashchange' is supported, determine how we check the URL state.
9315       if (this._hasPushState) {
9316         AV.$(window).bind('popstate', this.checkUrl);
9317       } else if (this._wantsHashChange &&
9318                  ('onhashchange' in window) &&
9319                  !oldIE) {
9320         AV.$(window).bind('hashchange', this.checkUrl);
9321       } else if (this._wantsHashChange) {
9322         this._checkUrlInterval = window.setInterval(this.checkUrl,
9323                                                     this.interval);
9324       }
9325 
9326       // Determine if we need to change the base url, for a pushState link
9327       // opened by a non-pushState browser.
9328       this.fragment = fragment;
9329       var loc = window.location;
9330       var atRoot  = loc.pathname === this.options.root;
9331 
9332       // If we've started off with a route from a `pushState`-enabled browser,
9333       // but we're currently in a browser that doesn't support it...
9334       if (this._wantsHashChange &&
9335           this._wantsPushState &&
9336           !this._hasPushState &&
9337           !atRoot) {
9338         this.fragment = this.getFragment(null, true);
9339         window.location.replace(this.options.root + '#' + this.fragment);
9340         // Return immediately as browser will do redirect to new url
9341         return true;
9342 
9343       // Or if we've started out with a hash-based route, but we're currently
9344       // in a browser where it could be `pushState`-based instead...
9345       } else if (this._wantsPushState &&
9346                  this._hasPushState &&
9347                  atRoot &&
9348                  loc.hash) {
9349         this.fragment = this.getHash().replace(routeStripper, '');
9350         window.history.replaceState({}, document.title,
9351             loc.protocol + '//' + loc.host + this.options.root + this.fragment);
9352       }
9353 
9354       if (!this.options.silent) {
9355         return this.loadUrl();
9356       }
9357     },
9358 
9359     // Disable AV.history, perhaps temporarily. Not useful in a real app,
9360     // but possibly useful for unit testing Routers.
9361     stop: function() {
9362       AV.$(window).unbind('popstate', this.checkUrl)
9363                      .unbind('hashchange', this.checkUrl);
9364       window.clearInterval(this._checkUrlInterval);
9365       AV.History.started = false;
9366     },
9367 
9368     // Add a route to be tested when the fragment changes. Routes added later
9369     // may override previous routes.
9370     route: function(route, callback) {
9371       this.handlers.unshift({route: route, callback: callback});
9372     },
9373 
9374     // Checks the current URL to see if it has changed, and if it has,
9375     // calls `loadUrl`, normalizing across the hidden iframe.
9376     checkUrl: function(e) {
9377       var current = this.getFragment();
9378       if (current === this.fragment && this.iframe) {
9379         current = this.getFragment(this.getHash(this.iframe));
9380       }
9381       if (current === this.fragment) {
9382         return false;
9383       }
9384       if (this.iframe) {
9385         this.navigate(current);
9386       }
9387       if (!this.loadUrl()) {
9388         this.loadUrl(this.getHash());
9389       }
9390     },
9391 
9392     // Attempt to load the current URL fragment. If a route succeeds with a
9393     // match, returns `true`. If no defined routes matches the fragment,
9394     // returns `false`.
9395     loadUrl: function(fragmentOverride) {
9396       var fragment = this.fragment = this.getFragment(fragmentOverride);
9397       var matched = _.any(this.handlers, function(handler) {
9398         if (handler.route.test(fragment)) {
9399           handler.callback(fragment);
9400           return true;
9401         }
9402       });
9403       return matched;
9404     },
9405 
9406     // Save a fragment into the hash history, or replace the URL state if the
9407     // 'replace' option is passed. You are responsible for properly URL-encoding
9408     // the fragment in advance.
9409     //
9410     // The options object can contain `trigger: true` if you wish to have the
9411     // route callback be fired (not usually desirable), or `replace: true`, if
9412     // you wish to modify the current URL without adding an entry to the
9413     // history.
9414     navigate: function(fragment, options) {
9415       if (!AV.History.started) {
9416         return false;
9417       }
9418       if (!options || options === true) {
9419         options = {trigger: options};
9420       }
9421       var frag = (fragment || '').replace(routeStripper, '');
9422       if (this.fragment === frag) {
9423         return;
9424       }
9425 
9426       // If pushState is available, we use it to set the fragment as a real URL.
9427       if (this._hasPushState) {
9428         if (frag.indexOf(this.options.root) !== 0) {
9429           frag = this.options.root + frag;
9430         }
9431         this.fragment = frag;
9432         var replaceOrPush = options.replace ? 'replaceState' : 'pushState';
9433         window.history[replaceOrPush]({}, document.title, frag);
9434 
9435       // If hash changes haven't been explicitly disabled, update the hash
9436       // fragment to store history.
9437       } else if (this._wantsHashChange) {
9438         this.fragment = frag;
9439         this._updateHash(window.location, frag, options.replace);
9440         if (this.iframe &&
9441             (frag !== this.getFragment(this.getHash(this.iframe)))) {
9442           // Opening and closing the iframe tricks IE7 and earlier
9443           // to push a history entry on hash-tag change.
9444           // When replace is true, we don't want this.
9445           if (!options.replace) {
9446             this.iframe.document.open().close();
9447           }
9448           this._updateHash(this.iframe.location, frag, options.replace);
9449         }
9450 
9451       // If you've told us that you explicitly don't want fallback hashchange-
9452       // based history, then `navigate` becomes a page refresh.
9453       } else {
9454         window.location.assign(this.options.root + fragment);
9455       }
9456       if (options.trigger) {
9457         this.loadUrl(fragment);
9458       }
9459     },
9460 
9461     // Update the hash location, either replacing the current entry, or adding
9462     // a new one to the browser history.
9463     _updateHash: function(location, fragment, replace) {
9464       if (replace) {
9465         var s = location.toString().replace(/(javascript:|#).*$/, '');
9466         location.replace(s + '#' + fragment);
9467       } else {
9468         location.hash = fragment;
9469       }
9470     }
9471   });
9472 }(this));
9473 
9474 /*global _: false*/
9475 (function(root) {
9476   root.AV = root.AV || {};
9477   var AV = root.AV;
9478   var _ = AV._;
9479 
9480   /**
9481    * Routers map faux-URLs to actions, and fire events when routes are
9482    * matched. Creating a new one sets its `routes` hash, if not set statically.
9483    * @class
9484    *
9485    * <p>A fork of Backbone.Router, provided for your convenience.
9486    * For more information, see the
9487    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#Router">Backbone
9488    * documentation</a>.</p>
9489    * <p><strong><em>Available in the client SDK only.</em></strong></p>
9490    */
9491   AV.Router = function(options) {
9492     options = options || {};
9493     if (options.routes) {
9494       this.routes = options.routes;
9495     }
9496     this._bindRoutes();
9497     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
9498   };
9499 
9500   // Cached regular expressions for matching named param parts and splatted
9501   // parts of route strings.
9502   var namedParam    = /:\w+/g;
9503   var splatParam    = /\*\w+/g;
9504   var escapeRegExp  = /[\-\[\]{}()+?.,\\\^\$\|#\s]/g;
9505 
9506   // Set up all inheritable **AV.Router** properties and methods.
9507   _.extend(AV.Router.prototype, AV.Events,
9508            /** @lends AV.Router.prototype */ {
9509 
9510     /**
9511      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
9512      * initialization logic.
9513      */
9514     initialize: function(){},
9515 
9516     /**
9517      * Manually bind a single named route to a callback. For example:
9518      *
9519      * <pre>this.route('search/:query/p:num', 'search', function(query, num) {
9520      *       ...
9521      *     });</pre>
9522      */
9523     route: function(route, name, callback) {
9524       AV.history = AV.history || new AV.History();
9525       if (!_.isRegExp(route)) {
9526         route = this._routeToRegExp(route);
9527       }
9528       if (!callback) {
9529         callback = this[name];
9530       }
9531       AV.history.route(route, _.bind(function(fragment) {
9532         var args = this._extractParameters(route, fragment);
9533         if (callback) {
9534           callback.apply(this, args);
9535         }
9536         this.trigger.apply(this, ['route:' + name].concat(args));
9537         AV.history.trigger('route', this, name, args);
9538       }, this));
9539       return this;
9540     },
9541 
9542     /**
9543      * Whenever you reach a point in your application that you'd
9544      * like to save as a URL, call navigate in order to update the
9545      * URL. If you wish to also call the route function, set the
9546      * trigger option to true. To update the URL without creating
9547      * an entry in the browser's history, set the replace option
9548      * to true.
9549      */
9550     navigate: function(fragment, options) {
9551       AV.history.navigate(fragment, options);
9552     },
9553 
9554     // Bind all defined routes to `AV.history`. We have to reverse the
9555     // order of the routes here to support behavior where the most general
9556     // routes can be defined at the bottom of the route map.
9557     _bindRoutes: function() {
9558       if (!this.routes) {
9559         return;
9560       }
9561       var routes = [];
9562       for (var route in this.routes) {
9563         if (this.routes.hasOwnProperty(route)) {
9564           routes.unshift([route, this.routes[route]]);
9565         }
9566       }
9567       for (var i = 0, l = routes.length; i < l; i++) {
9568         this.route(routes[i][0], routes[i][1], this[routes[i][1]]);
9569       }
9570     },
9571 
9572     // Convert a route string into a regular expression, suitable for matching
9573     // against the current location hash.
9574     _routeToRegExp: function(route) {
9575       route = route.replace(escapeRegExp, '\\$&')
9576                    .replace(namedParam, '([^\/]+)')
9577                    .replace(splatParam, '(.*?)');
9578       return new RegExp('^' + route + '$');
9579     },
9580 
9581     // Given a route, and a URL fragment that it matches, return the array of
9582     // extracted parameters.
9583     _extractParameters: function(route, fragment) {
9584       return route.exec(fragment).slice(1);
9585     }
9586   });
9587 
9588   /**
9589    * @function
9590    * @param {Object} instanceProps Instance properties for the router.
9591    * @param {Object} classProps Class properies for the router.
9592    * @return {Class} A new subclass of <code>AV.Router</code>.
9593    */
9594   AV.Router.extend = AV._extend;
9595 }(this));
9596 
9597 /*global _: false */
9598 (function(root) {
9599   root.AV = root.AV || {};
9600   var AV = root.AV;
9601   var _ = AV._;
9602 
9603   /**
9604    * Creates a new instance with the given models and options.  Typically, you
9605    * will not call this method directly, but will instead make a subclass using
9606    * <code>AV.Collection.extend</code>.
9607    *
9608    * @param {Array} models An array of instances of <code>AV.Object</code>.
9609    *
9610    * @param {Object} options An optional object with Backbone-style options.
9611    * Valid options are:<ul>
9612    *   <li>model: The AV.Object subclass that this collection contains.
9613    *   <li>query: An instance of AV.Query to use when fetching items.
9614    *   <li>comparator: A string property name or function to sort by.
9615    * </ul>
9616    *
9617    * @see AV.Collection.extend
9618    *
9619    * @class
9620    *
9621    * <p>Provides a standard collection class for our sets of models, ordered
9622    * or unordered.  For more information, see the
9623    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#Collection">Backbone
9624    * documentation</a>.</p>
9625    */
9626   AV.Collection = function(models, options) {
9627     options = options || {};
9628     if (options.comparator) {
9629       this.comparator = options.comparator;
9630     }
9631     if (options.model) {
9632       this.model = options.model;
9633     }
9634     if (options.query) {
9635       this.query = options.query;
9636     }
9637     this._reset();
9638     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
9639     if (models) {
9640       this.reset(models, {silent: true, parse: options.parse});
9641     }
9642   };
9643 
9644   // Define the Collection's inheritable methods.
9645   _.extend(AV.Collection.prototype, AV.Events,
9646       /** @lends AV.Collection.prototype */ {
9647 
9648     // The default model for a collection is just a AV.Object.
9649     // This should be overridden in most cases.
9650 
9651     model: AV.Object,
9652 
9653     /**
9654      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
9655      * initialization logic.
9656      */
9657     initialize: function(){},
9658 
9659     /**
9660      * The JSON representation of a Collection is an array of the
9661      * models' attributes.
9662      */
9663     toJSON: function() {
9664       return this.map(function(model){ return model.toJSON(); });
9665     },
9666 
9667     /**
9668      * Add a model, or list of models to the set. Pass **silent** to avoid
9669      * firing the `add` event for every new model.
9670      */
9671     add: function(models, options) {
9672       var i, index, length, model, cid, id, cids = {}, ids = {};
9673       options = options || {};
9674       models = _.isArray(models) ? models.slice() : [models];
9675 
9676       // Begin by turning bare objects into model references, and preventing
9677       // invalid models or duplicate models from being added.
9678       for (i = 0, length = models.length; i < length; i++) {
9679         models[i] = this._prepareModel(models[i], options);
9680         model = models[i];
9681         if (!model) {
9682           throw new Error("Can't add an invalid model to a collection");
9683         }
9684         cid = model.cid;
9685         if (cids[cid] || this._byCid[cid]) {
9686           throw new Error("Duplicate cid: can't add the same model " +
9687                           "to a collection twice");
9688         }
9689         id = model.id;
9690         if (!AV._isNullOrUndefined(id) && (ids[id] || this._byId[id])) {
9691           throw new Error("Duplicate id: can't add the same model " +
9692                           "to a collection twice");
9693         }
9694         ids[id] = model;
9695         cids[cid] = model;
9696       }
9697 
9698       // Listen to added models' events, and index models for lookup by
9699       // `id` and by `cid`.
9700       for (i = 0; i < length; i++) {
9701         (model = models[i]).on('all', this._onModelEvent, this);
9702         this._byCid[model.cid] = model;
9703         if (model.id) {
9704           this._byId[model.id] = model;
9705         }
9706       }
9707 
9708       // Insert models into the collection, re-sorting if needed, and triggering
9709       // `add` events unless silenced.
9710       this.length += length;
9711       index = AV._isNullOrUndefined(options.at) ?
9712           this.models.length : options.at;
9713       this.models.splice.apply(this.models, [index, 0].concat(models));
9714       if (this.comparator) {
9715         this.sort({silent: true});
9716       }
9717       if (options.silent) {
9718         return this;
9719       }
9720       for (i = 0, length = this.models.length; i < length; i++) {
9721         model = this.models[i];
9722         if (cids[model.cid]) {
9723           options.index = i;
9724           model.trigger('add', model, this, options);
9725         }
9726       }
9727       return this;
9728     },
9729 
9730     /**
9731      * Remove a model, or a list of models from the set. Pass silent to avoid
9732      * firing the <code>remove</code> event for every model removed.
9733      */
9734     remove: function(models, options) {
9735       var i, l, index, model;
9736       options = options || {};
9737       models = _.isArray(models) ? models.slice() : [models];
9738       for (i = 0, l = models.length; i < l; i++) {
9739         model = this.getByCid(models[i]) || this.get(models[i]);
9740         if (!model) {
9741           continue;
9742         }
9743         delete this._byId[model.id];
9744         delete this._byCid[model.cid];
9745         index = this.indexOf(model);
9746         this.models.splice(index, 1);
9747         this.length--;
9748         if (!options.silent) {
9749           options.index = index;
9750           model.trigger('remove', model, this, options);
9751         }
9752         this._removeReference(model);
9753       }
9754       return this;
9755     },
9756 
9757     /**
9758      * Gets a model from the set by id.
9759      */
9760     get: function(id) {
9761       return id && this._byId[id.id || id];
9762     },
9763 
9764     /**
9765      * Gets a model from the set by client id.
9766      */
9767     getByCid: function(cid) {
9768       return cid && this._byCid[cid.cid || cid];
9769     },
9770 
9771     /**
9772      * Gets the model at the given index.
9773      */
9774     at: function(index) {
9775       return this.models[index];
9776     },
9777 
9778     /**
9779      * Forces the collection to re-sort itself. You don't need to call this
9780      * under normal circumstances, as the set will maintain sort order as each
9781      * item is added.
9782      */
9783     sort: function(options) {
9784       options = options || {};
9785       if (!this.comparator) {
9786         throw new Error('Cannot sort a set without a comparator');
9787       }
9788       var boundComparator = _.bind(this.comparator, this);
9789       if (this.comparator.length === 1) {
9790         this.models = this.sortBy(boundComparator);
9791       } else {
9792         this.models.sort(boundComparator);
9793       }
9794       if (!options.silent) {
9795         this.trigger('reset', this, options);
9796       }
9797       return this;
9798     },
9799 
9800     /**
9801      * Plucks an attribute from each model in the collection.
9802      */
9803     pluck: function(attr) {
9804       return _.map(this.models, function(model){ return model.get(attr); });
9805     },
9806 
9807     /**
9808      * When you have more items than you want to add or remove individually,
9809      * you can reset the entire set with a new list of models, without firing
9810      * any `add` or `remove` events. Fires `reset` when finished.
9811      */
9812     reset: function(models, options) {
9813       var self = this;
9814       models = models || [];
9815       options = options || {};
9816       AV._arrayEach(this.models, function(model) {
9817         self._removeReference(model);
9818       });
9819       this._reset();
9820       this.add(models, {silent: true, parse: options.parse});
9821       if (!options.silent) {
9822         this.trigger('reset', this, options);
9823       }
9824       return this;
9825     },
9826 
9827     /**
9828      * Fetches the default set of models for this collection, resetting the
9829      * collection when they arrive. If `add: true` is passed, appends the
9830      * models to the collection instead of resetting.
9831      */
9832     fetch: function(options) {
9833       options = _.clone(options) || {};
9834       if (options.parse === undefined) {
9835         options.parse = true;
9836       }
9837       var collection = this;
9838       var query = this.query || new AV.Query(this.model);
9839       return query.find().then(function(results) {
9840         if (options.add) {
9841           collection.add(results, options);
9842         } else {
9843           collection.reset(results, options);
9844         }
9845         return collection;
9846       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
9847     },
9848 
9849     /**
9850      * Creates a new instance of a model in this collection. Add the model to
9851      * the collection immediately, unless `wait: true` is passed, in which case
9852      * we wait for the server to agree.
9853      */
9854     create: function(model, options) {
9855       var coll = this;
9856       options = options ? _.clone(options) : {};
9857       model = this._prepareModel(model, options);
9858       if (!model) {
9859         return false;
9860       }
9861       if (!options.wait) {
9862         coll.add(model, options);
9863       }
9864       var success = options.success;
9865       options.success = function(nextModel, resp, xhr) {
9866         if (options.wait) {
9867           coll.add(nextModel, options);
9868         }
9869         if (success) {
9870           success(nextModel, resp);
9871         } else {
9872           nextModel.trigger('sync', model, resp, options);
9873         }
9874       };
9875       model.save(null, options);
9876       return model;
9877     },
9878 
9879     /**
9880      * Converts a response into a list of models to be added to the collection.
9881      * The default implementation is just to pass it through.
9882      * @ignore
9883      */
9884     parse: function(resp, xhr) {
9885       return resp;
9886     },
9887 
9888     /**
9889      * Proxy to _'s chain. Can't be proxied the same way the rest of the
9890      * underscore methods are proxied because it relies on the underscore
9891      * constructor.
9892      */
9893     chain: function() {
9894       return _(this.models).chain();
9895     },
9896 
9897     /**
9898      * Reset all internal state. Called when the collection is reset.
9899      */
9900     _reset: function(options) {
9901       this.length = 0;
9902       this.models = [];
9903       this._byId  = {};
9904       this._byCid = {};
9905     },
9906 
9907     /**
9908      * Prepare a model or hash of attributes to be added to this collection.
9909      */
9910     _prepareModel: function(model, options) {
9911       if (!(model instanceof AV.Object)) {
9912         var attrs = model;
9913         options.collection = this;
9914         model = new this.model(attrs, options);
9915         if (!model._validate(model.attributes, options)) {
9916           model = false;
9917         }
9918       } else if (!model.collection) {
9919         model.collection = this;
9920       }
9921       return model;
9922     },
9923 
9924     /**
9925      * Internal method to remove a model's ties to a collection.
9926      */
9927     _removeReference: function(model) {
9928       if (this === model.collection) {
9929         delete model.collection;
9930       }
9931       model.off('all', this._onModelEvent, this);
9932     },
9933 
9934     /**
9935      * Internal method called every time a model in the set fires an event.
9936      * Sets need to update their indexes when models change ids. All other
9937      * events simply proxy through. "add" and "remove" events that originate
9938      * in other collections are ignored.
9939      */
9940     _onModelEvent: function(ev, model, collection, options) {
9941       if ((ev === 'add' || ev === 'remove') && collection !== this) {
9942         return;
9943       }
9944       if (ev === 'destroy') {
9945         this.remove(model, options);
9946       }
9947       if (model && ev === 'change:objectId') {
9948         delete this._byId[model.previous("objectId")];
9949         this._byId[model.id] = model;
9950       }
9951       this.trigger.apply(this, arguments);
9952     }
9953 
9954   });
9955 
9956   // Underscore methods that we want to implement on the Collection.
9957   var methods = ['forEach', 'each', 'map', 'reduce', 'reduceRight', 'find',
9958     'detect', 'filter', 'select', 'reject', 'every', 'all', 'some', 'any',
9959     'include', 'contains', 'invoke', 'max', 'min', 'sortBy', 'sortedIndex',
9960     'toArray', 'size', 'first', 'initial', 'rest', 'last', 'without', 'indexOf',
9961     'shuffle', 'lastIndexOf', 'isEmpty', 'groupBy'];
9962 
9963   // Mix in each Underscore method as a proxy to `Collection#models`.
9964   AV._arrayEach(methods, function(method) {
9965     AV.Collection.prototype[method] = function() {
9966       return _[method].apply(_, [this.models].concat(_.toArray(arguments)));
9967     };
9968   });
9969 
9970   /**
9971    * Creates a new subclass of <code>AV.Collection</code>.  For example,<pre>
9972    *   var MyCollection = AV.Collection.extend({
9973    *     // Instance properties
9974    *
9975    *     model: MyClass,
9976    *     query: MyQuery,
9977    *
9978    *     getFirst: function() {
9979    *       return this.at(0);
9980    *     }
9981    *   }, {
9982    *     // Class properties
9983    *
9984    *     makeOne: function() {
9985    *       return new MyCollection();
9986    *     }
9987    *   });
9988    *
9989    *   var collection = new MyCollection();
9990    * </pre>
9991    *
9992    * @function
9993    * @param {Object} instanceProps Instance properties for the collection.
9994    * @param {Object} classProps Class properies for the collection.
9995    * @return {Class} A new subclass of <code>AV.Collection</code>.
9996    */
9997   AV.Collection.extend = AV._extend;
9998 
9999 }(this));
10000 
10001 /*global _: false, document: false */
10002 (function(root) {
10003   root.AV = root.AV || {};
10004   var AV = root.AV;
10005   var _ = AV._;
10006 
10007   /**
10008    * Creating a AV.View creates its initial element outside of the DOM,
10009    * if an existing element is not provided...
10010    * @class
10011    *
10012    * <p>A fork of Backbone.View, provided for your convenience.  If you use this
10013    * class, you must also include jQuery, or another library that provides a
10014    * jQuery-compatible $ function.  For more information, see the
10015    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#View">Backbone
10016    * documentation</a>.</p>
10017    * <p><strong><em>Available in the client SDK only.</em></strong></p>
10018    */
10019   AV.View = function(options) {
10020     this.cid = _.uniqueId('view');
10021     this._configure(options || {});
10022     this._ensureElement();
10023     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
10024     this.delegateEvents();
10025   };
10026 
10027   // Cached regex to split keys for `delegate`.
10028   var eventSplitter = /^(\S+)\s*(.*)$/;
10029 
10030   // List of view options to be merged as properties.
10031 
10032   var viewOptions = ['model', 'collection', 'el', 'id', 'attributes',
10033                      'className', 'tagName'];
10034 
10035   // Set up all inheritable **AV.View** properties and methods.
10036   _.extend(AV.View.prototype, AV.Events,
10037            /** @lends AV.View.prototype */ {
10038 
10039     // The default `tagName` of a View's element is `"div"`.
10040     tagName: 'div',
10041 
10042     /**
10043      * jQuery delegate for element lookup, scoped to DOM elements within the
10044      * current view. This should be prefered to global lookups where possible.
10045      */
10046     $: function(selector) {
10047       return this.$el.find(selector);
10048     },
10049 
10050     /**
10051      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
10052      * initialization logic.
10053      */
10054     initialize: function(){},
10055 
10056     /**
10057      * The core function that your view should override, in order
10058      * to populate its element (`this.el`), with the appropriate HTML. The
10059      * convention is for **render** to always return `this`.
10060      */
10061     render: function() {
10062       return this;
10063     },
10064 
10065     /**
10066      * Remove this view from the DOM. Note that the view isn't present in the
10067      * DOM by default, so calling this method may be a no-op.
10068      */
10069     remove: function() {
10070       this.$el.remove();
10071       return this;
10072     },
10073 
10074     /**
10075      * For small amounts of DOM Elements, where a full-blown template isn't
10076      * needed, use **make** to manufacture elements, one at a time.
10077      * <pre>
10078      *     var el = this.make('li', {'class': 'row'},
10079      *                        this.model.escape('title'));</pre>
10080      */
10081     make: function(tagName, attributes, content) {
10082       var el = document.createElement(tagName);
10083       if (attributes) {
10084         AV.$(el).attr(attributes);
10085       }
10086       if (content) {
10087         AV.$(el).html(content);
10088       }
10089       return el;
10090     },
10091 
10092     /**
10093      * Changes the view's element (`this.el` property), including event
10094      * re-delegation.
10095      */
10096     setElement: function(element, delegate) {
10097       this.$el = AV.$(element);
10098       this.el = this.$el[0];
10099       if (delegate !== false) {
10100         this.delegateEvents();
10101       }
10102       return this;
10103     },
10104 
10105     /**
10106      * Set callbacks.  <code>this.events</code> is a hash of
10107      * <pre>
10108      * *{"event selector": "callback"}*
10109      *
10110      *     {
10111      *       'mousedown .title':  'edit',
10112      *       'click .button':     'save'
10113      *       'click .open':       function(e) { ... }
10114      *     }
10115      * </pre>
10116      * pairs. Callbacks will be bound to the view, with `this` set properly.
10117      * Uses event delegation for efficiency.
10118      * Omitting the selector binds the event to `this.el`.
10119      * This only works for delegate-able events: not `focus`, `blur`, and
10120      * not `change`, `submit`, and `reset` in Internet Explorer.
10121      */
10122     delegateEvents: function(events) {
10123       events = events || AV._getValue(this, 'events');
10124       if (!events) {
10125         return;
10126       }
10127       this.undelegateEvents();
10128       var self = this;
10129       AV._objectEach(events, function(method, key) {
10130         if (!_.isFunction(method)) {
10131           method = self[events[key]];
10132         }
10133         if (!method) {
10134           throw new Error('Event "' + events[key] + '" does not exist');
10135         }
10136         var match = key.match(eventSplitter);
10137         var eventName = match[1], selector = match[2];
10138         method = _.bind(method, self);
10139         eventName += '.delegateEvents' + self.cid;
10140         if (selector === '') {
10141           self.$el.bind(eventName, method);
10142         } else {
10143           self.$el.delegate(selector, eventName, method);
10144         }
10145       });
10146     },
10147 
10148     /**
10149      * Clears all callbacks previously bound to the view with `delegateEvents`.
10150      * You usually don't need to use this, but may wish to if you have multiple
10151      * Backbone views attached to the same DOM element.
10152      */
10153     undelegateEvents: function() {
10154       this.$el.unbind('.delegateEvents' + this.cid);
10155     },
10156 
10157     /**
10158      * Performs the initial configuration of a View with a set of options.
10159      * Keys with special meaning *(model, collection, id, className)*, are
10160      * attached directly to the view.
10161      */
10162     _configure: function(options) {
10163       if (this.options) {
10164         options = _.extend({}, this.options, options);
10165       }
10166       var self = this;
10167       _.each(viewOptions, function(attr) {
10168         if (options[attr]) {
10169           self[attr] = options[attr];
10170         }
10171       });
10172       this.options = options;
10173     },
10174 
10175     /**
10176      * Ensure that the View has a DOM element to render into.
10177      * If `this.el` is a string, pass it through `$()`, take the first
10178      * matching element, and re-assign it to `el`. Otherwise, create
10179      * an element from the `id`, `className` and `tagName` properties.
10180      */
10181     _ensureElement: function() {
10182       if (!this.el) {
10183         var attrs = AV._getValue(this, 'attributes') || {};
10184         if (this.id) {
10185           attrs.id = this.id;
10186         }
10187         if (this.className) {
10188           attrs['class'] = this.className;
10189         }
10190         this.setElement(this.make(this.tagName, attrs), false);
10191       } else {
10192         this.setElement(this.el, false);
10193       }
10194     }
10195 
10196   });
10197 
10198   /**
10199    * @function
10200    * @param {Object} instanceProps Instance properties for the view.
10201    * @param {Object} classProps Class properies for the view.
10202    * @return {Class} A new subclass of <code>AV.View</code>.
10203    */
10204   AV.View.extend = AV._extend;
10205 
10206 }(this));
10207
